Glimpse of many cultural sites such as Pangboche.&lt
Know the culture and tradition of indigenous people at Tengboche&lt

column1: Two clients share one porter. We will supply you with a trek duffel bag where you keep your heavy items and this bag is carried by the porter. You will need to bring your own daypack to be carried by you. In the daypack, you can put money, important documents, water bottle/bladder, camera, toiletries, sunscreen, notebook, etc.

The weight limit for Kathmandu-Lukla-Kathmandu flights is 15 kg or 33 pounds. This is combining both the duffel bag and the daypack. If you exceed this limit, you will have to pay an additional fee. When this happens, sometimes the airline sends your bag in later flights and this can be very problematic for many reasons. You can leave your non-trekking stuff at the locker facility in the Kathmandu hotel.

The Climbing equipments are more expensive to buy. So, please let us know if you want to rent the equipments at the additional cost of USD 250 per person. The Following equipments are essential for climbing Island peak.

column3: 1 pair plastic shell mountaineering boots with high altitude liners&lt
1 Mountaineering an axe with leash (sized properly for your height)&lt
1 Ascender (right or left handed as appropriate)&lt
1 Belay device (Black Diamond ATC or ATC Guide are good options)&lt
1 Pair expedition style gaiters (ensure fit over your boots)&lt
4 seasons Sleeping bag (Optional/we can provide one if you need it but is to be returned after the trek)&lt
Duffel or Rucksack bag or suitcase (We will provide one complimentary ACE duffel bag for you to keep.)&lt
Down Jacket (Optional/we can provide if you need one but is to be returned after the trek)&lt

Shade hat or baseball cap – some people drape a bandana down the back of their head and then put a baseball cap on to hold it is place. This can be a flexible alternative while keeping the sun off your ears and neck.&lt
Warm wool or synthetic hat that cover your ears.&lt

Glacier glasses-100% UV protection with side shields and a hard-sided storage case (i.e. Julbo or Cebe). This is to protect your eyes from the stronger rays of the sun due to the thinner atmosphere which can cause a painful condition known as snow blindness. Regular sunglasses are not sufficient. If you wear prescription glasses, speak to your doctor about prescription glacier glasses, perhaps with transitional lenses.&lt

Headlamp – Black Diamond and Petzl both make several good ones. Make sure to bring extra batteries and that they are lithium batteries so that they will last in the colder temperatures. These are indispensable for getting around at night, reading, etc. so, don’t go cheap here.&lt

column5: a good hat, balaclava, and hooded jacket should really be sufficient, but this is a personal choice for some people (optional).&lt

column3: A neck warmer is another piece of gear for extra warmth if you feel you will need it (optional).&lt
1 pair liner gloves, thin wool or synthetic, useful alone on mild days or as a layer inside other gloves/mitts for additional warmth.&lt
1 pair warm gloves (heavier fleece or wool).&lt

column4: Gore-Tex is preferred for keeping hands dry.&lt

column3: Instant hand warmers are always nice in a pinch, but really shouldn’t be necessary on the trek. Bringing appropriate hand protection as recommended above, should be sufficient (optional).&lt
Light and expedition weight thermal tops.&lt
2 women sports bras, Synthetic, no cotton!&lt
2 pairs nylon hiking shorts – Quick drying type, not cotton!&lt
2 pairs lightweight long underwear – Capilene or other synthetic.&lt
1 pair soft shell pants – synthetic, full zip from top and bottom preferable.&lt
2 pairs trekking pants, preferably that zip on/off at the knees so they double as shorts.&lt

1 pair hard shell pants. Waterproof / breathable, Gore-Tex or equivalent is best. Should zip from the top and bottom – this makes it easier to put on over boots without getting undressed should the weather change once you are underway for the day.&lt
All clothing should be kept dry using waterproof stuff sacks or large puncture resistant plastic bags.&lt
4 pairs of liner socks, synthetic or Capilene.&lt
3 pairs heavy weight socks to be worn over liner socks.&lt
1 pair light weight socks, a good option for the lower / warmer parts of the trail.&lt
1 pair light to medium weight waterproof hiking/trekking boots. Ensure a good fit with layered socks and you have worn them before to get used to it (otherwise you will get lots of blister).&lt
1 pair light trekking shoes or sneakers. Good for around the camp/lodges and in Kathmandu.&lt
1 pair hiking gaiters, good for keeping dust and rocks out of your shoes/boots as well as keep your feet dry as necessary (Optional).&lt

column1: (Please note our guide will also carry the first aid kit bag during the trek. However, we still recommend you to bring your personal first aid kit as well)

column3: Extra Strength Excedrin for altitude related headaches.&lt
Ibuprofen for general aches and pains.&lt
Immodium or Pepto Bismol capsules for upset stomach or diarrhea.&lt
Diamox (commonly prescribed as Acetazolamide) 125 or 250mg tablets for altitude sickness. Please discuss with us before starting to take this medicine.&lt

1 small personal sized first-aid kit with blister treatments such as mole skin, band-aids, some waterproof tape, anti-infection ointments, etc. Your guides will have more extensive medical gear, but you should have the basics for general use.&lt
Passport and extra passport photos (4 copies).&lt
Airline ticket (Please make a copy and leave on at our office in Kathmandu just in case if you need to change the date of your).&lt
Durable wallet/pouch for travel documents, money &amp

Lip balm. At least SPF 20, 2 sticks. A string taped to the stick is helpful, to hang around your neck and some are now being sold with a cord already attached. Handy as it avoids you from having to stop and look for it.&lt
Sunscreen. SPF 40 is recommended and should be relatively new since it loses its’ effectiveness over time.&lt
Pocket knife or small Swiss Army type.&lt
Water purification Iodine tablets or Polar-pure crystals.&lt
Toiletry kit. Be sure to include toilet paper stored in a plastic bag, hand wipes, and liquid hand sanitizer, towel, soap, etc.&lt

column17: s:71:""Fly to Lukla (2804 m) then trek to Phakding (2610 m) – approx 3 hours""
column19: s:48:""Trek to Namche Bazaar (3441m) – approx 5 hours""
column23: s:54:""Trek to Tengboche Monastery (3860m) – approx 5 hours""
column27: s:43:""Trek to Chukung (4710 m) – approx 4 hours""
column29: s:56:""Trek to Island peak base camp (5240m) – approx 4 hours""
column33: s:78:""Summit to Island peak (6187m) then return to Chhukung (4750m)- approx 10 hours""
column37: s:71:""Trek to Namche Bazaar (3441 m) via Khumjung (3780 m) – approx 5 hours""
column48: s:173:""Our representative will be receiving you at Tribhuvan International Airport, Kathmandu. You will be then transferred to your respective hotel in our private tourist vehicle.""
column50: s:1020:""After breakfast, your sightseeing trip will start at 8:45 am in the morning. We provide a private vehicle and professional tour guide. We visit Boudhanath Stupa, one of the biggest Buddhist shrines in the world, where we observe Buddhist monks in prayer in the monasteries surrounding the stupa. After Boudhanath Stupa we visit Pashupatinath, the most famous Hindu temple in the country, located on the banks of the holy Bagmati River. Here we see Hindu holy men (sadhus) meditating, pilgrims bathing and occasionally funeral pyres burning on the ghats. We also visit Bhaktapur Durbar Square, which is a collection of pagoda and shikhara – style temples grouped around a fifty-five window palace of brick and wood. The attraction of the Bhaktapur Durbar Square are the the Lion gate, the Golden gate, the Palace of fifty-five windows, art galleries, the Statue of King Bhupatindra Malla.

column1: The rest of our time in Kathmandu is free for further exploration and some last-minute shopping in Thamel area near your hotel.""
column3: s:681:""An early morning start takes us to Tribhuvan International Airport in Kathmandu for the 35 minutes scenic flight to Tenzing and Hillary Airport in Lukla (2,804 m). Upon arrival at the airport, a guide will meet us and introduce the porters before we begin the 3 hours trek to Phakding (2,610 m).

column1: After landing there will be time to explore the village while our Sherpa crew sort and load the trekking equipment. We then begin our trek by descending towards the Dudh Kosi River where we join the main trail to Namche Bazaar, located just above Chaurikharka (2713 m). The walking is easy and after passing through the small village of Ghat (2550 m), Phakding is just a short walk.""
column3: s:489:""We begin the 5 hours trek along the banks of the Dudh Kosi, crossing this majestic river many times on exciting suspension bridges laden with prayer flags. After entering Sagarmatha National Park, the trail climbs steeply with breathtaking views. Namche Bazaar, known as the “Gateway to Everest,” is home to many quality restaurants, hotels, lodges, shops, money exchange, internet cafe and a bakery. Namche Bazaar (3441 m) is one of the biggest villages along the whole Everest trail.""
column5: s:369:""A day will be spent in Namche in order to adjust to the high altitude. We’ll go on a short trek to a museum celebrating the traditional customs of the Sherpa people. We will also hike up the Syangboche Airport around Everest View Hotel. From this point can be seen rewarding views of the Himalayas with a stunning sunrise and sunset over the panorama of Khumbu peaks.""
column7: s:470:""The trek continues along the rushing glacial waters of the Dudh Kosi, with magnificent views of the mountains. After 5 hours we’ll reach Tengboche, where the local monastery can be seen. Inside the monastery are incredibly ornate wall hangings, a twenty foot sculpture of Buddha, and the musical instruments and robes of the Lamas. The group will be taken to observe a prayer ceremony in either the evening or morning, depending on how the day’s trekking progressed.""
column9: s:317:""From Tengboche, the trail drops to Debuche, crosses suspension bridge on the Imja Khola, and climbs to Pangboche amongst thousands of mani stones. Our uphill trek continues for six hours, taking us to the quaint traditional Sherpa village of Dingboche, with its exquisite views of Lhotse, Island Peak, and Ama Dablam.""
column11: s:243:""From here we have four hours of walking to Chhukung, as it is very important to adjust to the high altitude in order to climb Island Peak. Our guide will provide important information about climbing Island Peak and the next day’s activities.""
column13: s:196:""Today is another short trek of 4 hours to the Island Peak base camp. Starting from today, accommodations will be in tented camps for the next two days, with food prepared by our professional chef.""
column15: s:175:""We will spend a day here in adjusting to the thinning of the air. We’ll also make a short trek around the base camp to prepare us for the 6,000 m adventure tomorrow morning.""
column17: s:381:""Today is our main adventure day. Weather permitting, we’ll start early in the morning for a climb up the Island Peak (6187 m). After Camp 1, we ascend through a gully and traverse to the right. After making our way up a wide stone field, we cross the ridge to the glacier and crevasses. After a safe trip to the top, we make our way back down the same day and return to Chhukung.""
column19: s:151:""Today we follow the same route back down to Tengboche (3860 m). Passing through Dingboche, Pangboche and Diboche, the day’s trek will take six hours.""
column21: s:255:""Leaving the mountains behind, our descent takes us from Tengboche Monastery to the town of Namche Bazaar (3441 m). We arrive back at Namche Bazaar in the afternoon, a 5 hours walk. We’ll enjoy an evening of talking with fellow trekkers over a nice meal.""
column23: s:184:""Finally, we make the 5 hours return to Lukla (2804 m), where the trek began. We’ll take time to reflect on the trek as a group, and on the personal achievements of all who took part.""
column25: s:201:""On the scenic thirty-five minute flight back to Kathmandu, you’ll enjoy a last glimpse of the mountains you have recently climbed. Upon arrival in Kathmandu, we will return to the hotel in Kathmandu.""
column27: s:350:""There’s much to see and do in Kathmandu and the surrounding areas, including Chitwan Jungle Safari, River Rafting Adventure, Kathmandu Shopping Tour or Scenic Everest Flight. This is also a spare day in the event of bad weather in Lukla. In the evening we will have a farewell dinner in a traditional Nepalese restaurant with cultural performances.""
column29: s:149:""This day we will be saying final goodbye. Our representative will escort you to Kathmandu International Airport for your flight departure from Nepal.""

column36: >","Island Peak Nepal(6189m) is commonly called Imja Tse Peak. It is situated in the Khumbu region above Imja Tse Khola. The peak is surrounded by the three glaciers i.e. Imja, Lhotse and Lhotse Shar glaciers. Island Peak is not technically so hard but it offers a worthwhile challenge to the...","Island Peak Nepal (a.k.a Imja Tse) towering at 6,187 meters makes your dream of summiting a Himalayan peak come true and prepares you for bigger giants.",,"a:22:{s:6:""enable""

column1: 543,"Beni Dolpo Trekking","Doplo Region is remote and fascinating. Confined by the Dhaulagiri range in the south and east, the mountains Sisne and Kanjiroba in the west and Tibet towards the north, it showcases the extraordinary untouched beauty of the region. It was popularized by the film “Caravan”.
Lake Phoksundo with its turquoise waters is the major attraction during Dolpo trekking.
[tp-trip name=""22 days Beni Dolpo Trekking"" heading=""h4""][/tp-trip]

column79: s:56:""hotel included breakfast,  3 meals a day during trekking""
column82: s:70:"" march, april, may, june, july, august, september, october, november""

column3: Hidden valley, a land of mystery, scenery and peace.&lt
Yarsha Gumba(Corylopsis sinensis) one of the most expensive herb famous for health benefits is found here.&lt
Six-passes trekking which gives you the countless unmatched himalayan scenic beauty and natural sceneries.&lt
Excellent views of Dhaulagiri Massif, Kanjiroba Peak, and the most admired Shey-Phoksundo Lake.&lt
Dhorpatan Hunting Reserve, the only hunting reserve under Government of Nepal.&lt
4 seasons Sleeping bag (Optional/we can provide one if you need it but is to be returned after the trek)&lt
Duffel or Rucksack bag or suitcase (We will provide one complimentary ACE duffel bag for you to keep.)&lt
Down Jacket (Optional/we can provide if you need one but is to be returned after the trek)&lt

Shade hat or baseball cap – some people drape a bandana down the back of their head and then put a baseball cap on to hold it. This can be a flexible alternative while keeping the sun off your ears and neck.&lt
Warm wool or synthetic hat that cover your ears.&lt

Glacier glasses-100% UV protection with side shields and a hard-sided storage case (i.e. Julbo or Cebe). This is to protect your eyes from the stronger rays of the sun due to the thinner atmosphere which can cause a painful condition known as snow blindness. Regular sunglasses are not sufficient. If you wear prescription glasses, speak to your doctor about prescription glacier glasses, perhaps with transitional lenses.&lt

Headlamp – Black Diamond and Petzl both make several good ones. Make sure to bring extra batteries and that they are lithium batteries so that they will last in the colder temperatures. These are indispensable for getting around at night, reading, etc. so, don’t go cheap here.&lt

column5: a good hat, balaclava, and hooded jacket should really be sufficient, but this is a personal choice for some people (optional).&lt

column3: A neck warmer is another piece of gear for extra warmth if you feel you will need it (optional).&lt
1 pair liner gloves, thin wool or synthetic, useful alone on mild days or as a layer inside other gloves/mitts for additional warmth.&lt
1 pair warm gloves (heavier fleece or wool).&lt

column4: Gore-Tex is preferred for keeping hands dry.&lt

column3: Instant hand warmers are always nice in a pinch, but really shouldn’t be necessary on the trek. Bringing appropriate hand protection as recommended above, should be sufficient (optional).&lt
Light and expedition weight thermal tops.&lt
2 women sports bras, Synthetic, no cotton!&lt
2 pairs nylon hiking shorts – Quick drying type, not cotton!&lt
2 pairs lightweight long underwear – Capilene or other synthetic.&lt
1 pair soft shell pants – synthetic, full zip from top and bottom preferable.&lt
2 pairs trekking pants, preferably that zip on/off at the knees so they double as shorts.&lt

1 pair hard shell pants. Waterproof/breathable, Gore-Tex or equivalent is best. Should zip from the top and bottom – this makes it easier to put on over boots without getting undressed should the weather change once you are underway for the day.&lt
All clothing should be kept dry using waterproof stuff sacks or large puncture resistant plastic bags.&lt
4 pairs of liner socks, synthetic or Capilene.&lt
3 pairs heavy weight socks to be worn over liner socks.&lt
1 pair light weight socks, a good option for the lower / warmer parts of the trail.&lt
1 pair light to medium weight waterproof hiking/trekking boots. Ensure a good fit with layered socks and you have worn them before to get used to it (otherwise you will get lots of blister).&lt
1 pair light trekking shoes or sneakers. Good for around the camp/lodges and in Kathmandu.&lt
1 pair hiking gaiters, good for keeping dust and rocks out of your shoes/boots as well as keep your feet dry as necessary (Optional).&lt

column1: (Please note our guide will also carry the first aid kit bag during the trek. However, we still recommend you to bring your personal first aid kit as well)

column3: Extra Strength Excedrin for altitude related headaches.&lt
Ibuprofen for general aches and pains.&lt
Immodium or Pepto Bismol capsules for upset stomach or diarrhea.&lt
Diamox (commonly prescribed as Acetazolamide) 125 or 250mg tablets for altitude sickness. Please discuss with us before starting to take this medicine.&lt

1 small personal sized first-aid kit with blister treatments such as mole skin, band-aids, some waterproof tape, anti-infection ointments, etc. Your guides will have more extensive medical gear, but you should have the basics for general use.&lt
Passport and extra passport photos (4 copies).&lt
Airline ticket (Please make a copy and leave on at our office in Kathmandu just in case if you need to change the date of your).&lt
Durable wallet/pouch for travel documents, money &amp

Lip balm. At least SPF 20, 2 sticks. A string taped to the stick is helpful, to hang around your neck and some are now being sold with a cord already attached. Handy as it avoids you from having to stop and look for it.&lt
Sunscreen. SPF 40 is recommended and should be relatively new since it loses its’ effectiveness over time.&lt
Pocket knife or small Swiss Army type.&lt
Water purification Iodine tablets or Polar-pure crystals.&lt
Toiletry kit. Be sure to include toilet paper stored in a plastic bag, hand wipes, and liquid hand sanitizer, towel, soap, etc.&lt

1 pair adjustable trekking poles. Although these are listed as optional, these can be of great assistance to people who may think of themselves and generally clumsy or with bad knees, ankles, etc especially when going downhill.&lt
Favorite snack foods, no more than 2 pounds.&lt
Paperback books, cards, mp3 player (there are a couple of stops where you could recharge. Avoid players with moving hardware as it may not function. Remember, keep these items lightweight.&lt

column5: shoot camera or 1 large SLR. Digital cameras are ok, but you must keep the batteries warm when not in use.&lt

column3: Hydration bladder with drinking tube and tube insulator.&lt
A pee bottle for men and pee funnel for woman, some swear by them to avoid that chilly late night trip.&lt

column19: s:51:""Trek to Tara Khet via Singa Bazaar - approx 7 hours""
column33: s:36:""Trek to Takur via Phagune Dhuri Pass""
column58: s:173:""Our representative will be receiving you at Tribhuvan International Airport, Kathmandu. You will be then transferred to your respective hotel in our private tourist vehicle.""
column60: s:172:""After breakfast, our tour guide will show you some historical places in Kathmandu valley such like Pashupatinath Temple, Durbar Square, Monkey Temple and Boudhanath Stupas.""
column62: s:285:""We follow the Tribhuwan and Prithvi Highways along with Trishuli, Marsyandi and Seti River to Pokhara. From here we continue driving to Beni following Naudanda and Nayapul. Then we drive along the bank of Mardi River to reach Beni. From here we start spending our night in tented camp.""
column64: s:355:""We start our trekking to Tara Khet via Singa Bazaar which follows the trails along the bank of Beni River with views of mountains and small villages at distance. We take short rest at Singa Bazaar, the place where we can find lodge, tea houses. Then we continue walk to the Tara Khet. The whole trekking takes approx. 7 hours to reach Tara Khet from Beni.""
column66: s:383:""We start trekking to Panchey through gentle ascend trail passing small villages. Then we move to Torka, crossing suspension bridge over Beni River. Afterward we move to Junla and follows the flat passing trail through villages, forest and green hills to reach the bank of Danyga Khola. Here we see the typical houses and local inhabitants, mostly Magar community involved in farming.""
column68: s:295:""Trekking to Dharapani give an experience to walk in ascend and descend path with the spectacular views of green hills, forests, typical houses and views of Dhaulagiri, Mana Pathi Himal. The infrastructure and development of Dharapani village is far better than any other villages in this region.""
column70: s:208:""Today we follows quite long ascend path through small village and forest with pine, oak and rhododendron. Later we walk to the flat trail for couple hour to reach Muna where we spend overnight at tented camp.""
column72: s:281:""It takes approx. 7 hours to reach Jaljala La via Lumsum and small village Moreni. Jaljala La is alpine grassland atop a ridge where we can experience the panoramic views of Dhaulagiri range. People living in this region follows the Tibetan culture due to the close link with Tibet.""
column74: s:325:""We face most of the trail as flat until to the Dhorpatan. We trek along to the bank of river passing through oak, pine, juniper and rhododendron forest. Dhorpatan is the place where we roads from Baglung, Rolpa, Rukum and Beni meet. We also find small airport here. Here we can go for hunting by paying small Government fees.""
column76: s:236:""There are some interesting place you should never miss such Monastery and chortens. You can spend a day visiting the local markets, typical houses with wooden roofs. We also get enough time to understand local peoples and their culture.""
column78: s:318:""We trek to Phagune Dhuri Pass through a grassland and sparse forests. The forest is surrounded by green hills, the trail goes steep down passing villages, terraces and a suspension bridge over Pelma Khola. After that, we ascend gently to the Takur, small village where people are involving with their daily activities.""
column80: s:233:""We walk down all the way to Pelma crossing a wooden bridge over Pelma Khola. During our walk, we can see several villages, terraces, green hills and local people. Pelma is small village where the people are involved with the farming.""
column82: s:155:""After crossing the Pelma Khola, the trails follows up all the way to Dhule, village at a certain height. It takes approx 7 hours from Pelma to reach Dhule.""
column84: s:415:""There is steep ascent path through the pine, rhododendron and juniper forests to the Nautale Bhanjyang. This is the place where we can experience once again the panoramic views of Dhaulagiri range along with unnamed mountains. Then we continue trek to the Seng Khola which lies at the bank of Seng River. Seng Khola is small village where we can see terraces with wheat, buckwheat and mainly potatoes growing on it.""
column86: s:288:""We trek to steep rocky and dry land to reach Purpang en route through alpine grass land. Purpang is an open rockygrass land surrounded by mountains. During the trekking period, we have the panoramic views of Dhaulagiri range, Kantagaton Himal, Nurbukang Himal and other unnamed mountains.""
column88: s:254:""Trekking to Sahar Tara take approx. 7 hours follow steep ascent up to Jangla Bhanjyang through rocky trail. Later we descend gently to the Tokar, a village surrounded by hill. We continue to the Sahar Tara through few small village and sparse vegetation.""
column90: s:253:""We trek to Kanjgaon via Tarakot, Yelkot Khola. Both are the small village situated in this region. Later we also walk to another small village name as Kanjgaon where we can find small market, teahouses and lodges. We spend overnight here at tented camp.""
column92: s:261:""We trek to gentle descent path along the bank of Thuli Bheri River passing through small villages and terraces to reach Dunai. Dunai is headquarter of Dolpo district lies at the Bank of Thuli Bheri River. There we can find lodges, teahouses, government offices.""
column94: s:293:""This is very short trekking period approx. takes 3 hours. We pass through small villages, terraces and sparse vegetation to reach the Dunai. Most of the people involved with farming. This is our last destination during the trek. There is small airport, lodges, hotels and typical local houses.""
column96: s:191:""We take 40 min. fly to Nepalgunj from here. We spend our day in Nepalgunj and overnight in Hotel. After the very tough 18 days of trekking, you are going to stay in Hotel comfortably tonight.""
column98: s:266:""We take early morning flight to Kathmandu. We have enough free time for shopping and sightseeing to the local market. We spend overnight at hotel. We can also discuss on other activities in Nepal such Jungle Safari, rafting, Pokhara Sightseeing, mountain flight etc.""
column100: s:149:""This day we will be saying final goodbye. Our representative will escort you to Kathmandu International Airport for your flight departure from Nepal.""

The infrastructure and development of Dharapani village is far better than any other villages in this region.&lt
column145: Today we follows quite long ascend path through small village and forest with pine, oak and rhododendron. Later we walk to the flat trail for couple hour to reach Muna where we spend overnight at tented camp.&lt
column151: It takes approx. 7 hours to reach Jaljala La via Lumsum and small village Moreni. Jaljala La is alpine grass land atop a ridge where we can experience the panoramic views of Dhaulagiri range. People living in this region follows the Tibetan culture due to the close link with Tibet.&lt
column157: We face most of the trail as flat until to the Dhorpatan. We trek along to the bank of river passing through oak, pine, juniper and rhododendron forest. Dhorpatan is the place where we roads from Baglung, Rolpa, Rukum and Beni meet. We also find small airport here. Here we can go for hunting by paying small Government fees.&lt
column163: There are some interesting place you should never miss such Monastery and chortens. You can spend a day visiting the local markets, typical houses with wooden roofs. We also get enough time to understand local peoples and their culture.&lt
column169: We trek to Phagune Dhuri Pass through a grass land and sparse forests. The forest is surrounded by green hills, the trail goes steep down passing villages, terraces and a suspension bridge over Pelma Khola. After that, we ascend gently to the Takur, small village where people are involving with their daily activities.&lt
column175: We walk down all the way to Pelma crossing a wooden bridge over Pelma Khola. During our walk, we can see several villages, terraces, green hills and local people. Pelma is small village where the people are involved with the farming.&lt
column181: After crossing the Pelma Khola, the trails follows up all the way to Dhule, village at a certain height. It takes approx 7 hours from Pelma to reach Dhule.&lt
column187: There is steep ascent path through the pine, rhododendron and juniper forests to the Nautale Bhanjyang. This is the place where we can experience once again the panoramic views of Dhaulagiri range along with unnamed mountains. Then we continue trek to the Seng Khola which lies at the bank of Seng River. Seng Khola is small village where we can see terraces with wheat, buck wheat and mainly potatoes growing on it.&lt
column193: We trek to steep rocky and dry land to reach Purpang en route through alpine grass land. Purpang is an open rocky grass land surrounded by mountains. During the trekking period, we have the panoramic views of Dhaulagiri range, Kantagaton Himal, Nurbukang Himal and other unnamed mountains.&lt
column199: Trekking to Sahar Tara take approx. 7 hours follow steep ascent up to Jangla Bhanjyng through rocky trail. Later we descend gently to the Tokar, a village surrounded by hill. We continue to the Sahar Tara through few small village and sparse vegetation.&lt
column205: We trek to Kanjgaon via Tarakot, Yalkot Khola. Both are the small village situated in this region. Later we also walk to another small village name as Kanjgaon where we can find small market, teahouses and lodges. We spend overnight here at tented camp.&lt
column211: We trek to gentle descent path along the bank of Thulibheri River passing through small villages and terraces to reach Dunai. Dunai is headquarter of Dolpo district lies at the Bank of Thulibheri River. There we can find lodges, teahouses, government offices.&lt
column217: This is very short trekking period approx. takes 3 hours. We pass through small villages, terraces and sparse vegetation to reach the Dunai. Most of the people involve with farming. This is our last destination during the trek. There is small airport, lodges, hotels and typical local houses.&lt
column223: We take 40 min. fly to Nepalgunj from here. We spend our day in Nepalgunj and overnight in Hotel. After the very tough 18 days of trekking, you are going to stay in Hotel comfortly tonight.&lt
column229: We take early morning flight to Kathmandu. We have enough free time for shopping and sightseeing to the local market. We spend overnight at hotel. We can also discuss on other activities in Nepal such Jungle Safari, rafting, Pokhara Sightseeing, mountain flight etc.&lt
column235: This day we will be saying final goodbye. Our representative will escort you to Kathmandu International Airport for your flight departure from Nepal.&lt
column243: Departure Transfer by Private Comfortable Car/van/ Hiace.

column60: >","Doplo Region is remote and fascinating. Confined by the Dhaulagiri range in the south and east, the mountains Sisne and Kanjiroba in the west and Tibet towards the north, it showcases the extraordinary untouched beauty of the region. It was popularized by the film &ldquo
column62: . Lake Phoksundo with...","Enjoy Dolpo trekking through this spectacular heaven-like hidden valleys, visit ancient Shey Gompa, touch icy waters of Phoksundo Lake. View our itinerary.",,"a:10:{s:6:""enable""

column1: 585,"Manaslu Rupina La Pass Trekking","Manaslu Rupina La Pass trekking will take you into the untouched and hidden part of Manaslu region. It is commonly called Manaslu or Manasula. It is generally means Mountains of the Spirit.

Manaslu trekking provides magnificent beauty scenery along the border of Nepal and Tibet. This might be a quite challenging trek, thus we encourage you to have good physical fitness and stamina before trekking.
[tp-trip name=""20 days Manaslu Rupina La Pass Trekking"" heading=""h4""][/tp-trip]

column125: s:56:""hotel included breakfast,  3 meals a day during trekking""
column128: s:48:""march, april, may, september, november, december""

column3: Wonderful lakes, waterfalls, ethnic villages, beautiful landscape.&lt
Spectacular views of Manasalu (8163m) Himal Chuli (7893m) Bouddha(6672m)&lt
Rupina La Pass offers you the views of magnificent monasteries, mani walls, chortens, and many more religious landmarks.&lt

column1: Two clients share one porter. We will supply you a trek duffel bag where you keep your heavy items and this bag is carried by the porter. You will need to bring your own daypack to be carried by you. In the daypack, you can put money, important documents, water bottle/bladder, camera, toiletries, sunscreen, notebook, etc. &lt
column3: You can leave your bag with your non-trek items at the hotel in Kathmandu and collect them after the trek.&lt
4-season sleeping bag (We can provide one if you need it but has to be returned after the trek.)&lt
Duffel bag (We will provide one complimentary Ace the Himalaya duffel bag which is yours to keep.)&lt
Down jacket (Must have for mornings, nights and evenings, and for altitudes above 4,000 m
column4: we can provide it if you need one but has to be returned after the trek.)&lt

column3: Sun hat (We will provide you a complimentary Ace the Himalaya hat.)&lt
Wool or synthetic hat that cover the ears&lt
Soft shell and hard shell trekking pants&lt

column1: (Please note our guide will carry the first-aid kit bag during the trek. However, we still recommend you to bring your personalized first-aid kit as well.)

column3: Extra Strength Excedrin for altitude related headaches&lt
Ibuprofen for general aches and pains&lt
Immodium or Pepto Bismol capsules for upset stomach or diarrhea&lt
Diamox (commonly prescribed as Acetazolamide) 125 or 250mg tablets for altitude sickness&lt
Passport and extra passport photos (3 copies)&lt
Airline ticket (Please makes a copy and leaves one at our office in Kathmandu just in case if you need to change the date of your flight.)&lt
Durable wallet/pouch for travel documents, money &amp
Toiletry kit (Be sure to include toilet paper stored in a plastic bag, hand wipes, and liquid hand sanitizer, towel, soap, etc.)&lt
Favorite snack foods (No more than 2 pounds)&lt
Cameras (Memory cards, chargers and also batteries)&lt
Pee bottle for men and pee funnel for women&lt

column29: s:62:""Kathmandu Valley Sightseeing Tour and Preparation for Trekking""
column31: s:48:""Drive from Kathmandu to Arughat - approx 9 hours""
column33: s:45:""Arughat to Soti Khola (700m) - approx 6 hours""
column35: s:48:""Trek Soti Khola to Machha Khola - approx 7 hours""
column37: s:46:""Machha Khola to Jagat (2340m) - approx 7 hours""
column39: s:44:""Trek Jagat to Gomna (2100m) - approx 7 hours""
column41: s:45:""Trek Gomna to Jarang (2620m) - approx 7 hours""
column43: s:55:""Trek Jarang to Rupina la Phedi (4143m) - approx 7 hours""
column45: s:85:""Trek Rupinala Phedi to Bhedi Odar (5150m) Via Rupina La Pass (4610m) - approx 6 hours""
column47: s:56:""Trek Bhedi Odar to Bhedi Kharka (5225m) - approx 6 hours""
column49: s:58:""Trek Bhedi Kharka to Dudh Pokhari (5390m) - approx 7 hours""
column51: s:59:""Trek Dudh Pokhari to Ninghalaghari (4590m) - approx 7 hours""
column53: s:59:""Trek Ninghalaghari to Chyadi Danda (3600m) - approx 7 hours""
column55: s:51:""Trek Chyadi Danda to Tonje (1850m) - approx 7 hours""
column57: s:43:""Trek Tonje to Duwar (975m) - approx 7 hours""
column59: s:47:""Trek Duwar to Besisahar (760m) - approx 6 hours""
column61: s:50:""Drive from Besisahar to Kathmandu - approx 8 hours""
column68: s:411:""Upon you are arrivals at the Kathmandu Airport, then after fulfill all the legal formalities in the immigration and collect your luggage from the custom and reach at the arrival gate. Then reaching at the arrival gate you will meet our Airport representative who is displaying your name on the board. Then you will transfer to hotel. In the evening our tour operator will explain about the program for tomorrow.""
column70: s:418:""Early in the morning after breakfast, our tour guide will takes you for the sightseeing around the Kathmandu, the sightseeing site are- Durbar Square, the sacred Hindu temple of Pashupatinath, the famous ‘Monkey Temple’ (Swayambhunath) and Buddhists shrine (Boudhanath) which is one of the large Stupas in the world. In the late afternoon you will have preparation for the trek and you can buy necessary equipment.""
column72: s:340:""Early morning after breakfast, you will have drive from Kathmandu to Arughat which takes 7-8hours via Dhading Besi. Then from Dhading Besi the road is muddy and the trail offers beautiful green hills and finally reaches to Arughat. Arughat is one of the big bazaars for the local people. You can also visit the local market and do shopping.""
column74: s:805:""Early in the morning after breakfast, you will start your trek by crossing the bridge over Budhi Gandaki and trekking from the west part of Arughat by following the stone-paved street to north through the bazaar. The trail moves forward by passing through the rice field, hydro-electric power plant, millet to Mangaltar and passing the forest you will reach to Shanti Bazaar. Then from Shanti Bazaar the trail is steeper and difficult and again crossing the bridge of Arkhet Khola you will reach to the Arkhet Bazaar. Then from Arkhet Bazaar the trails moves downwards by passing through the cascading waterfall makes the way little difficult then you will reach to Kuerepani. Again from here the trail moves downwards to the Soti Khola. After reaching the Soti Khola you can have rest ad have your lunch.""
column76: s:415:""Today early in the morning after breakfast, we start our trek to Machha Khola.  Trekking trail leads through the steep way crossing the bridge and walking through the Sal forest with the trail moving sometime ascend and descend we reach at the Gurug village known as Labubesi. Taking few minutes rest we again start our trek to Machha Khola by trekking steep up for few minutes we finally reach at the Machha Khola.""
column78: s:668:""The trail from Machha Khola to Jagat involves narrow trail walking up and down by crossing the Tharo Khola, passing by the rocky ravine. And tiny village you will reach to Khorla Besi. The trail is challenging in some place. Then hiking few ups and downs you will reach at the hot spring at Tatopani. After the short section walk and climbing over the path of forest then you will reach at the Doban.  Then from Doban crossing the suspension bridge over the Doban Khola, from here you will climb the stone stairs up to Tharo Bharyang. After few rest again you have to cross the west bank of Budhi Gandaki and climb on the high path to the fields and villages of Jagat.""
column80: s:394:""Early in the morning after breakfast, we begin our trek to Gomna. The trekking path slowly moves upwards by passing through the terraces and little difficult trail until we reach at the Surtidas. Then reaching at Surtibas we take few minutes rest and have lunch. Then continue trek to Gomna with the attractive views of Ganesh Himal, Shringi Himal and green hills we finally reach at the Gomna.""
column82: s:329:""Today we will have adventures trek by passing through the thick forest where we can get chance to see the wild life such as bear, deer, leopard and many more local mountain birds. The trail is moves slowly up and down with pleasant environment with views of mountain. Then after 7 hours of lovely walk we finally reach at Jarang.""
column84: s:280:""Today our trekking trail leads through the upwards to cross the Rupina la pass. The trekking trail passes through the scenic environment with the views of mountain like- Ganesh Himal, Boudha Himal and Shringi Himal. Then we reach at the Rupina la Phedi and stay overnight at camp.""
column86: s:347:""After breakfast we start our trek up to the Rupina la pass then crossing the Rupina la pass and enjoying the views we slowly move down to Bhedi Odar.  Before reaching to Bhedi Odar the trail offers the views of Boudha Himal, Manaslu Mountain, Himal Chuli, Ganesh Himal and Shringi Himal. Then after 6 hours trek we finally reach at the Bhedi Odar.""
column88: s:298:""Today our trekking trail moves sloppy at the beginning with attractive landscaped. After a walk of 4 hours we stop for our lunch and take little rest. Then again continues walk of 2 hours by passing through the forest and green hills with the views of mountain we finally reach at the Bhedi Kharka.""
column90: s:439:""Today we have to trek by passing through the bamboo forest and trail goes up hill until we reach at Dudh Pokhari. Dudh Pokhari is the one of the Hindu Pilgrimage site where many devotees comes to pray. Dudh Pokhari is also consider as best view point of Manaslu Rupina la pass trekking as you can see panoramic views of  Mount Manaslu, Ganesh Himal, Shringi Himal, Lamjung Himal, Annapurna range and many other unnamed mountains and peaks.""
column92: s:195:""Today we have easy trek by slowly moving down by passing through the bamboo, rhododendron, pine forest and other natural vegetation. Then trekking of 7 hours we finally reach at the Ninghalaghar.""
column94: s:238:""Today after breakfast we slowly trek down for few minutes and again continue our trek to uphill. The trail passes through the forest and quiet way which makes the trek enjoyable then again trekking uphill we finally reach at Chyadi Danda.""
column96: s:376:""Early in the morning after breakfast, we start our trek to Tonje. On the way to Tonje the trail passes through the thin forest and pleasing environment with the sound of birds. Then finally after 7 hours trek we reach at Tonje, which is small village and settlement of Gurung people. In the evening the local people show the cultural dance which makes the trip more memorable.""
column98: s:289:""Today our trekking trail passes through the beautiful village and along the river bank. Then continues trek until reaching to Duwar. Duwar is also the Gurung village but it is bigger than Tonje. In this village we can experience more traditional culture and can interact with local people.""
column100: s:282:""Today we will have easy trek by passing through the terraces, villages and crossing the bridge. On the way to Besisahar we can enjoy our trek with the views of green hills, mountain views and beautiful landscaped. Then enjoying with nature for 6 hours we finally reach at Besisahar.""
column102: s:508:""Early in the morning after breakfast, we drive to Besisahar by the local Jeep. Then after reaching at the Besisahar, we will have 8 hours drive to Kathmandu.  The drive leads along the bank of the Marsyangdi and Trishuli rivers with superb views of green hills, mountains, farming terraces and villages on both sides of road. Upon reaching at the Kathmandu we will be transfer to the hotel. After few rest you can have few minutes shopping and in the evening you will have farewell dinner with tour operator.""
column104: s:219:""Today we will have free day at Kathmandu for personal activities and you can buy souvenir to your friends, family and relatives. In the evening you will have Farewell dinner with our tour guide. Stay overnight at hotel.""
column106: s:205:""Today as per your international flight time, keep your confirmed air ticket, and your passport handy. Our office staff will take you to the airport for your final departure from this amazing country, Nepal""

column79: s:231:""The best seasons to trek in Himalayas of Nepal between Autumn and Spring. You can also enjoy Nepali main festival like Dashain and Tihar.  You can also have trekking in other season but you could expect difficult weather situation.""
column81: s:475:""Normally trekking in Nepal is suitable for those who can walk 5-6 hours in day with light weight rucksack. And for adventurous trekking, you must have experience of moderate trekking. And physical fitness is must necessary for trekking.

column1: Normally trekking in Nepal is suitable for those who can walk 5-6 hours in day with lightweight rucksack. And for adventurous trekking, you must have experience of moderate trekking. And physical fitness is must necessary for trekking.""
column3: s:160:""Yes! We have free airport pick up and drop facilities with every booked package with us. You just need to inform us time and date of arrival during the booking.""
column5: s:285:""There are three types of accommodation in Nepal depending upon the destination. Lodge or tea house accommodations with basic standard are available in popular trekking trail. And many trail lack lodges and tea house will have homestay or camping style accommodations with expert cooks.""
column7: s:343:""Basic standard but delicious food will be available during the trek. Mostly vegetarian style foods can be expected where lodges or tea houses are available. In camping style trekking, our expert and professional cook will help you. We suggest you must have your breakfast, lunch or dinner where you spend overnight to avoid hunger and fatigue.""
column9: s:278:""You guide will be English talking local Nepali. We can also provide specific language talking guide for you such as Russian, Spanish, Chinese, French, Italian or Malay. All guides are well trained and government authorized which includes Sherpas, Gurung, Magar, Rai and Brahmin.""
column11: s:310:""We provide sleeping bags, down jackets for the Lodge to Lodge trek (Teahouse) and tents, mattresses, kitchen equipment (all of the highest quality) during the Camping Treks. However, trekking shoes, personal equipment and climbing equipment is up to you. See our equipment list or email us for a specific list.""
column13: s:278:""You need to allocate around US $10 per day for lunch and dinner during stay at Kathmandu or Pokhara. During trekking depending upon a destination, you need 20-US $20 per day for lunch and dinner. It would be more than enough unless if you prefer on fancy restaurant in the city.""
column15: s:222:""Yes! Our staffs such as guides, cooks, Sherpas and porters are fully equipped. We are connected with each other and believe in teamwork. We protect and advocates for the rights of all our staffs and they are fully insured.""
column17: s:197:""Yup, You can add another extra days during the trekking. We can arrange to extend the trekking days at your request with additional costs to cover guides, porters, and accommodation along trekking.""
column19: s:227:""Yes! Just let us know your interest
column20: we can customize package according to your need. You can have other activities such as rafting, expedition, bird watching tours, jungle safari and many other adventurous activities in Nepal.""
column27: >","Manaslu Rupina La Pass trekking will take you into the untouched and hidden part of Manaslu region. It is commonly called Manaslu or Manasula. It is generally means Mountains of the Spirit. Manaslu trekking provides magnificent beauty scenery along the border of Nepal and Tibet. This might be a...","Exploring the untouched, lush, and striking views of remarkable Himalayan vistas and authentic cultural experience during this Manaslu trekking.",,"a:15:{s:6:""enable""

column1: 616,"Sun Koshi River White Water Rafting","Nepal is one of the best places in the world for white water rafting. Nepal has some of the rushing and fast flowing rivers that originate from a higher altitude and flows towards the lower plane.
Warm water, a subtropical climate and huge white sandy beaches that are ideal for camping add further to the appeal.

[sharethis-inline-buttons]

",,20180929,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/9-days-sun-koshi-river-white-water-rafting/,https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544805511/cynthia-andres-346540-unsplash-1_qonk89.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544805020/bikalpa-pokhrel-712268-unsplash_rf3b2d.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544805019/tiago-rosado-752257-unsplash_jjmzg7.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544805019/firdouss-ross-414673-unsplash_ugz5ob.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544805019/harry-w-edmonds-540753-unsplash_h18ipn.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544805018/julie-thornton-473049-unsplash_zwgcna.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544805018/raphael-rychetsky-213744-unsplash_o9ptt4.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544805018/kayaking-in-nepal_xrtmki.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544805017/kayaking-in-nepal2_txzwit.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544805017/kayaking-in-nepal3_pqk7yu.jpg,"river rafting & kayaking in nepal|Swoyambhunath Stupa, Kathmandu, Nepal|Trekking in Nepal|firdouss-ross-414673-unsplash|harry-w-edmonds-540753-unsplash|white water rafting in sun koshi river|Swayambhunath, Kathmandu, Nepal|kayaking in nepal|kayaking in nepal|kayaking in nepal",|||||||||,|||||||||,"river rafting & kayaking|Swoyambhunath Stupa, Kathmandu, Nepal|Swayambhunath, Kathmandu, Nepal||||Dharapani, Nepal|||",https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544805511/cynthia-andres-346540-unsplash-1_qonk89.jpg,,"Middle Hills>Sindhupalchowk","Adventure>RAFTING &

column5: Top 10 River Rafting Destination in the world.&lt
Longest white rafting in Nepal of about 270km.&lt
Accessible to the people of all group, beginner to professional level.&lt

This is a great river for any kayaker. Great for expericed kayakers wanting to take it easy but also for beiginngers or intermediates wanting to improve upon their skills. There is the option to kayak the easier days and then jump in the raft when the rapids get alittle too intense! With our kayaking guides showing you the way, this is a great high volume river to work on your skills.&lt

column1: Along with our high quality self-bailing rafts, we provide helmets, plastic paddles, wetsuits, lifejackets, and first aid kit. We provide plentiful, healthy and hygienically prepared food and drinks. Tents and sleeping mats are also provided. Sleeping bags can be supplied upon request. All our equipment is of the highest quality, clean and well maintained.

column3: shorts and a T-shirt or swimwear for on the river&lt
suitable footwear for wearing in the raft&lt
What you need to tell us&lt

column1: Please tell us if you are a non-swimmer, or not very confident in the water. Also it is essential that you inform us of any medical conditions that may affect your well being on the trip. Don’t forget to request vegetarian meals if required.

Osho Adventure takes the safety of its clients very seriously. All our guides are licensed, with many years of experience on the rivers of Nepal and other European countries. All are trained in CPR, First Aid and advanced river rescue techniques.""
column11: s:61:""Drive from Kathmandu to Dolalghat then rafting to Tarang Gaon""
column13: s:33:""Rafting from Tarang Gaon to Dumja""
column17: s:35:""Rafting from Khurkot to Likhu Khola""
column19: s:44:""Rafting from Likhu Khola to Harkapur village""
column21: s:41:""Rafting from Harkapur village to Rai Ghat""
column23: s:37:""Rafting from Rai Ghat to Buwajor Ghat""
column25: s:43:""Rafting from Buwajor Ghat to Baraha Chhetra""
column27: s:66:""Rafting from Barahchhatra to Chatara then drive back to Kathmandu.""
column30: s:276:""We start our rafting from the Dolalghat which takes 3-4 hours drive from Kathmandu and take short raft to the Tarang Gaon.It is a fairly easy start to the trip, with just a few Grade 2 rapids before we reach our camp on Butterfly Beach. We setup camp and stay overnight there.""
column32: s:214:""Our next day rafting start in the morning after breakfast and packing of camp. Today we raft to the most excited big class rapid “No Exit” – Grade 3 and “Meatgrinder”-Grade 4. We will setup camp at Dumja.""
column34: s:215:""Another enjoying day of rafting where we raft to a point where Tama Koshi River joins the Sun Koshi on the left with a beach on the confluence. There is another beautiful Shiva temple. We will setup camp at Khurkot.""
column36: s:285:""Today we raft to “Anxiety” rapid series which includes the “Pre”, “Post” and “High Anxiety”. After that we raft to the warm waters, keep an eye out for those cheeky monkeys, enjoy the scenery and perhaps have a little go at kayaking. We setup camp at Likhu Khola beach.""
column38: s:167:""Today we raft to the “Harkapur” village. We passes to the 3+ grade rapid and Harkapur 2 and 3 are the hardest rapid on the river which should be carefully scouted.""
column40: s:214:""After the Harkapur, Dudh Kosi River joins the Sun Kosi from the left. Below here the river widens into an arid area of gravel. We meet some small rapids and will teach you into another aptly named rapid ‘Jaws’.""
column42: s:335:""This is the hardest part of the rafting as we will encounter most of the grade 4+ rapids – we are straight into good exciting rapid “Rhino Rock” – grade 4+ followed by “Jungle Corridor” a kilometer of continuous white water. Waterfalls cascade on both sides of the river. One waterfall makes a great spot for a team shower.""
column44: s:184:""Last few days are mainly wave trains if you are interested you can try kayaking where our experts will teach you the basic skills needed to maneuver the boats or learn the Eskimo roll.""
column46: s:499:""The last stretch of River which brings us to the last class 4+ Big Dipper is a series of huge standing waves. After few kilometers, Arun, Tamur and Sunkushi join together and form the Sapta Kosi. Then we float along on the powerful current, the hills dramatically give way to totally flat Terai and the northern plains of India. This is the end of a classic and memorable Rafting journey. Finally we finish rafting around 2 pm and then drive back to Kathmandu which takes around 14 hours of journey.""

column63: s:291:""Rafting is for fun, excitement, wilderness and adventure. There is risk involves with any adventurous activities. Our guides are well trained to overcome risks in rafting. The most common injury is sunburn, and most other injuries occur on land, especially getting into and out of the boats.""
column65: s:553:""Every rafter (beginner or experienced) are necessarily wears a coast guard approved buoyancy vest.  This will keep you afloat in the event that you find yourself in the river. Many non-swimmers enjoy white water rafting, however it is advisable not to go rafting above IV+ grade river. One things there will be one man single rescue Kayak. This safety kayak always front of us if some body fall down from water this Kayaks man (Kayaker) immediately rescue to the fallen people. This rescue Kayaker always waits at the ends of the risk place like Rapids.""
column67: s:351:""You must be fit and healthy for rafting as many boats on rafting need paddling which will be in your hand. Our guides will instruct you on paddling technique. Oar boats, where you ride along as a passenger, are also available on many rivers. If you’re in doubt about your ability to go rafting, or your fitness, check with your doctor before you go.""
column69: s:263:""It is depend on the time, water temperature and weather condition. We recommend you dress for the water temperature, rather than the air temperature, since you’ll be getting wet. Don’t wear cotton. It will just make you colder. Please check on Highlights tab.""
column71: s:263:""If you are first time rafter, then it is advisable to start rafting with II or III grade, however you can also choose for IV grade. Guides will make sure you are trained in safety and paddle techniques. For class V Rivers, you must have prior class IV experience.""
column73: s:251:""Many people love falling from boat, it’s exciting. But with our guide and their instruction, you are fully safe from falling out of the boat. If you fall out of the boat which is very rare, then there is always safety kits available with our guides.""
column75: s:303:""It is only recommend to bring waterproof cameras, which work just fine. The quality of the pictures is pretty good, and if you lose it, it’s not the end of the world. They are well suited to rafting. Some river trips have professional photographers, whose photos you can view and order after the trip.""
column77: s:149:""Yes, if you have time and interest then we many things to do such as- Trekking in Nepal, Jungle Safari, Expedition in Nepal and Birds Watching tours.""
column79: s:292:""Tipping is not expected, but is certainly appreciated by the guides, who work hard to make sure you have a fun, yet safe trip. If you feel your guide has done a good job, keeping you entertained, and sharing the wonderful river environment with you, then feels free to show your appreciation.""
column86: >","Nepal is one of the best places in the world for white water rafting. Nepal has some of the rushing and fast flowing rivers that originate from a higher altitude and flows towards the lower plane. Warm water, a subtropical climate and huge white sandy beaches that are ideal for camping add...","Trishuli River is an excellent river for those looking for a short river trip, without the challenge of huge but with some really exciting rapids, with beautiful scenery and a relatively peaceful environment.",,"a:9:{s:6:""enable""

column1: 763,"Panoramic Langtang Trek through Langtang Valley","Langtang region lies at the south of Tibet Border and north from the capital- Kathmandu.

The major attraction of this region spectacular views of snow-capped mountains such as Langtang Lirung (7246m), Gang Chhenpo(6388m) and Naya Kanga Ri(5846m) lie to the south and Dorje Lakpa(6966m) at the East of the Langtang Valley. The Langtang Trek awaits.
[tp-trip name=""12 days Panoramic Langtang Trek through Langtang Valley"" heading=""h4""][/tp-trip]

[sharethis-inline-buttons]",,20181002,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/12-days-panoramic-langtang-trek-through-valley/,https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544804965/teddy-hartanto-710064-unsplash_slely7.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544804966/nepal-836303_fyw9xa.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544804966/nepal-836309_coknjq.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544804965/nepal-970250_w9yibs.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544804965/nepal-2982837_s30jx6.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544804889/samrat-khadka-1079358-unsplash_az6zmv.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544804888/sergey-pesterev-228813-unsplash_fzqrmx.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544804888/sergey-pesterev-230017-unsplash_lyggam.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544804887/sergey-pesterev-227352-unsplash_mfdgbu.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544804887/samrat-khadka-1079353-unsplash_p1qt6y.jpg,"Langtang National Park, Nepal|Langtang National Park, Nepal|Langtang National Park, Nepal|Langtang National Park, Nepal|Langtang National Park, Nepal|Langtang National Park, Nepal|Langtang National Park, Nepal|Langtang National Park, Nepal|Langtang National Park, Nepal|Langtang National Park, Nepal",|||||||||,|||||||||,|||||||||,https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544804965/teddy-hartanto-710064-unsplash_slely7.jpg,,"Himalayas>Langtang Region","Natural &amp

column3: Know the culture and tradition of indigenous people such as Sherpa and Tamang.&lt
High-waterfalls and rushing Trishuli river originated from mountains like Langtang Himal, Dorje Lakpa, Lhanghisha Ri.&lt
Vibrant colors of birds and flowers.&lt

column1: Two clients share one porter. We will supply you a trek duffel bag where you keep your heavy items and this bag is carried by the porter. You will need to bring your own daypack to be carried by you. In the daypack, you can put money, important documents, water bottle/bladder, camera, toiletries, sunscreen, notebook, etc.

The weight limit for the porter is 30 kg or 66 pounds. 15 kg or 33 pounds for each client. So, we recommend you to pack as carefully as you can and not exceed the weight limit. You can leave your non-trekking stuff at the locker facility in the Kathmandu hotel.

column3: 4-season sleeping bag (We can provide one if you need it but has to be returned after the trek.)&lt
Down jacket (Must have for mornings, nights and evenings, and for altitudes above 4,000 m
column4: We can provide it if you need one but has to be returned after the trek.)&lt

column3: Wool or synthetic hat that cover the ears&lt
Soft shell and hard shell trek pants&lt

column1: (Please note our guide will carry the first-aid kit bag during the trek. However we still recommend you to bring your personalized first-aid kit as well.)

column3: Extra Strength Excedrin for altitude related headaches&lt
Ibuprofen for general aches and pains&lt
Immodium or Pepto Bismol capsules for upset stomach or diarrhea&lt
Diamox (commonly prescribed as Acetazolamide) 125 or 250mg tablets for altitude sickness&lt
Passport and extra passport photos (3 copies)&lt
Airline ticket (Please make a copy and leave one at our office in Kathmandu just in case if you need to change the date of your flight.)&lt
Durable wallet/pouch for travel documents, money &amp
Toiletry kit (Be sure to include toilet paper stored in a plastic bag, hand wipes, and liquid hand sanitizer, towel, soap, etc.)&lt
Favorite snack foods (No more than 2 pounds)&lt
Cameras (Memory cards, chargers and also batteries)&lt
Pee bottle for men and pee funnel for women&lt

column38: s:411:""Upon you are arrivals at the Kathmandu Airport, then after fulfill all the legal formalities in the immigration and collect your luggage from the custom and reach at the arrival gate. Then reaching at the arrival gate you will meet our Airport representative who is displaying your name on the board. Then you will transfer to hotel. In the evening our tour operator will explain about the program for tomorrow.""
column40: s:418:""Early in the morning after breakfast, our tour guide will takes you for the sightseeing around the Kathmandu, the sightseeing site are- Durbar Square, the sacred Hindu temple of Pashupatinath, the famous ‘Monkey Temple’ (Swayambhunath) and Buddhists shrine (Boudhanath) which is one of the large Stupas in the world. In the late afternoon you will have preparation for the trek and you can buy necessary equipment.""
column42: s:411:""Early in the morning, we drive from Kathmandu to Syabru Besi which takes about eight hours on a public bus. Driving through scenic foothills and ridgeline vistas to Syabru Besi passing Dhunche, we’ll get a glimpse of Ganesh Himal after driving along the mighty Trishuli River. Terraced green hills and lush forests make the drive very pleasurable. Parts of the road though may be bumpy and under construction.""
column44: s:401:""The first part of the trail crosses through the Bhote Koshi River and follows the Langtang Khola. This trail gradually ascends up to Bamboo (1,960 m) passing rugged paths. Afterward, our trek climbs gently to Rimche (2,400 m). We can have lunch at this place and at the end of our trail is the Lama Hotel. En route we could see red pandas, monkeys and bears if we are lucky. Overnight at a guesthouse.""
column46: s:361:""The trek route follows Gumanechok at Ghoda Tabela which literally means the Horse Stable. After this the trail climbs gradually to the beautiful valley with yaks about. Langtang is a typical village and one of the oldest along this trekking route. The views of the mountains are spectacular and become more imposing as we trek closer. Overnight at a guesthouse.""
column48: s:400:""It is shorter walk today, but adequate for acclimatizing. There are some interesting things to explore, especially the famous cheese factory – don’t forget to try some locally produced cheese as fresh as it could get. This beautiful valley is on the lap of the Langtang Lirung. This is the spot where we can explore the valley and climbs several small peaks (hillocks). Overnight at a guesthouse.""
column50: s:342:""Today is a day to rest as we explore the area. You can visit the monastery and the cheese factory, walk up the moraine to see the spectacular icefaces and tumbling glaciers of Langtang Lirung or ascend Kyanjin Ri (4350m) which is the highest point of this trek, directly behind the village, for a breath-taking panorama of the Langtang peaks.""
column52: s:161:""After one day of relaxation and observation of the surrounding in Kyanjin Gompa, we will follow the same trail back to Lama hotel today. Overnight in Lama hotel.""
column54: s:395:""We begin strolling to Syabru Besi from Lama hotel after breakfast and walk our way down on a slow pace. We catch up with the elements of the beautiful forest and the wildlife missed on our way up and will try capturing some species of flora and fauna in our camera. We rest the day in Syabrubesi and it is difficult to find a decent ride back to the capital after noon. Overnight in Syabru Besi.""
column56: s:206:""Early in the morning we take bus or jeep to reach Kathmandu by next 8 hours. The time of arrival depends on the bus route we take, either via Kakani or via the main prithivi highway. Overnight in Kathmandu.""
column58: s:522:""Today we will have free day at Kathmandu for personal activities and you can buy souvenir to your friends, family and relatives. In the evening you will have Farewell dinner with our tour guide. In the evening we will have a farewell dinner in a traditional Nepalese restaurant with cultural performances. Stay overnight at hotel.

column1: If you are interested in extending the trip, there are many options such as Chitwan jungle safari, river rafting adventure, Kathmandu shopping tour, mountain biking and other activities.""
column3: s:205:""Today as per your international flight time, keep your confirmed air ticket, and your passport handy. Our office staff will take you to the airport for your final departure from this amazing country, Nepal""
column8: Upon you are arrivals at the Kathmandu Airport, then after fulfill all the legal formalities in the immigration and collect your luggage from the custom and reach at the arrival gate. Then reaching at the arrival gate you will meet our Airport representative who is displaying your name on the board. Then you will transfer to hotel. In the evening our tour operator will explain about the program for tomorrow.&lt

Stay overnight at hotel.&lt
