column64: s:170:""Our airport representative will be receiving you at Tribhuvan International Airport. You will be then transferred to your respective hotel in our private tourist vehicle.""
column66: s:1395:""After a hearty breakfast, at 8.30 am your sightseeing trip will start. You will have a private vehicle and a professional tour guide at your disposal. Today we will visit some heritages listed below:

column1: Pashupatinath Temple is one of the most significant Hindu temples of Lord Shiva in the world, located on the banks of the Bagmati River. Though you are not allowed to go inside the temple as it is strictly for Hindus only, you can clearly see the temple and the activities from the eastern bank of the Bagmati River. It is a square two-tiered pagoda temple built on a single-tier plinth which is famous all over the world.

Boudhananath is one of the holiest Buddhist sites in Kathmandu. It was built in the 5th century with four pairs of eyes of Lord Buddha in four cardinal directions keeping an eternal watch over the people and their doings. You will find Buddhist pilgrims from Tibet going round the stupa spinning the prayer wheels.

Visit the Bhaktapur Durbar Square, the Royal Residential Quarter of Bhupatindra Malla, famous five-storied temple of Nyatapola in Pagoda style Batsala temple, Bhairavnath temple, Dattatreya temple, Pujari Muth and Palace of 55 windows.
The rest of our time in Kathmandu is free for further exploration and some last-minute shopping in Thamel area for trekking essentials.""
column3: s:276:""After the morning breakfast we leave for Soti Khola, the starting point of our trek. From Kathmandu to Dhading Besi is a 3-hour comfortable drive after which will be a 5-hour bumpy and winding dirt road to Soti Khola. The total drive for the day will approximately be 8 hours.""
column5: s:357:""Today we start walking to Machha Khola. The trail is full of ups and downs and goes through narrow and rocky terrain. We come across many beautiful waterfalls. Before reaching Machha Khola, we pass through Labubesi village which is a Gurung community. After walking for almost 6 hours, we arrive at our destination for the day which is Machha khola (River).""
column7: s:262:""After crossing Machha River and Khorla besi, there is a hot spring called Tatopani. The trail follows a forest reaching Dovan, below which flows the massive Budi Gandaki. As the elevation increases, the rapids and the scenery undergoes a complete transformation.""
column9: s:527:""The early morning trek makes us climb through a rocky ridge up to Salleri from where we descend down towards Sirdibas. The valley widens as the trail takes us to Ghatta khola and then upstream towards the Gurung village, Philim. Walking towards the northern direction through the forest, we reach Chisopani. Leaving Chisopani, we cross the gorge and walk for around half an hour only to arrive at the beautiful waterfall. We then walk into the pine and rhododendron forests, descend down the trail towards Tsum Valley to Lokpa.""
column11: s:426:""Today is a tough day as the altitude increases and the trail is mostly an ascent too.  The panoramic views of the Himalayas hides and seeks time and again throughout the trail. We walk down beautiful villages of Lungwa Khola and then ascend through pine forests to Gumlung.  After crossing the Siyar Khola, we finally reach Chumling, the lower Tsum valley, famous for Chumling Gompa and the stone paved streets of the village.""
column13: s:317:""The trek starts with crossing the suspension bridge today. We walk on the other side and enjoying the views of Ganesh Himal walk towards Rainjam towards Serpu Khola. We cross one more bridge and head towards a village named Gho. We walk further 2 hours to finally walk to the upper Tsum valley and reach Chokhangparo.""
column15: s:459:""Today there is a strong rise in altitude and the ascent in the trail too. We walk past Lamagaon crossing suspension bridge towards Rachen Gompa, also known as Nunnery Gompa. After making a visit to the Gompa we return back on the trail. We pass through Shiar Khola, Lar, Phoebe and Pangdun village, many Buddhist monasteries, cross the final bridge before reaching Nile. There is a monastery at Chule nearby to Nile which can be visited after resting at Nile.""
column17: s:191:""The trail today takes us closer to the Tibetan border. We walk through the west bank of the valley through Tibetan landscapes. After walking for around 3 to 4 hours we finally reach Mu Gompa.""
column19: s:297:""Today we spend the day resting and exploring the Mu Gompa, the other Tibetan landscapes and the most remote area of this Tsum valley. Mu Gompa is the largest monastery in the region. After completing the exploration at Mu Gompa, we can also consider walking to the base of the Pika Himal (4865 m).""
column21: s:262:""Today we walk back the trail to Chule and Phoebe. On the east bank of Shiar Khola, we arrive at Burgi village. This village is small and beautiful. We climb up the Milarepa cave famous for the mesmerizing view of the Kipu Himal, Churke Himal and Poshyop glacier.""
column23: s:161:""We walk back the trail enjoying the dense pine and rhododendron forests, descending down to Chokhangparo and then walking towards the lower Tsum Valley Chumling.""
column25: s:125:""The walk today will be of 5 to 6 hours. Descending down to Lokpa, enjoying the gorgeous Samba Falls, we finally reach Philim.""
column27: s:409:""We walk down towards Sirdibas then to Jagat and further descend to Yaruphant. The Tibetan arid climate can be seen gradually changing over to the subtropical green vegetation. We continue descending down towards Dovan and finally reaching Tatopani. There is a hot water spring at Tatopani, if preferred one can take a dip into it to relax the tired muscles. We further walk down and finally reach Khorla Besi.""
column29: s:309:""The trail today is mostly a descent. We walk down the trail, cross suspension bridges, walk back to Machha Khola, walk along the Budhi Gandaki river, pass the Gurung village of Lapubesi, the waterfalls, a village names Khursani, walk across the pine forests, cross the bridge and finally arrive at Soti Khola.""
column31: s:163:""We will be driving back to Kathmandu in the morning. In the evening we will have a farewell dinner in a traditional Nepalese restaurant with cultural performances.""
column33: s:138:""The trip ends, our Airport Representative will drop you to the Kathmandu International Airport for your final flight departure from Nepal.""

column41: >","Tsum Valley trek is one of the best examples of off-beaten trekking path in Nepal. This makes Tsum Valley one of the finest trekking spot for many people who want to experience the...","Explore the remote, mysterious region full of Tibetan culture, the majestic Himalayas, and the secluded Himalayan valleys through Tsum Valley Trek.",,"a:18:{s:6:""enable""

column1: 1571,"Fishtail Poon Hill Sunrise Short Trek","Fishtail Poon Hill Sunrise Short Trek is an experience for first time trekking tenderfoot kids and their families seeking the thrills of natural beauty.

This trek will give you the truest experience of natural serenity with a gentle part of mountains and lush green forests. This 5-days trip  is perfect for those who are short of time but still want to slog it on the lower foothills of Nepal.",,20181121,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/poon-hill-sunrise-short-trek/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/16644359050_6f11b21819_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/5889811948_c75a21ee33_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/8679145006_6ba26d1b2e_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/14989174923_089b241de3_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/121883009_9b48f978fe_b-1.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/435229329_c675d00e4e_b-1.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/2422812597_4ae036f795_b-1.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/4655728252_e159196f66_b-1.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/4748165035_bc740e4592_b-1.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/5581677840_8e6dc7186f_b-1.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/6945880433_ed763e54fd_k-1.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/8418036378_e7045220bf_b-1.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/8475646360_fa40041961_k-1.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/9490323084_572363f2ac_k-1.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/14475363330_a419270a5a_k-1.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/15716872424_0401d7ed33_o-1.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/15716936174_2d06e8fd78_o-1.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/16153117429_947becf1f6_o-1.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/33389703888_fab7792756_k-1.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/41291559062_d1a8fa9dfe_k-1.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/46356388705_b774a11cdc_k-1.jpg,"16644359050_6f11b21819_b|5889811948_c75a21ee33_b|8679145006_6ba26d1b2e_b|14989174923_089b241de3_b|121883009_9b48f978fe_b|43522932 column96: s:680:""Beginning at the comfortable altitude of 1100m the trail follows the ridges created by the Burundi Khola and takes you through terraced farmlands and bamboo forests - along with friendly local people as they move from village to village on their daily tasks.

column1: Along this Fishtail Poon Hill Sunrise Short Trek, second day passes through ancient bird-filled forests of rhododendron, oak, maple and pine as you climb to the prosperous village of Ghorepani. From here, an early morning climb to the summit of Poon Hill offers breathtaking views of some of Nepal’s highest and most dramatic peaks, including three of the world’s 148000m peaks: Dhaulagiri, Annapurna and Manaslu.""

column3: Two clients share one porter. We will supply you a trek duffel bag where you keep your heavy items and this bag is carried by the porter. You will need to bring your own daypack to be carried by you. In the daypack, you can put money, important documents, water bottle/bladder, camera, toiletries, sunscreen, notebook, etc. The weight limit for the porter is 30 kg or 66 pounds. 15 kg or 33 pounds for each client. So, we recommend you to pack as carefully as you can and not exceed the weight limit. You can leave your non-trekking stuff at the locker facility in the Kathmandu hotel.&lt
4-season sleeping bag (We can provide one if you need it but has to be returned after the trek)&lt
Down jacket (Must have for mornings, nights and evenings, and for altitudes above 4,000 m
column4: We can provide it if you need one but has to be returned after the trek.)&lt

column3: Wool or synthetic hat that cover the ears&lt
Soft shell and hard shell trekking pants&lt
(Please note our guide will carry the first-aid kit bag during the trek. However we still recommend you to bring your personalized first-aid kit as well.)&lt
Extra Strength Excedrin for altitude related headaches&lt
Ibuprofen for general aches and pains&lt
Immodium or Pepto Bismol capsules for upset stomach or diarrhea&lt
Diamox (commonly prescribed as Acetazolamide) 125 or 250mg tablets for altitude sickness&lt
Passport and extra passport photos (3 copies)&lt
Airline ticket (Please make a copy and leave one at our office in Kathmandu just in case if you need to change the date of your flight.)&lt
Durable wallet/pouch for travel documents, money &amp
Toiletry kit (Be sure to include toilet paper stored in a plastic bag, hand wipes, and liquid hand sanitizer, towel, soap, etc.)&lt
Favorite snack foods (No more than 2 pounds)&lt
Cameras (Memory cards, chargers and also batteries)&lt
Pee bottle for men and pee funnel for women&lt

column27: s:115:""Fly from Kathmandu to Pokhara then Trek from Nayapul through Tikhedhunga (1495m) to Ulleri (1950m) - approx 6 hours""
column29: s:54:""Trek from Ulleri to Ghorepani (2850m) - approx 6 hours""
column31: s:81:""Hike up to Poon Hill (3210m) then descend from Ghorepani to Hile - approx 7 hours""
column33: s:53:""Drive back from Pokhara to Kathmandu - approx 7 hours""
column36: s:591:""Early morning, transfer to Kathmandu domestic airport and fly to Pokhara. Then, drive along the zigzag route to Nayapul where we commence our trek to Birethanti, a large and prosperous riverside village at the confluence of the Modi and Burundi Kholas (streams). We hike up to Sudame along the off road and then climb gradually up the side of the valley, Tikhedhunga.

column1: Cross suspension metal bridge and steep ascent on stone staircases to the village of Ulleri – and an amazing landscape of valley floor where we came during the day with marvelous views of Annapurna South and Hiunchuli.""
column3: s:364:""After breakfast, our pleasant trekking begins through rhododendron and oak forests. The scenery will give you the energy to continue up the steps as you immerse yourself in the walk. After a few hours and with several breaks we reach Ghorepani. Upper Ghorepani (Deurali) where we stay in this trip, offers fantastic views of Dhaulagiri and the Annapurna Himalayas.""
column5: s:675:""Make a pre-dawn start for the 45 minute walk up Poon hill (3,210m/10,530ft)
column6: through rhododendron forest. From the grassy top of the hill there is an unobstructed panoramic view of the high Himalayas stretching from far western Dolpo, and Dhaulagiri (8172m), the Annapurna Range in the north, including Machhapuchhre (Fishtail) and on to Manaslu (8163m) in the northeast. To the south, the mist slowly rises from the flatlands towards India. After countless photographs, walk back to Ghorepani for breakfast and then retrace your steps on the easier and faster down route to Hile (trailhead). Then, 3 hours off road drive to Nayapul to Pokhara by jeep/taxi. Rest of day free.""
column8: s:288:""After breakfast, transfer to Tourist bus station and 07:30am drive back to Kathmandu by tourist bus. This scenic drive offers fascinating glimpses of rural Nepal as you pass through Middle Hill scenery along the famous rafting Trishuli River originated from Tibet north east of Kathmandu.""
column13: Early morning, transfer to Kathmandu’s domestic airport and fly to Pokhara. Then, drive along the zigzag route to Nayapul where we commence our trek to Birethanti, a large and prosperous riverside village at the confluence of the Modi and Bhurungdi Kholas (streams). We hike up to Sudame along the off road and then climb gradually up the side of the valley, Tikhedhunga.&lt
column21: Cross suspension metal bridge and steep ascent on stone staircases to the village of Ulleri – and an amazing landscape of valley floor where we came during the day with marvelous views of Annapurna South and Hiunchuli.&lt
column27: After breakfast, our pleasant trekking begins through rhododendron and oak forests. The scenery will give you the energy to continue up the steps as you immerse yourself in the walk. column40: After breakfast, transfer to Tourist bus station and 07:30am drive back to Kathmandu by tourist bus. column1: 1575,"Ghorepani Ghandruk Short Annapurna Trek","Ghorepani Ghandruk Short Annapurna Trek is one of the popular short classical trekking in Nepal. The starting point of the trek is Pokhara- the city of lakes where you can witness the real serenity of nature. There is an exceptional please of trekking in Annapurna foothills with enchanting settlements of various ethnic groups of Nepal. Ghorepani and Ghandruk are the main dwelling settlements for the Ghale and Gurung tribes of people.
This Poonhill Trekking is a circular route through farmland, rhododendron forests. Poonhill offers magnificent sunrise views of huge Annapurna and Dhaulagiri ranges to the northern highlands.

column27: s:114:""Fly from Kathmandu to Pokhara then Trek from Nayapul through Tikhedhunga (1495m) to Ulleri (1950m)- approx 6 hours""
column29: s:54:""Trek from Ulleri to Ghorepani (2850m) - approx 6 hours""

column38: s:608:""Early morning, transfer to Kathmandu’s domestic airport and fly to Pokhara. Then, drive along the zigzag route to Nayapul (trail foot) where we commence our trek to Birethanti, a large and prosperous riverside village at the confluence of the Modi and Burundi Kholas (streams). We hike up to Sudame along the off road and then climb gradually up the side of the valley, Tikhedhunga.

column1: Cross suspension metal bridge and steep ascent on stone staircases to the village of Ulleri – and an amazing landscape of valley floor where we came during the day with marvelous views of Annapurna South and Hiunchuli.""
column3: s:364:""After breakfast, our pleasant trekking begins through rhododendron and oak forests. The scenery will give you the energy to continue up the steps as you immerse yourself in the walk. After a few hours and with several breaks we reach Ghorepani. Upper Ghorepani (Deurali) where we stay in this trip, offers fantastic views of Dhaulagiri and the Annapurna Himalayas.""
column5: s:730:""Make a pre-dawn start for the 45 minute walk up Poon hill (3,210m/10,530ft)
column6: through rhododendron forest. From the grassy top of the hill there is an unobstructed panoramic view of the high Himalayas stretching from far western Dolpo, and Dhaulagiri (8,172m/26,812ft), the Annapurna Range in the north, including Machhapuchhare (Fish Tail) and on to Manaslu (8,163m/26,783ft) in the northeast. To the south, the mist slowly rises from the flatlands towards India. After countless photographs, walk back to Ghorepani for breakfast.

column1: The eastward trail to Tadapani crosses numerous ridges through thick pine and rhododendron forest with occasional flat sections and wonderful views of the snow peaks to the north from high ground.""
column3: s:514:""Today’s trail is mainly downhill: the first destination being the large Gurung village of Ghandruk with Himalayan views on the background. We arrive here just by the Lunch time. After lunch, trek to Ghandruk Phedi (trail head) for an hour to the road to finish the trek, and brings quicker to Lake City Pokhara for shopping and hang around. About 3 hours scenic drive following downstream of ice cold river and overlooking Phewas Lake. Eventually, back to Pokhara and your Hotel to Lakeside. Afternoon free time.""
column5: s:288:""After breakfast, transfer to Tourist bus station and 07:30am drive back to Kathmandu by tourist bus. This scenic drive offers fascinating glimpses of rural Nepal as you pass through Middle Hill scenery along the famous rafting Trishuli River originated from Tibet north east of Kathmandu.""

column1: 1579,"Langtang Valley Short Trek","Langtang Valley Trekking is one of the superb treks in Nepal that packs a lot of scenic punch into a small amount of time. The trip not only provides the magical views of rushing Langtang river, bamboo groves to a collection of high alpine pastures but also the amazing views magnificent glaciers and valleys.

Additionally, the day-hike in Thuman particularly offers spectacular close-up views of the Langtang Lirung (7246m), Kimshung (6781m) and Langshisha Ri (6370m). It's worth budgeting a couple of days here to take advantage of the fabulous scenic side trips.",,20181121,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/langtang-valley-short-trek/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/5284439270_542b1e9c36_o.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803898/lantang-valley-trek_gelbiu.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803897/lantang-valley-trek2_jrwfxw.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803897/lantang-valley-trek3_sk2znm.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803897/lantang-valley-trek4_frlup4.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803897/lantang-valley-trek5_nrrits.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803896/Annapurna-circuit-trek-Langtang-valley-trekking-Kathmandu-Nepal_gvxrsp.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803234/Annapurna-circuit-trek-Langtang-valley-trekking-Kathmandu-Nepal2_lvknxt.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803234/Langtang-National-Park-Helambu-Nepal_xzkwp0.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803234/Langtang-National-Park-Nepal-1_c8zskc.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803233/Langtang-National-Park-Nepal2_me3vw3.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803233/Langtang-National-Park-Nepal3_c9m8ne.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803232/Langtang-National-Park-Nepal4_owg4pr.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803232/Langtang-National-Park-Nepal5_t6nloy.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/5283977181_272e75b14e_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/32885181583_0eef6d29d1_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/33311110820_c307c7a7d8_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/33654294386_92f7360f4c_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-conten column36: s:375:""Drive on a northern highway that twists and climbs ridges to Trishuli Bazar. The journey will take 8-10 hours through picturesque landscapes, Himalayan sceneries and local villages. On the way we have magnificent views of Manaslu, Ganesh Himal and Tibetan mountain range including Mt. Kerung.. Drive continue to Dhunche, Syabru Besi and Chilime. Overnight in Chilime at Lodge""
column38: s:504:""After breakfast, ascend crossing the hanging suspension bridge and trail keeps raising untill you get to Tatopani for lunch. Tatopani means ‘hot water’ You can cleanse yourself in natural hot spring at bathing areas in the lap of the Himalayas. Locals believe that the waters have a heating quality that eases away your aches and pains. After Lunch our trail again toward Nagathali Gyang (3165m), the high open grassland with amazing views of the snow capped Himalayas. Overnight in Tatopani at Lodge""
column40: s:336:""After sunrise and magnificent view of Ganesh Himal range and Langtang range our trail descend down Thuman for Lunch, and then join the ancient trade route from Tibet along the Bhote Koshi Nadi down to Syabru Besi: a lively village at the confluence of two rivers. Return to Kathmandu the next morning. Overnight in Syabru Besi at Lodge.""
column42: s:140:""Drive through crumble and bumpy road through Dhunche following the same highway as before to Kathmandu and transfer to your choice of hotel.""

column1: 1600,"60 mins Hot Air Ballooning in Pokhara","Pokhara is one of the most popular locations in Nepal for hot ballooning.  It’s also one of the few places in the world you can balloon almost all year round. Trips run in boiling hot summers and snowy winters – and the landscape looks incredible in both. While on a flight, you won’t just see a few balloons, the sky will be filled with around 50 balloons of different colors and designs. Every day is like a fiesta.

Pokhara has excellent safety records for many adventure sports including hot air ballooning. To fly here, pilots must be well trained and must have been taken training for more than 5 times in other parts of the world.",,20181123,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/60-mins-hot-air-ballooning-in-pokhara/,https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803230/hot-air-ballooning-in-nepal4_mro2c3.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803231/hot-air-ballooning-in-nepal_fpctkg.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803231/hot-air-ballooning-in-nepal2_zxfptr.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803231/hot-air-ballooning-in-nepal3_pev6bz.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803230/hot-air-ballooning-in-nepal5_wzbqaq.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803230/hot-air-ballooning-in-nepal6_xcievn.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803229/hot-air-ballooning-in-nepal7_zegntk.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803229/hot-air-ballooning-in-nepal9_jisa01.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803228/hot-air-ballooning-in-nepal10_yz4dxm.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803228/hot-air-ballooning-in-nepal11_tbmoo3.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803228/hot-baloon-pokhara_ym7lxe.jpg,"hot air ballooning in nepal|hot air ballooning in nepal|hot air ballooning in nepal|hot air ballooning in nepal|hot air ballooning in nepal|hot air ballooning in nepal|hot air ballooning in nepal|hot air ballooning in nepal|hot air ballooning in nepal|hot air ballooning in nepal|hot baloon pokhara",||||||||||,||||||||||,||||||||||,https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544803230/hot-air-ballooning-in-nepal4_mro2c3.jpg,,"Middle Hills>Pokhara","Relaxing Moments>HOT AIR BALLOONING","Duration>day trip|Trip Level>Easy|Budget>Less than $500",,"a:1:{s:15:""departure_dates""

column1: 1636,"Lobuche East Peak via Gokyo Cho-la Trek ","Lobuche Peak (6145 m) is a gorgeous summit lies at the Everest Region. It is one of the well-known trekking peaks in Nepal which offers various routes for summiteers. Lobuche peak is reached by descending into a marked notch and climbing steep snow and ice slopes to the top. It is situated at an elevation of 6119 meters.

The descent can be made down the South Ridge and then by scrambling down on the east side back to Lobuche village. The climb is graded alpine TD, with the section of Scottish 5.",,20181128,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/lobuche-east-peak-via-gokyo-cho-la-trek%e2%80%a8/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/6390212019_ca621cfe74_b.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544643883/everest-base-camp-lobuche-east-peak_ift9vt.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544643883/everest-base-camp-lobuche-east-peak1_akfc5e.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544643881/everest-base-camp-lobuche-east-peak2_mnfu37.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544643880/everest-base-camp-lobuche-east-peak3_z7zyzx.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544643879/everest-base-camp-lobuche-east-peak4_ey8g3b.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544643878/everest-base-camp-lobuche-east-peak5_v6svsl.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544643877/everest-base-camp-lobuche-east-peak6_unnqwj.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544643876/everest-base-camp-lobuche-east-peak7_hhyxfy.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544643875/everest-base-camp-lobuche-east-peak8_qnkpaf.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544643875/everest-base-camp-lobuche-east-peak9_jsadkn.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544643874/everest-base-camp-lobuche-east-peak10_vaxzag.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544643873/everest-base-camp-lobuche-east-peak12_yh0gfp.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1544643050/everest-base-camp-lobuche-east-peak13_dx3nmp.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/gokyo-lake-.tif|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/59386856_4af8ff6bba_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/4587543136_c1f484bed1_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/5170485954_9558969e54_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/5176981067_9a3be58a52_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/5178707674_3e34af763d_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/6270617276_60d03bb441_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/6342238933_3f32080e47_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/8077851381_4a43c7ee38_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/9154222186_b07910b1e8_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/16024112528_f1735cbb38_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/28522478068_6325021e13_b.jpg,"6390212019_ca621cfe74_b|everest column4: s:42:""Lobuche East Peak via Gokyo Cho-la Trek ""
column6: s:160:""Lobuche Peak (6145 m) is a gorgeous summit lies at the Everest Region. It is one of the well-known trekking peaks in Nepal which offers various routes for summi""
column10: s:42:""Lobuche East Peak via Gokyo Cho-la Trek ""
column12: s:160:""Lobuche Peak (6145 m) is a gorgeous summit lies at the Everest Region. It is one of the well-known trekking peaks in Nepal which offers various routes for summi""
column140: s:56:""hotel included breakfast,  3 meals a day during trekking""
column143: s:47:""march, april, may, september, october, november""

column3: Mind blowing views of world's highest mountains and its ranges like Mt. Everest ( 8848m), Mt. Lhotse (8516m), Mt. Makalu (8481m), Mt. Cho Oyu (8201m).&lt
Crossing one of the highest passes - Gokyo Chola Pass (5420m)&lt
Pristine Gokyo Lakes, floating Khumbu icefall&lt
Vibrant blossoms of flowers and exotic species in the World's Heritage, The Sagarmatha National Park.&lt

column1: Two clients share one porter. We will supply you a trek duffel bag where you keep your heavy items and this bag is carried by the porter. You will need to bring your own daypack to be carried by you. In the daypack, you can put money, important documents, water bottle/bladder, camera, toiletries, sunscreen, notebook, etc.

The weight limit for Kathmandu-Lukla-Kathmandu flights is 15 kg or 33 pounds. This is combining both the duffel bag and the daypack. If you exceed this limit, you will have to pay an additional fee. When this happens, sometimes the airline sends your bag in later flights and this can be very problematic for many reasons. So, we recommend you to pack as carefully as you can and not exceed the weight limit. You can leave your non-trekking stuff at the locker facility in the Kathmandu hotel.

column3: 4-season sleeping bag (We can provide one if you need it but has to be returned after the trek.)&lt
Down jacket (Must have for mornings, nights and evenings, and for altitudes above 4,000 m
column4: We can provide it if you need one but has to be returned after the trek.)&lt

column3: Wool or synthetic hat that cover the ears&lt
Soft shell and hard shell trek pants&lt

column1: Please note our guide will carry the first-aid kit bag during the trek. However we still recommend you to bring your personalized first-aid kit as well.

column3: Extra Strength Excedrin for altitude related headaches&lt
Ibuprofen for general aches and pains&lt
Immodium or Pepto Bismol capsules for upset stomach or diarrhea&lt
Diamox (commonly prescribed as Acetazolamide) 125 or 250mg tablets for altitude sickness&lt
Passport and extra passport photos (3 copies)&lt
Airline ticket (Please make a copy and leave one at our office in Kathmandu just in case if you need to change the date of your flight.)&lt
Durable wallet/pouch for travel documents, money &amp
Toiletry kit (Be sure to include toilet paper stored in a plastic bag, hand wipes, and liquid hand sanitizer, towel, soap, etc.)&lt
Favorite snack foods (No more than 2 pounds)&lt
Cameras (Memory cards, chargers and also batteries)&lt
Pee bottle for men and pee funnel for women&lt

column17: s:68:""Fly from Kathmandu to Lukla (30 min) &amp
column20: s:46:""Trek to Namche Bazaar (3440m) - approx 6 hours""
column22: s:45:""Rest day at Namche Bazaar for acclimatisation""
column24: s:58:""Trek to Khunde / Khumjung village (3730m) - approx 4 hours""
column26: s:46:""Trek to Phortse Tenga (3900m) - approx 4 hours""
column34: s:32:""At Gokyo (5400 m) for local hike""
column36: s:91:""Trek from Dragnak cross Cho-la (5430m) then descending to Dzong-la (4830m) - approx 7 hours""
column43: s:59:""Trek to Lobuche East Peak Base Camp (5340m) -approx 4 hours""
column45: s:30:""At Lobuche East Peak Base Camp""
column47: s:63:""Climb to Lobuche Peak and return to Lobuche East Peak Base Camp""
column53: s:39:""Trek to Lukla (2860 m) - approx 5 hours""
column55: s:35:""Fly from Lukla to Kathmandu- 30 Min""
column59: s:51:""Transfer to Airport for the International departure""
column62: s:313:""On arrival at Kathmandu Tribhuvan International Airport you will be received by our staff and escort you to the Hotel, where one of our leader or a Sherpa guide will give you a brief orientation of the Hotel, Kathmandu, Trekking, do's and don't and other related information that you might require while in Nepal.""
column64: s:1032:""After your first night in Kathmandu, you will be well informed on arrival about the time for your half day guided sightseeing tour in Kathmandu at places of interest.

column1: This complex of palaces, courtyards and temples, built between the 12th and 18th centuries, used to be the seat of the ancient Malla kings of Kathmandu. An intriguing piece here is the 17th- century stone inscription set into the wall of the palace with writings in 15 languages. The Durbar Square is the social, religious and urban focal point of the city. There are also three museums inside the palace building.

The stupa watches over the valley from the top of a hillock on its western side. The huge white-domed stupa is one of the holiest Buddhist sites in Nepal and its establishment is linked to the creation of the Kathmandu Valley out of a primordial lake. Swoyambhu is also known as ‘Samhengu’ and the Monkey temple because of the countless monkeys living in the premises.""
column3: s:626:""Approx: 45 minutes flight to Lukla 2,800m (2 -3 hrs walk) to Phakding at 2,652m. Early morning after breakfast you will be transferred from the Hotel to domestic Airport for a 32 minutes sweeping panoramic flight to Lukla, on arrival you will be received by our trekking guides. The walk is gradual and most of the way, with few ups from Tarhe khola, where you can have a superb view of Kusum-Kangru 6,369m crossing a short suspension bridge, from here after a short climb brings us to the Ghat village, another 11/2hr of gradual walk brings you to Phakding village for the overnight stop near the bank of the Dudh-Kosi river.""
column5: s:958:""From Phakding after crossing the suspension bridge over the Dudh-Kosi the walk is pleasant with few short uphill and downhill and re crossing the same river again, with magnificent view of Thermasarkhu 6,608m, from the village of Benkar, cross the long suspension bridge over the Bhote-Koshi river, after the bridge on this busy trail of trekkers and Ghopkyo and porters, finally reaching at Monjo near the entrance of Sagarmatha National Park. From here a short descend and a gradual walk brings to the suspension bridge over the Bhote-Koshi river, after the bridge Jorsalle village is reached, the last village before Namche Bazaar is reached, after a short walk, a second bridge is reached over the same river, the walk is pleasant on the river bed till the last bridge over the Imja Tse river is reached, from here the walk is along the winding uphill path all the way to Namche Bazaar. The colourful houses are situated in an amphitheatre U shaped bowl.""
column7: s:231:""A leisure day to enjoy and relax around the town or visit the Sagarmatha National Park museum just above Namche Bazaar for outstanding views of Everest, Nuptse, Lhotse,Ama Dablam, Taboche, Thermasarkhu, Kang tenga and Khunde peaks.""
column9: s:972:""After a great time at Namche, trace the route above the ridge of Namche towards Syangboche just above Namche, following the trail to Khunde and Khumjung the largest of the Sherpa villages in the Khumbu area, trek leads towards the Syangboche small airstrip, the first one and half hour walk is quite strenuous uphill due to high altitude overlooking the magnificent view of Mt.Kwangde, Thermasherkhu and other neighboring peaks with an aerial view of Namche Bazaar down below.

column1: On reaching Syangboche small airstrip, take a short climb towards the Khunde village situated in the same glacial valley as Khumjung village beneath the sacred Mt.Khumbila (5761m). A quiet gentle path brings to the sleepy village of Khumjung via Khunde for the overnight halt. At Khunde there's a hospital built with the help of Sir Edmund Hillary's Foundation. Afternoon visit the Khumjung old Monastery, Khumjung also has a High School built with the help of Sir Edmund Hillary Foundation.""
column3: s:861:"" After a wonderful time here, the walk is fairly easy for the first half, from Khumjung the trail leads to an hour downhill joining the main busy trail at Shanasa, on this area there is more chances of seeing the beautiful colourful Danphe pheasant (Impeyan Pheasant) national bird of Nepal and the elusive musk deer, and sometime even heard of Himalayan Tahr (mountain goat).

column1: From Shanasa, Gokyo route diverts from the main trail towards north. The path climbs gently on the steep rock steps embedded in a narrow cleft in a large boulder
column2: the two trails soon join and continue towards a large Chorten on the top of the ridge at Mong (3973m). This ridge descends from Khumbila (5716m) abode of the patron god Khumbu. From this ridge, the path meanders in a series of switchbacks down a sandy slope to the Dudh Kosi at Phortse Thanga for our overnight stop.""
column4: s:532:""After Phortse, continue trek to Dole, from here the trail climbs steeply out of the valley through a patch of rhododendron forest which gives way to juniper and conifers trees. In the spring time this place will be vivid when all the flowers in bloom. This path passes many summer pastures where the Yak and other cattle graze in this high pastureland. The trek winds through the Tongba village at (3950m) and Gayle (3960m) and finally arriving at Dole. A superb view of Khumbila and Tawache (6542m) can be seen throughout the walk.""
column6: s:676:""From Dole, our route climbs steadily along the side of the valley, rhododendron forest giving way to scrub juniper as altitude gains gradually. The trail climbs on a fairly level path for one hour to Alabama Kharka at (4325m) and a further an hour to Luza at (4390m)
column7: eventually skirting around a ridge to gain the first views of Machermo village, spread out in the valley below. There is an excellent Swiss chalet style lodge at Machermo, Arriving at Machermo on good time for the overnight halt.

column1: With time for exploration above the village. Just above the village there is a superb view encompassing Cho Oyu (8210m) and all the mountains that flank the Ngozumpa Glacier.""
column3: s:851:""From here, head for the holy lake at Gokyo. By following a very scenic trail to Pangka (4545m) and then descend slightly, following one of the glacial fed rivers which flow down the west of Ngozumpa Glacier. Then climb a steep rocky incline into the ablation valley by the side of the glacier, passing the first lake. Soon arriving at the second lake, crossing the path which heads across the glacier to the Cho -La (another tough route to Lobuche and beyond to Everest base camp) Coming to the third lake known as Dudh Pokhari and on its east shore is the summer settlement of Gokyo at (4790m).

column1: Walking by the side of the lake, the scenery is magnificent with the peak of Cho Oyu and Gyachung Kang reflected in its emerald green waters we will be camping just by shore of the lake depending upon the availability of the campsite with a good view.""
column3: s:456:""Today, a rest day and free from packing after breakfast a hike to Gokyo Ri is one of the highlight of the trip, the view around Gokyo itself is marvelous, for the very best panorama take a hike to Gokyo Ri, a small peak above the lake, Gokyo Ri at (5357m). offers breathtaking views providing a panorama of Cho Oyu, Gyachung Kang, Everest, Lhotse, Cholatse, Taboche and far as to Mt. Makalu in the east. A two hours climb brings you to this wonderful spot.""
column5: s:344:""After a wonderful time at Gokyo, a short walk of few hours leads to Dragnak on the base of Chugyuma or Cho-la pass, just above the village of Na situated at the foot of the Ngozumpa glacier. From here the walk climbs steadily towards Cho-la pass for few hours, then descending towards the small hidden valley at Dzong-la for the overnight stop.""
column7: s:818:""From Dzongla the trail diverts towards north east, the path is gentle on the hard meadow looking down below Pheriche village, today's walk offers beautiful view of the Mt.Tawache, Ama Dablam and to the north Pokalde (5741m), Kongma-tse (5820m) and the great wall of Nuptse.

column1: Then reaching to the junction where the path from Pheriche meets above Thugla ridge. From here you can have great view of Mt.Pumori and other peaks west of Everest, the spot here is good place for a few minutes break after the great scenic walk, close to this spot you can also see a number of memorial of the unfortunate climbers, who died in expeditions around the mountain of this region, From here an hour gradual up brings you to Loboche, situated in the corner well hidden and sheltered from the wind. Loboche has about 5-6 Teahouses.""
column3: s:1660:""Today towards final destination of this adventurous journey at the foot of number one, the first hour walk is gradual up the valley at the end of the grassy field, a short 20 minutes climb, the walk from here follows the rocky moraine path, as you walk you can see the icy-glacial pond and icebergs down below of Khumbu glacier. After the last rocky moraine dunes a short downhill walk bring you to Gorak Shep on the flat field below Kalapathar 5545m and Mt.Pumori 7,145m. Gorakshep has two teahouses, and it used to be a base camp in the early 50's expedition to Mt.Everest. After a break here at Gorak Shep continue towards Kala Patthar, a few minutes of easy walk on the sandy field, then a steep climb for 45 minutes brings you to the near level field, the walk from here is gradual till you reach the rocky spot after an hour, from here another steep climb to the top for another 1/2 hour. Top of Kala Patthar a small rocky peak on the southwest ridge of Mt.Pumori, the view from here is beyond imagination as the Everest looks within a stone throw distance, between the summit of Nuptse and Lho-la and Lhotse on the back, the panoramic view from this spot is something to cherish, and you feel its worth the hard climb up to here and to feel at the top of the world, with all the higher snow capped giants that surrounds, it is truly a magnificent spot to be here on a clear sunny day to view an array of mountains up to the far horizon, to the south Khumbu glacier sweeps below you, and you can also see the Everest Base camp down below on the moraine of Khumbu glacier, after a great moment with the panoramic view descend for the overnight at Loboche.""
column5: s:376:""The final day of this great adventure, continues towards Lobuche East Peak Base Camp, the path from here can be misleading, follow the lead Sherpa, every year the trail changes due to the movements of the glacier, the walk is quite strenuous due to the high altitude and thin air, the walk passes through over rocky dunes and moraine and streams, till you reach the base camp.""
column7: s:220:""Rest day which help for the final preparation for the climb or trek and climb further to establish high camp at around (5600m) if there is space available to camp. This will make it easier and shorten the day and effort.""
column9: s:356:""Today the final day to achieve the goal of this trip, if the weather is fine can be done in a day with strenuous effort on reaching the top of the summit grand panorama of the surrounding peaks including the number one Mt.Everest. After the climb time permitting either descend towards the Base Camp or continue towards Loboche village for the celebration.""
column11: s:822:""The walk today will be easy heading downhill to a lower elevation
column12: after the bridge route descends following the stream towards Pheriche valley, after 40 minutes of downhill the walk gets better as reach the valley floor, an hour of easy good walk brings you at Pheriche (4243m). After a break here, a short walk brings you to the bridge from the bridge it is nearly downhill all the way with few ups in between to Pangboche, from here descend towards the bridge with a pleasant walk through the pine, rhododendron forest to Deoboche, after Deoboche 40 minutes uphill climb reaches you at Thyangboche for the overnight stop. Thyangboche offers excellent scenery of the surrounding peaks including Mt.Everest and of the majestic peal of Ama Dablam, visit the famed Thyangboche monastery as per the time rules for the visit.""
column14: s:476:""From Thyangboche the walk leads downhill to Phunge-tenga for an hour, after reaching the bottom cross the wooden bridge over the torrent Imja-tse river, after the bridge climb leads you back to the village of Shana-sa,  from here the trail from Khumjung, Gokyo and to Namche meets. From here route follows the main busy path, to Namche Bazaar, after Namche retrace the same track to Monjo for the overnight stop. Located  just near after the Sagarmatha National Park entrance.""
column16: s:462:""Last day of this great trek will be one of the good walk to Lukla, you can walk at your own chosen pace, leisurely and enjoying the lush green scenery around.

column1: Apart from few short uphill the only long climb will be just before Lukla which will take approximately 45 minutes from a place called Chop lung or from the old big oak tree. On reaching Lukla, prepare for the last day great dinner and a party with the fellow Sherpa crew, porters and trekking members.""
column3: s:573:""The flight time to Kathmandu, are schedule for morning normally, because of the wind in the afternoon, sometime the flight time can be delayed due to bad weather and other reason beyond our command. As we get hold of the boarding pass depending upon our flight time we make our way to the terminal for security check, this scenic flight from Lukla takes about 45 minutes to Kathmandu, a panoramic view of the snow capped peaks can be seen from window of the plane.

column1: Arriving at Kathmandu domestic terminal, our office staffs will receive and escort you back to the Hotel.""
column3: s:196:""A free day in Kathmandu, please let our staff or tour officer know if you would like to go on another short tour in and around Kathmandu Valley or for scenic mountain flight or hot air ballooning.""
column5: s:240:""Today as per your international flight time, keep your confirmed air ticket, departure tax (in local currency) and your passport handy. Our Office staff will take you to the airport for your final departure from this amazing country, Nepal.""
column10: On arrival at Kathmandu Tribhuvan International Airport you will be received by our staff and escort you to the Hotel, where one of our leader or a Sherpa guide will give you a brief orientation of the Hotel, Kathmandu, Trekking, do's and don't and other related information that you might require while in Nepal. &lt

column107: From Dole, our route climbs steadily along the side of the valley, rhododendron forest giving way to scrub juniper as altitude gains gradually. The trail climbs on a fairly level path for one hour to Lhabarma Kharka at (4325m) and a further an hour to Luza at (4390m)
column108: eventually skirting around a ridge to gain the first views of Machermo village, spread out in the valley below. There is an excellent Swiss chalet style lodge at Machermo, Arriving at Machermo on good time for the overnight halt. &lt
column116: With time for exploration above the village. Just above the village there is a superb view encompassing Cho Oyu (8210m) and all the mountains that flank the Ngozumpa Glacier.&lt
column126: From here, head for the holy lake at Gokyo. By following a very scenic trail to Pangka (4545m) and then descend slightly, following one of the glacial fed rivers which flow down the west of Ngozumpa Glacier. Then climb a steep rocky incline into the ablation valley by the side of the glacier, passing the first lake. Soon arriving at the second lake, crossing the path which heads across the glacier to the Cho -La (another tough route to Lobuche and beyond to Everest base camp) Coming to the third lake known as Dudh Pokhari and on its east shore is the summer settlement of Gokyo at (4790m). &lt
column134: Walking by the side of the lake, the scenery is magnificent with the peak of Cho Oyu and Gyachung Kang reflected in its emerald green waters we will be camping just by shore of the lake depending upon the availability of the campsite with a good view.&lt
column140: Today, a rest day and free from packing after breakfast a hike to Gokyo Ri is one of the highlight of the trip, the view around Gokyo itself is marvelous, for the very best panorama take a hike to Gokyo Ri, a small peak above the lake, Gokyo Ri at (5357m). offers breathtaking views providing a panorama of Cho Oyu, Gyachung Kang, Everest, Lhotse, Cholatse, Taboche and far as to Mt. Makalu in the east. A two hours climb brings you to this wonderful spot.&lt
column146: After a wonderful time at Gokyo, a short walk of few hours leads to Dragnak on the base of Chugyuma or Cho-la pass, just above the village of Na situated at the foot of the Ngozumba glacier. From here the walk climbs steadily towards Cho-la pass for few hours, then descending towards the small hidden valley at Dzong-la for the overnight stop. &lt
column152: From Dzongla the trail diverts towards north east, the path is gentle on the hard meadow looking down below Pheriche village, today's walk offers beautiful view of the Mt.Tawache, Ama Dablam and to the north Pokalde (5741m), Kongma-tse (5820m) and the great wall of Nuptse. &lt
column160: Then reaching to the junction where the path from Pheriche meets above Thugla ridge. From here you can have great view of Mt.Pumori and other peaks west of Everest, the spot here is good place for a few minutes break after the great scenic walk, close to this spot you can also see a number of memorial of the unfortunate climbers, who died in expeditions around the mountain of this region, From here an hour gradual up brings you to Loboche, situated in the corner well hidden and sheltered from the wind. Loboche has about 5-6 Teahouses.&lt
column166: Today towards final destination of this adventurous journey at the foot of number one, the first hour walk is gradual up the valley at the end of the grassy field, a short 20 minutes climb, the walk from here follows the rocky moraine path, as you walk you can see the icy-glacial pond and icebergs down below of Khumbu glacier. After the last rocky moraine dunes a short downhill walk bring you to Gorak Shep on the flat field below Kalapathar 5545m and Mt.Pumori 7,145m. Gorakshep has two teahouses, and it used to be a base camp in the early 50's expedition to Mt.Everest. After a break here at Gorak Shep continue towards Kala Patthar, a few minutes of easy walk on the sandy field, then a steep climb for 45 minutes brings you to the near level field, the walk from here is gradual till you reach the rocky spot after an hour, from here another steep climb to the top for another 1/2 hour. Top of Kala Patthar a small rocky peak on the southwest ridge of Mt.Pumori, the view from here is beyond imagination as the Everest looks within a stone throw distance, between the summit of Nuptse and Lho-la and Lhotse on the back, the panoramic view from this spot is something to cherish, and you feel its worth the hard climb up to here and to feel at the top of the world, with all the higher snow capped giants that surrounds, it is truly a magnificent spot to be here on a clear sunny day to view an array of mountains up to the far horizon, to the south Khumbu glacier sweeps below you, and you can also see the Everest Base camp down below on the moraine of Khumbu glacier, after a great moment with the panoramic view descend for the overnight at Loboche.&lt
column172: The final day of this great adventure, continues towards Loboche East Peak Base Camp, the path from here can be misleading, follow the lead Sherpa, every year the trail changes due to the movements of the glacier, the walk is quite strenuous due to the high altitude and thin air, the walk passes through over rocky dunes and moraine and streams, till you reach the base camp.&lt
column178: Rest day which help for the final preparation for the climb or trek and climb further to establish high camp at around (5600m) if there is space available to camp. This will make it easier and shorten the day and effort.&lt
column184: Today the final day to achieve the goal of this trip, if the weather is fine can be done in a day with strenuous effort on reaching the top of the summit grand panorama of the surrounding peaks including the number one Mt.Everest. After the climb time permitting either descend towards the Base Camp or continue towards Loboche village for the celebration.  &lt
column190: The walk today will be easy heading downhill to a lower elevation
column191: after the bridge route descends following the stream towards Pheriche valley, after 40 minutes of downhill the walk gets better as reach the valley floor, an hour of easy good walk brings you at Pheriche (4243m). After a break here, a short walk brings you to the bridge from the bridge it is nearly downhill all the way with few ups in between to Pangboche, from here descend towards the bridge with a pleasant walk through the pine, rhododendron forest to Deoboche, after Deoboche 40 minutes uphill climb reaches you at Thyangboche for the overnight stop. Thyangboche offers excellent scenery of the surrounding peaks including Mt.Everest and of the majestic peal of Ama Dablam, visit the famed Thyangboche monastery as per the time rules for the visit.&lt
column197: From Thyangboche the walk leads downhill to Phunge-tenga for an hour, after reaching the bottom cross the wooden bridge over the torrent Imja-tse river, after the bridge climb leads you back to the village of Shana-sa,  from here the trail from Khumjung, Gokyo and to Namche meets. From here route follows the main busy path, to Namche Bazaar, after Namche retrace the same track to Monjo for the overnight stop. Located  just near after the Sagarmatha National Park entrance.&lt
column203: Last day of this great trek will be one of the good walk to Lukla, you can walk at your own chosen pace, leisurely and enjoying the lush green scenery around.&lt
column207: Apart from few short uphill the only long climb will be just before Lukla which will take approximately 45 minutes from a place called Chop lung or from the old big oak tree. On reaching Lukla, prepare for the last day great dinner and a party with the fellow Sherpa crew, porters and trekking members. &lt
column213: The flight time to Kathmandu, are schedule for morning normally, because of the wind in the afternoon, sometime the flight time can be delayed due to bad weather and other reason beyond our command. As we get hold of the boarding pass depending upon our flight time we make our way to the terminal for security check, this scenic flight from Lukla takes about 45 minutes to Kathmandu, a panoramic view of the snow capped peaks can be seen from window of the plane.&lt
column221: Arriving at Kathmandu domestic terminal, our office staffs will receive and escort you back to the Hotel.&lt
column227: A free day in Kathmandu, please let our staff or tour officer know if you would like to go on another short tour in and around Kathmandu Valley or for scenic mountain flight or hot air ballooning.&lt
column233: Today as per your international flight time, keep your confirmed air ticket, departure tax (in local currency) and your passport handy. Our Office staff will take you to the airport for your final departure from this amazing country, Nepal.&lt

column45: >","Lobuche Peak (6145 m) is a gorgeous summit lies at the Everest Region. It is one of the well-known trekking peaks in Nepal which offers various routes for summiteers. Lobuche peak is reached by descending into a marked notch and climbing steep snow and ice slopes to the top. It is situated at an...","Sensational views of array of high snow capped mountains, verdant high valleys, warm-friendly hospitality of high landers - welcome to Lobuche East Peak!",,"a:14:{s:6:""enable""

column1: 1679,"Lhasa to Kathmandu Mountain Biking","The classic Trans-Himalayan trade route is a long and demanding ride on a road. This is certainly amongst the contenders for the title of "" the world's wildest highway"".

Flying to Lhasa gives you time to get acclimatized at the world's highest capital at 3,600-meter altitude. There is much to see in Lhasa such as Potala Palace, the Jokhang Temple, and the largest of the Tibetan markets at Barkor. A couple of short easy bike rides around Lhasa will help the group's acclimatization. It will also allow visiting some of the many interesting temples and religious sites.

There are six major passes to be negotiated on the main Lhasa to Kathmandu route as it runs southwards, parallel to the Great Himalayan chain which forms the border with the territories of Bhutan, Sikkim, and Nepal. On the entire trip, the road traverses a high and dry plateau - punctuated by the unforgettable monastery towns of Gyantse, Shigatse, and Shegar, and also by several smaller settlements and nomadic Drogpa encampments.

column7: Truly fabulous and adventurous journey which covers the most sceneries of Tibet and Nepal.&lt
Numerous high passes with stunning views of picturesque landscapes, tranquil lakes, rural villages, large meadows with nomad camps.&lt
Enriched by the ancient most lavishly decorated monasteries and temples with chanting saffron.&lt
Smiling faces of local people and their unique culture and tradition.&lt
Sweeping panoramic flight over the mighty Himalayas.&lt

column5: s:9322:""During your biking tour all the heavy items are carried by porters, yaks or donkeys and personal belongings that you may need for the day like money, water bottle, rain gear, camera, sun cream and toilet paper etc. should be carried by yourself. So you are briefed to pack items in two different bags.
Padded cycling shorts (to last at least 5 rides)&lt

column1: If you’re bringing your own bike:

column3: Brake pads specific to your bike x 2 sets&lt
Rear mech hanger specific to your bike x 2&lt
Four inner tubes, or spare bottle of fluid for&lt
Quick link to suit your chain&lt
For 29” wheels bring extra spare tubes
column4: these are more difficult to find in Nepal&lt

column3: 4 seasons Sleeping bag (we can provide one if you need it but is to be returned after the trek)&lt
Duffel or Rucksack bag or suitcase&lt
Down Jacket only if you are traveling in the cold season i.e January, February, November and December (Optional/we can provide if you need one but is to be returned after the trek)&lt

Shade hat or baseball cap – some people drape a bandana down the back of their head and then put a baseball cap on to hold it. This can be a flexible alternative while keeping the sun off your ears and neck.&lt
Warm wool or synthetic hat that covers your ears (only if you are traveling in the cold season i.e January, February, November and December)&lt
Goggles or sunglasses for sunbeam, dust and wind.&lt

Headlamp – Black Diamond and Petzl both make several good ones. Make sure to bring extra batteries and that they are lithium batteries so that they will last in the colder temperatures. These are indispensable for getting around at night, reading, etc. so, don’t go cheap here.&lt

column5: a good hat, balaclava, and hooded jacket should really be sufficient, but this is a personal choice for some people.&lt

column3: A neck warmer is another piece of gear for extra warmth if you feel you will need it and is for cold season.&lt
1 pair liner gloves, thin wool or synthetic, useful alone on mild days or as a layer inside other gloves / mitts for additional warmth.&lt
1 pair warm gloves (This is required if you are traveling in cold season i.e January, February, November and December).&lt
Instant hand warmers are always nice in a pinch, but really shouldn’t be necessary on the trek. Bringing appropriate hand protection as recommended above, should be sufficient (optional).&lt
2 women sports bras, Synthetic, no cotton!&lt
2 pairs nylon hiking shorts – Quick drying type, not cotton!&lt
2 pairs lightweight long underwear – Capilene or other synthetic.&lt
1 pair soft shell pants – synthetic, full zip from top and bottom preferable.&lt
2 pairs trekking pants, preferably that zip on/off at the knees so they double as shorts..&lt
All clothing should be kept dry using waterproof stuff sacks or large puncture resistant plastic bags.&lt
2 pairs of liner socks, synthetic or Capilene.&lt
2 pairs heavy weight socks to be worn over liner socks preferable for cold season.&lt
2 pair light weight socks, a good option for the lower / warmer parts of the trail.&lt
1 pair light to medium weight waterproof hiking/trekking boots. Ensure a good fit with layered socks and you have worn them before to get used to it (otherwise you will get lots of blister).&lt
1 pair light trekking shoes or sneakers. Good for around the camp/lodges and in Kathmandu.&lt
1 pair hiking gaiters, good for keeping dust and rocks out of your shoes / boots as well as keep your feet dry as necessary.&lt

column1: Please note our guide will also carry the first aid kit bag during the trek. However, we still recommend you to bring your personal first aid kit as well.

column3: Extra Strength Excedrin for altitude related headaches.&lt
Ibuprofen for general aches and pains.&lt
Immodium or Pepto Bismol capsules for upset stomach or diarrhea.&lt
Diamox (commonly prescribed as Acetazolamide) 125 or 250mg tablets for altitude sickness. Please discuss with us before starting to take this medicine.&lt

1 small personal sized first-aid kit with blister treatments such as mole skin, band-aids, some waterproof tape, anti-infection ointments, etc. Your guides will have more extensive medical gear, but you should have the basics for general use.&lt
Passport and extra passport photos (4 copies).&lt
Airline ticket (Please make a copy and leave on at our office in KTM just in case if you need to change the date of your).&lt
Durable wallet/pouch for travel documents, money &amp

Lip balm. At least SPF 20, 2 sticks. A string taped to the stick is helpful, to hang around your neck and some are now being sold with a cord already attached. Handy as it avoids you from having to stop and look for it.&lt
Sunscreen. SPF 40 is recommended and should be relatively new since it loses its’ effectiveness over time.&lt
Pocket knife or small Swiss Army type.&lt
Water purification Iodine tablets or Polar-pure crystals.&lt
Toiletry kit. Be sure to include toilet paper stored in a plastic bag, hand wipes, and liquid hand sanitizer, towel, soap, etc.&lt

1 pair adjustable trekking poles. Although these are listed as optional, these can be of great assistance to people who may think of themselves and generally clumsy or with bad knees, ankles, etc, especially when going downhill&lt
Favorite snack foods, no more than 2 lbs&lt
Paperback books, cards, mp3 player (there are a couple of stops where you could recharge. Avoid players with moving hardware as it may not function.&lt

column5: shoot camera or 1 large SLR. Digital cameras are ok, but you must keep the batteries warm when not in use&lt

column3: Hydration bladder with the drinking tube and tube insulator&lt
A pee bottle for men and pee funnel for the women&lt
