column80: s:666:""On arrival at Kathmandu Tribhuvan International Airport you will be received by our staff and will escort you to the Hotel, where one of our leader or a local biking guide will give you a brief orientation of the Hotel, Kathmandu, and Biking / Camping, do's and don't and other related information that you might require while in Nepal &amp
column81: in Tibet. Our Tour Officer will ask for your International flight ticket and your passport for safekeeping and for reconfirmation of your outbound flight. Do not hesitate to do this, this is one of our routine service and it will be in the safe hand while you are on the biking trip, and after the trip you will get it back.""
column83: s:393:""After your first night in Kathmandu, you will be well informed on arrival about the the time for your half day guided sightseeing tour in Kathmandu at places of interest. Sometime, depending upon your flight arrival if its late in the night we will do this tour in the afternoon instead of morning to give you a nice sleep and rest before you venture out of the Hotel for our interesting tour.""
column85: s:249:""Fly from Kathmandu to Lhasa and if the weather is clear enough you can have the spectacular view of World’s highest peaks including Mount Everest. Will be received at the Airport by the Chinese Agents and will drive to our Hotel for about 2 Hours.""
column87: s:882:""During these three days we will tour the fabled City of Lhasa. A completely forbidden City until very recent times, Lhasa was Holy Grail for many central Asian explorers of past generations. The City has of course been altered by the Chinese occupation and the impact of  foreign visitors. However much of the original character remains and whilst jostling through the Potala with crowds of ethnic Tibetans, it is hard not to be captivated by this magnificent civilisation. Visit to the great monasteries of Sera and Drepung, both of which were extensively destroyed in the cultural revolution but are now being rebuilt. We will also visit the Jokhang and of course the Potala. Lhasa is at 3,600m /12,000ft and provides an ideal acclimation for the first few days.  The relatively comfortable hotel will give members some time to get to know each other without the stress of moving.""
column89: s:38:""Continue to explore the city of Lhasa.""
column91: s:38:""Continue to explore the city of Lhasa.""
column93: s:1284:""After the good acclimatization at Lhasa, adventure begins with a relatively level and gradual stage, towards the bottom of the Khamba-la. Just before this great ride we pack our excess gear onto our support vehicle. Taking with us only the things that are necessary for the day biking that's water bottles, camera, wind jacket.

column1: Near to Lhasa the road is fairly good, but one should be careful, as this area is covered in a particular thorn bush that might get into the tyres.
The ride continues through the good road passing through the rural farm villages and fields and the traffic on the road coming to and from Lhasa, Gonggar airport, Tsedang or from Shigatse.
This beautiful day ride carries on to have lunch after a good 40 kilometers run finding a suitable spot away from the crowd of villagers and from the wind.

After lunch ride takes to another 45 k.m. distance to camp further up the town of Quxu beneath the Khamba-la. Overnight camp on the grassy field where possible. After the great first day cycling retire in the camp for refreshment, where our nepali camping crew have already set, riding before us on supporting truck with all the camping gear.
Dinner is soon followed after the late afternoon tea, with time for chat in the evening of the day's event.""
column3: s:913:""Today's great biking journey starts with a 909 metre climb to the top of Khamba-la pass at (4794m). We begin the ride with a slow start, not tiring oneself the ride continues crossing bend after bend with few traffic enroute till the top of the Khamba-la is reached after few hours of strenuous climb. At the top of this pass which offers stunning scenery of the surrounding landscapes and the snow capped peaks in the distance and as well of the deep turquoise waters of Yamdrok Tso Lake down below, where our route follows.

column1: After a great moment here, an easy descent on the dirt track leads near to the shore of the lake, passing through farm fields and villagers on horse cart, the ride after reaching the lake shore is quite gradual most of the way towards our lovely campsite just before the town of Ngartse by the lake. Reaching to the campsite after a 6-7 hours of good scenic ride. Total ride of 70 km.""
column3: s:1014:""Morning view from the camp we can see the distance mountains to the south of the lake, these are in the border of Bhutan. On leaving this nice campsite, our route turns west and eventually climbs towards the scenic pass of Karo-la at (5050m). On reaching the top of the pass it can be cold being in the gorge between the massif snow capped peaks, amazing views of the glacier and ice fall of Mt.Dzongkhags. (7206m). Time for short break or for possible lunch break at this lovely sight, at this place Drok-pa or the nomads dwells, but at present they have made a permanent house and tents on the nice grassy meadow herding yaks and sheeps and selling some semi precious crude stones and quartz to the tourist. From here it is almost downhill ride passing the village of Ralung. Then continue for another 2-3 hours almost 19 k.m. down a wonderful valley, riding through a series of colourful Tibetan villages, to our camp beneath a pass of Simi-la. (4375m). after a great 6-7 hours of good biking. Total 58 / 60 km.""
column5: s:708:""Continuing our biking journey towards the City of Gyantse, we will travel for about four hours. Starting with a 15 kilometre, easy-angled climb to the top of Simi-la and then gradual and mostly downhill stage of another 35 kms, taking almost four  hours to Gyantse.

column1: Another important town, almost a city which was unitl recently the third largest settlement in  Tibet. At Gyantse visit the Kumbum stupa. This was built in the early 15th century and contains thousands of frescoes. At Gyantse we will take the comfort of the Hotels, the hotel in Gyantse is a step down from the hotel in Lhasa but still not too bad by Tibetan standards. In Gyantse with time to visit the Kumbum monastery and its market.""
column3: s:578:""Our biking continues towards Shigatse the second largest city in Tibet after Lhasa.

column1: Today's ride covers 95 k.m. The road has recently been improved from the bumpy and rutted portion. After leaving the Gyantse biking begins on the 15 k.m of long straight sections, with no hills to climb, just vanishing points. The road follows the Nyang Chu River passing through many scattered farm villages and fields and finally approaching towards Shigatse, riding on the good wide road. On arrival after a good 6-7 hrs of ride, here again we take the overnight accommodation in the Hotel.""
column3: s:236:""In Shigatse we visit the very large complex of Tashilumpo monastery. This is the traditional residence of the Panchen Lama and contains a 27m high gold plated Buddha known as Matria (the future Buddha). Afternoon visit the local market.""
column5: s:599:""After a wonderful break at Shigatse, journey continues on the dirt road once leaving the city

column1: suburb of Shigatse, the trail climbs gradually as it makes its way to the distant Tsho-La covering 106 kms. We will be having late lunch today to gain more miles before afternoon,

lunch at a pleasant side besides the Ra Chu River beyond the village of Chemo, after 60-61 kms. Much of the section of the road has recently been tarmac, however there are more dirt section still under process of metaling. After a long vigorous 8 hours ride finally reaching to our campsite below the Tsho-La pass at 4290m.""
column3: s:729:""An easy gradual climb of about two hours over 8 kms to the Tsho-La at 4,500 metres, at the top which offers a distant view of the main Himalaya range. From the top of this pass a quick sharp descent and then coming to a 1-2 hour ride across the plains to the town of Larze.  Larze a growing town which lies at the junction of Lhasa-Kathmandu highway and to the west leading to western Tibet and to Mt.Kailash region. From here our journey continues on the main Lhasa-Kathmandu higheway, biking continues for another three hours on the dirt road with interesting views of the rural life along the way, and then finally arriving at our overnight camp halfway up to the top of Gyamtsho-la. Overnight camp is placed at about 4760m.""
column5: s:1042:""Today's ride takes us to the highest point of this trip at the top of Gyamthso-la at

column1: 5,220 metres. Starting the morning biking on the gradual portion, with some steep and rough section, the trail winds up for tough 2-3 hours and is around ten kilometres from the camp to the summit. After reaching the top, the descent is at first a gradual gradient but finally steepens into a freewheel downhill, with superb views of Mt.Everest, Lhotse and Cho Oyu. Passing through more wild Tibetan settlements, isolated monastries and coming across nomadic herders and then finally reaching to the town of Shegar for a nice short break, from here we continue our ride on the main highway for an hour and then our route diverts north east from the main road towards Rongbuk and Everest Base Camp via Pang-la. After few hours of gradual ascend coming to a small farm settlement and to the entrance of the Qumolungma (Everest) region. Depending upon the time, we might ride a little further to camp beneath the pass or just on the soutskirt of this village.""
column3: s:648:""Morning ride climbs on the winding dirt road for more than an hour to the top of the Pang-La Pass at 5,150 metres, and this is encountered less than ten kilometres after we have turned off the main Lhasa / Kathmandu highway. On reaching the top stunning views of unparalleled chain of great Himalayan peaks can be seen including Mt.Makalu, Everest, Cho Oyu and Shishapangma. After a great moment here, our route descends to a steep slope of 1010 metres downhill, with lots of switchbacks and wild cut offs, over 19 kms to the village of Phadu. From this village another 12 km ride distance reaches us at Tshusum village area for our overnight camp.""
column5: s:492:""Today's biking leads us to the world's highest monastery at Rongbuk, from the camp the ride is gradual most of the way with slow undulating climbs following the Rongbuk river upstream.

column1: Since last year the road to Everest Base Camp and to Old Tingri has been completed, the ride on this gravel road is smooth and takes less hours to reach towards our destination.
After 3-4 hours of constant ride with few breaks in between brings us to Rongbuk Monastery with great views of Mt.Everest.""
column3: s:619:""A well worth rest day to appreciate the stunning views. Today we have an option to hike, bike or a ride on the vehicle to the Base Camp. What ever the option you take, it will take about less than two hours to reach Base Camp, the ride takes on the good road following the Rongbuk river over the glacial moraine with few steep climbs as we reach just before the Base Camp. On reaching Base Camp complete view of Mt.Everest to the east. At Base Camp there are 4-5 small tented tea shops and a Government run guest house at the top of the moraine hill. After a wonderful time here, we retrace the journey back to Rongbuk.""
column5: s:1119:""Depending upon one's fitness an option for a ride on the vehicle or a long bike ride towards Old Tingri, the road leads on the same route for an hour and then coming to a newly built bridge, from the bridge the road climbs all the way to the top of Lamna-la at 5,150 metres passing through isolated herders settlement, with good clear view of Mt.Cho Oyu enroute to Old Tingri. After a hard climb to the top of Lamna-la, an easy descend leads to the well define path to the village of Lungja, from this village a gradual ride on the plain field brings us to the overnight camp at Old Tingri.

column1: From Tingri, you can have great views of Mt.Everest (8,848m) &amp
column2: Cho-Oyu (8,201m).  Tingri, a wind blown village with more than hundred of houses grouped along the base of an isolated hill. Its orginal name used to be Ganggar. Most of the good lodge and restaurent available are on the roadside, where it's a must stop for all the Trucks and other vehicle drivers and passengers for lunch and overnight halt.  Overnight camp on the grassy field near the barley and buckwheat field where there is a clean flowing stream.""
column4: s:417:""After being on the highest spot on earth our journey leads towards the Tibet / Nepal border. Morning ride begins with the stunning view of Everest and Cho Oyu on the main Lhasa to Kathmandu road, after leaving Tingri, back on the dirt road passing through several villages and finally reaching to our camp below the Laylung-la pass, after a good 4-5 hours ride covering about 55 kms distance with lunch break enroute.""
column6: s:814:""Morning ride heads uphill towards the double pass of Laylung-la and Thang-la, although being well acclamatised, it is still hard work climbing. From the camp it is about 14 kms to the first top, the Laylung at 5,124m, then dropping down 200 metres, over 6 kms and then climbing back again to further 7 kms to the summit of the main pass, the Thang-la, 5,050m.

column1: From this top stunning views of the snow capped peaks of the central himalayan range can be seen from Number, Gauri Shankar, Shisapangma to Langtang. After a great moment here, an hour steep descend reaches to the bottom of the pass, journey continues on the good level road passing through numerous farm villages and cultivated fields till Nyalam town is reached. From Nylam a short bike downhill brings us to our overnight camp just by the roadside.""
column3: s:1215:""Our last day in Tibet, cycling continues after breakfast on the downhill slope to meet the Bhote Koshi river just by the bridge, we finally leave the cold, arid Tibetan Palteau and enter the warm jungles of Nepal. The road is at first quite steep and rocky with lots of hairpin bends. Brakes takes a bit of a hammering on this section. The road enters a steep narrow gorge with many waterfalls, after 40 minutes of downhill rush, the path is gradual on this winding road, following the river downstream through the lush green forest of pines, hemlocks, oaks and rhododendrons, with beautiful waterfalls cascading just by the roadside.

column1: The journey continues going downhills and eventually coming to the border busy town of Zhangmu with a mixture of Chinese, Tibetan and Nepali people. After going through the passport fomalities, biking continues towards the Friendship Bridge where the red line divides China and Nepal. Here again on the Nepal side of the border going through the visa formalities, we continue for another 15-16 kilometres to the Last Resort beside the Bhote Koshi River. Great place to relax after the great biking adventure. Today's total biking hour approx. 4-5 hrs on the 60 km road stretch.""
column3: s:689:""Our biking journey continues on the long winding road following the Bhote Koshi with number of hairpin bends around, but compared to Tibet the day will be warm cycling through the villages and paddy fields and eventually coming down towards the town of Dolalghat, where Bhote Koshi river joins with the great Sun Koshi River. After this place, the road climbs slowly and then coming to 17 kilometres drag up to Dhulikhel perched on the rim of the Kathmandu Valley. On reaching the ridge top, we take our overnight accommodation in Dhulikhel and from this high vantage the main Himalayan chain is spread before us. Dhulikhel is famous for its outstanding view of the snow capped peak range.""
column5: s:550:""Today is our last day of this great biking adventure, we follow a partially off road 'back way' to Kathmandu passing through Nama Bhudda and Panauti village before rejoining the Friendship Highway for the final kilometres into the Kathmandu city.

column1: This ride is also an optional and anyone wishing to be earlier and to spend more time in Kathmandu will drive there directly in our supporting vehicle. Biking will reach Kathmandu in time for a late lunch. Rest of the afternoon free to rest and recuperate, and of course to clean and pack up the bikes.""
column3: s:196:""A free day in Kathmandu, please let our staff or tour officer know if you would like to go on another short tour in and around Kathmandu Valley or for scenic mountain flight or hot air ballooning.""
column5: s:243:""Today as per your international flight time, keep your confirmed air ticket, departure tax (in local currency) and your passport handy. Our Tour Officer will take you to the airport for your final departure from this amazing country, Nepal. ""
column10: On arrival at Kathmandu Tribhuvan International Airport you will be received by our staff and will escort you to the Hotel, where one of our leader or a local biking guide will give you a brief orientation of the Hotel, Kathmandu, and Biking / Camping, do's and don't and other related information that you might require while in Nepal &amp
column11: in Tibet. Our Tour Officer will ask for your Interantional flight ticket and your passport for safe keeping and for reconfiramtion of your out bound flight. Do not hesitate to do this, this is one of our routine service and it will be in the safe hand while you are on the biking trip, and after the trip you will get it back.&lt
column17: After your first night in Kathmandu, you will be well informed on arrival about the the time for your half day guided sightseeing tour in Kathmandu at places of interest. Sometime, depending upon your flight arrival if its late in the night we will do this tour in the afternoon instead of morning to give you a nice sleep and rest before you venture out of the Hotel for our interesting tour.&lt
column23: Fly from Kathmandu to Lhasa and if the weather is clear enough you can have the spectalur view of World’s highest peaks including Mount Everest. Will be received at the Airport by the Chinese Agents and will drive to our Hotel for about 2 Hours.&lt
column29: During these three days we will tour the fabled City of Lhasa. A completely forbidden City until very recent times, Lhasa was Holy Grail for many central Asian explorers of past generations. The City has of course been altered by the Chinese occupation and the impact of  foreign visitors. However much of the original character remains and whilst jostling through the Potala with crowds of ethnic Tibetans, it is hard not to be captivated by this magnificent civilisation. Visit to the great monasteries of Sera and Drepung, both of which were extensively destroyed in the cultural revolution but are now being rebuilt. We will also visit the Jokhang and of course the Potala. Lhasa is at 3,600m /12,000ft and provides an ideal acclimation for the first few days.  The relatively comfortable hotel will give members some time to get to know each other without the stress of moving.&lt
column35: Continue to explore the city of Lhasa.&lt
column41: Continue to explore the city of Lhasa.&lt
column47: After the good acclimatization at Lhasa, adventure begins with a relatively level and gradual stage, towards the bottom of the Khamba-la. Just before this great ride we pack our excess gear onto our support vehicle. Taking with us only the things that are necessary for the day biking that's water bottles, camera, wind jacket. &lt
column55: Near to Lhasa the road is fairly good, but one should be careful, as this area is covered in a particular thorn bush that might get into the tyres.&lt
column59: The ride continues through the good road passing through the rural farm villages and fields and the traffic on the road coming to and from Lhasa, Gonggar airport, Tsedang or from Shigatse.&lt
column67: This beautiful day ride carries on to have lunch after a good 40 kilometers run finding a suitable spot away from the crowd of villagers and from the wind. &lt
column71: After lunch ride takes to another 45 k.m. distance to camp further up the town of Quxu beneath the Khamba-la. Overnight camp on the grassy field where possible. After the great first day cycling retire in the camp for refreshment, where our nepali camping crew have already set, riding before us on supporting truck with all the camping gear.&lt
column79: Dinner is soon followed after the late afternoon tea, with time for chat in the evening of the day's event.&lt
column85: Today's great biking journey starts with a 909 metre climb to the top of Khamba-la pass at (4794m). We begin the ride with a slow start, not tiring oneself the ride continues crossing bend after bend with few traffic enroute till the top of the Khamba-la is reached after few hours of strenuous climb. At the top of this pass which offers stunning scenery of the surrounding landscapes and the snow capped peaks in the distance and as well of the deep turquoise waters of Yamdrok Tso Lake down below, where our route follows.&lt
column93: After a great moment here, an easy descent on the dirt track leads near to the shore of the lake, passing through farm fields and villagers on horse cart, the ride after reaching the lake shore is quite gradual most of the way towards our lovely campsite just before the town of Ngartse by the lake. Reaching to the campsite after a 6-7 hours of good scenic ride. Total ride of 70 km.&lt
column99: Morning view from the camp we can see the distance mountains to the south of the lake, these are in the border of Bhutan. On leaving this nice campsite, our route turns west and eventually climbs towards the scenic pass of Karo-la at (5050m). On reaching the top of the pass it can be cold being in the gorge between the massif snow capped peaks, amazing views of the glacier and ice fall of Mt.Dzongkhags. (7206m). (4375m). after a great 6-7 hours of good biking. Total 58 / 60 km.&lt

column2: >Rara Lake is one of the most incredible treks, located at the altitude of 2,990 meters above the sea level. Journey to Mugu Region and the Rara Lake gives you a unique experience of the next world. Such a pristine lake, beautiful landscapes, amazing lush of green forests. You can also have a glimpse of vibrant flora and faunas including endangered species like musk deer, Himalayan black bear and many more. ",,20190124,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/chilling-in-jumla-ra-ra-lake/,https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1548337234/rara-lake-3515584_utoho6.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1548337236/mountains-2470053_wy7k4m.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1548337235/nepal-306621_prpdpz.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1548337235/nepal-1423815_ujjz8t.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1548337234/lake-1970055_h2mjec.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1548337234/rara-lake_jb34fp.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1548337233/rara-lake-3515585_fxypo2.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1548337233/jeremy-thomas-363992-unsplash_g7hwjk.jpg|https://res.cloudinary.com/trekkingtopnepal/image/upload/v1548337232/sahin-yesilyaprak-546700-unsplash_glg1w6.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/01/4635927025_ca5a3ab0a1_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/01/15711043744_e7f16f82f2_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/01/15711043794_202f5ede7c_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/01/27573064758_f6bca494fb_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/01/33952233450_57b5dd0ce5_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/01/34978209706_80a9b4d423_k.jpg,"rara-lake-3515584|mountains-2470053|nepal-306621|nepal-1423815|lake-1970055|rara column3: One of the off-beaten-trek in Nepal&lt
Pristine Lake, excellent views of Mt. Doplo and Tibetan ranges&lt
Magical Landscapes, amazing lush of green forests&lt

column1: Two clients share one porter. We will supply you a trek duffel bag where you keep your heavy items and this bag is carried by the porter. You will need to bring your own daypack to be carried by you. In the daypack, you can put money, important documents, water bottle/bladder, camera, toiletries, sunscreen, notebook, etc.

The weight limit for the porter is 30 kg or 66 pounds. 15 kg or 33 pounds for each client. So, we recommend you to pack as carefully as you can and not exceed the weight limit. You can leave your non-trekking stuff at the locker facility in the Kathmandu hotel.

column3: 4-season sleeping bag (We can provide one if you need it but has to be returned after the trek.)&lt
Down jacket (Must have for mornings, nights and evenings, and for altitudes above 4,000 m
column4: We can provide it if you need one but has to be returned after the trek.)&lt

column3: Wool or synthetic hat that cover the ears&lt
Soft shell and hard shell trek pants&lt

column1: (Please note our guide will carry the first-aid kit bag during the trek. However we still recommend you to bring your personalized first-aid kit as well.)

column3: Extra Strength Excedrin for altitude related headaches&lt
Ibuprofen for general aches and pains&lt
Immodium or Pepto Bismol capsules for upset stomach or diarrhea&lt
Diamox (commonly prescribed as Acetazolamide) 125 or 250mg tablets for altitude sickness&lt
Passport and extra passport photos (3 copies)&lt
Airline ticket (Please make a copy and leave one at our office in Kathmandu just in case if you need to change the date of your flight.)&lt
Durable wallet/pouch for travel documents, money &amp
Toiletry kit (Be sure to include toilet paper stored in a plastic bag, hand wipes, and liquid hand sanitizer, towel, soap, etc.)&lt
Favorite snack foods (No more than 2 pounds)&lt
Cameras (Memory cards, chargers and also batteries)&lt
Pee bottle for men and pee funnel for women&lt

column17: s:53:""Fly from Kathmandu to Nepalgunj (150 m) Around 55 min""
column19: s:57:""Fly from Nepalgunj to Jumla (2514 m) Aproxiamately 30 min""
column21: s:87:""From Charya-Chaur to camp beneath the unnamed grassy pass (3500m) - approx 6 hours walk""
column23: s:62:""Trek to Botan (2680m) via Sinja Khola (2440m) - approx 7 hours""
column25: s:44:""Trek to Rara Border (3190m) - approx 4 hours""
column27: s:42:""Trek to Rara Lake (2980m) - approx 7 hours""
column31: s:45:""Trek to River Camp or Pina via Jhyari (2580m)""
column33: s:70:""Trek to Chauta (2770m) via Ghurchi Lagna Pass (3460m) - approx 6 hours""
column37: s:39:""Trek to Jumla (2514 m) - approx 6 hours""
column43: s:51:""Transfer to Airport for the International departure""
column46: s:296:""On arrival at Kathmandu Tribhuvan International Airport you will be received by our staff and will escort you to the Hotel, where our guide will give you a brief orientation of the Hotel, Kathmandu, Trek/Camping, do's and don't and other related information that you might require while in Nepal.""
column48: s:166:""After your first night in Kathmandu, you will be well informed on arrival about the time for your half day guided sightseeing tour in Kathmandu at places of interest.""
column50: s:325:""As per the flight schedule for Nepalgunj we transfer to the domestic airport for one and half hour scenic flight to Nepaljung. At Nepalgunj will have time in the late afternoon or evening to have a look around the town which is situated on the southern Nepal border with India. Here it is quite hot and tropical in character.""
column52: s:1143:""After a pleasant overnight at Nepalgunj, early morning transfer to airport for half hour flight to Jumla over the Himalayan foothills, with views of the distant snow capped peaks. On arrival at Jumla our trekking staffs will receive you, who have walked all the way from Nepalgunj with the camping gear and food supply taking 5-6 days. Jumla is the largest upland town in the Karnali District, Nepal's most sparsely-populated adminstrative zone with no roads communication and is only accessible on foot or by air.

column1: We will have time to explore Jumla to see the bazaar and temple dedicated to Chandan Nath, a mythical saint who defeated serpents demon and emptied the lake which flooded the valley. Some half an hour's walk from Jumla towards the college is the small village of Micha where, in a small walled enclosure, stand a number of stone stupas telling of the Buddhist history. The stupas were erected in memory of important dignitaries of the region and date back from the late 15th century. From here we take a short walk climbing away from the Jumla Valley to the campsite at Charya Chaur high above the Karnali Technical College.""
column3: s:446:""Our day start with a morning climb through birch and pine forests to the unnamed grassy pass sometime known as Jaljala. As the walk progress view of Kanjiroba himal can be seen to the east, with its twin peaks that towers over the adjacent area. At afternoon we descent of about 870m through beautiful forests and find a suitable spot for overnight camping on the pastures with a nearby Shepard's hut after a relatively moderate day on the trail.""
column5: s:1335:""Our morning walk completes the descent to Sinja by following the Jaljala Khola downstream through forests with immense gnarled pines and through terraced farmland. Just before the final descent to Sinja the trail passes the 300 year old Kanaksundari Temple where ancient stone lions guard the inner sanctum. Sinja was once the ancient and thriving winter capital of the Malla kings and a few Malla stones dating from the medieval Khasa kingdom can still be seen alongside the trail on its steep, low knob. The trail passes south of the peaked, white temple and descends to the main river, crossing a thick plant bridge at a place where the water has cut a deep, narrow furrow through bedrock. Sinja village rests upon a small alluvial plain on the west bank of the clear Lah Gad River, here called the Sinja River.

column1: The ruined town actually stood on the east bank of the Sinja Khola, at a place known as Kotgaon or Lamathada, where you can poke among ancient sculptured stones overgrown with weeds. Just north of Sinja stone-bound aeries once used by meditating re-annunciates are visible along the rock walls. Maybe we will have lunch stop or a short break near the bridge over the Khola and then following the river upstream passing by the small village of Ganj through a spectacular gorge to the campsite at the village of Botan.""
column3: s:452:""Today will be a short walk to the entrance of the Rara Lake National Park where we camp. Our route leaves the Sinja Khola from Botan to follow the Ghatte Khola north and then walking towards north-eastwards up a beautiful miniture valley through farmland and past primitive flour mills to enter the Rara National Park at the Ghorasain police post, with enough time for short walk around or catch up on some laundry or simply enjoy a relaxing afternoon.""
column5: s:524:""Leaving the Ghorasain campsite our route leads to a climb all the way to the Chuchemara Danda ridge at about 4,260m which will take us nearly 2 hours, the climb is not too hard and on reaching the crest of the ridge an excellent panorama can be seen against the northern horizon. Descending the trail northwards, Rara Lake will soon be seen to the north-east and the trail passes through bamboo and birch forests before crossing the Khatyar Khola which is followed upstream to our overnight camp near the shore of Rara Lake.""
column7: s:274:""A rest day to explore and climb up to the wooden observation tower for fine views of the lake and surrounding hills. The National Park Headquarters can be visited and a leaflet about the National Park can be obtained there. Swimming is allowed in the lake and is refreshing.""
column9: s:565:""Another short day on the trail to leave Rara Lake behind and cross a ridge to the villge of Jhyari, following the Jhyari Bira Khola downstream for only short way, the route then crosses into the Dhauligar Khola valley to our overnight campsite beside the river. Farming is very evident in these valleys with terraced fields on all but the steepest slopes and snow capped peaks will be seen to the north east. We can (time permitting and willingness of the group and the porters) also trek on to a delightful campsite at Pina if we want to make the next day shorter.""
column11: s:551:""From the campsite on the Dhauligar Khola, our walk leads through farmland to the village of Pina where there is a police post and a small local hotel before climbing to the Ghurchi pass. The long climb from Pina is mostly through forests with fine views to the north which are best enjoyed during rest stops. The pass is marked by several chortens and the trail then descends across alpine pastures, through walnut groves and to a steep narrow valley all the way to the village of Chauta for our overnight stop, where there are shops and local hotels.""
column13: s:473:""Our journey from Chauta follows the northern bank of the Sinja khola through Bumra and past the small hotel and health clinic under the massive overhanging rock at Kamra, source of the important medicinal mineral, Silaji. Descending to the Sinja Khola the route passes the village of Nyawre, supplied by hydroelectricity, to the next bridge upstream before climbing for some 600meters to the pasture at Tharamara, we will be camping here or an hour further above Tharamara.""
column15: s:491:""Our last day of trekking begins slowly and gradually dropping down a really lovely valley from high alpine pastures, through magnificent forests and eventually into a fertile well farmed valley. It has pretty little villages such as Padmara and the track is not too steep and following the same river all the way down to Jumla. This makes a nice circuit and avoids having a repeat part of the outward trek. On reaching Jumla rest of the afternoon can be spent exploring the busy market town.""
column17: s:392:""Early morning 30 minutes sweeping wonderful flight to Nepalgunj over the Himalayan foothills, overlooking stunning views of the snow capped peaks. On arrival at Nepalgunj depending upon the connecting flight schedule to Kathmandu. If its in the afternoon we will have time, few hours for refreshment in the comfort of the Hotel Batika at Nepalgunj, then connect with flight back to Kathmandu.""
column19: s:129:""A free day in Kathmandu and please inform our staff if you would like to go on another short tour in and around Kathmandu Valley.""
column21: s:199:""Today as per your international flight time, keep your confirmed air ticket, and your passport handy. Our staff will take you to the airport for your final departure from this amazing country, Nepal.""

Journey to Mugu Region and the Rara Lake gives you a unique experience of the next world. Such a pristine lake, beautiful landscapes, amazing lush of green forests. You can also have a...","Visit Nepal's largest Rara lake in the western himalayas mountain range, isolated traditional villages, high scenic passes in complete wilderness.",,"a:11:{s:6:""enable""

column2: >13-days Jomsom Muktinath Trek is one of the pleasing treks in Nepal where you will be able to encounter the plains of Terai, exciting landscapes of Hilly region, massive mountains and also the Himalayan desert at once.

>The trek starts from Kathmandu with the tour of UNESCO world heritage sites. We trek in the appealing and beautiful Annapurna Region and enter into the Mustang Region, which is beyond the Himalayas. The trekking trail passes through the amazing lush green forests, high cascading waterfalls, dramatic landscapes encountering excellent paddy, corns and maize fields.

>The trail follows the deepest gorge of Kaligandaki then passes through the Muktinath Temple, the holy place for both Hindus and Buddhists. Therefore, the trip is also called Pilgrimage Tour for many Hindu and Buddhist people. Muktinath is the highest point of the trek, lies at an altitude of 3710m. The trekking marks its completion by a downhill trek to Jomsom then a drive back to Pokhara.",,20190328,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/jomsom-muktinath-pilgrimage-adventure/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/4463004302_23dee2a5e8_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/1340296468_e01dfc7f79_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/2423192376_524c71e852_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/2957775621_7894661b8f_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/4463004062_aed1b4602e_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/8252597479_f3b8716eff_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/8314441355_8e09b4067f_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/8680312053_8e0d156a4f_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/8755271361_145345461a_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/10672965465_3363d83961_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/15327839968_c44e0c0f66_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/16797750484_9395d55429_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/23223743551_0467327210_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/30027560347_182fe7ae06_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/31444682417_1777108367_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/33115554393_315f589c0e_b.jpg,4463004302_23dee2a5e8_o|1340296468_e01dfc7f79_o|2423192376_524c71e852_b|2957775621_7894661b8f_o|4463004062_aed1b4602e_o|8252597479_f3b8716eff_k|8314441355_8e09b4067f_k|8680312053_8e0d156a4f_k|8755271361_145345461a_b|10672965465_3363d83961_b|15327839968_c44e0c0f66_k|16797750484_9395d55429_b|23223743551_0467327210_b|30027560347_182fe7ae06_k|31444682417_1777108367_k|33115554393_315f589c0e_b,|||||||||||||||,|||||||||||||||,|||||||||||||||,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/4463004302_23dee2a5e8_o.jpg,,"Himalayas>Annapurna column11: Encounter with amazing lush green forests full with vibrant colors of flowers throughout the Annapurna foothill.&lt
The waterfalls originates from the massive Dhaulagiri and Annapurna ranges makes the deepest gorge in the world, Kali Gandaki gorge.&lt
Stay with local people at Jomsom and experience their culture and tradition.&lt
Taste the organic apples at Jomsom, and the wine made from those. &lt
Swimming at the natural hot water of Tatopani. &lt

column1: Two clients share one porter. We will supply you a trek duffel bag where you keep your heavy items and this bag is carried by the porter. You will need to bring your own daypack to be carried by you. In the daypack, you can put money, important documents, water bottle/bladder, camera, toiletries, sunscreen, notebook, etc. The weight limit for the porter is 30 kg or 66 pounds. 15 kg or 33 pounds for each client. So, we recommend you to pack as carefully as you can and not exceed the weight limit. You can leave your non-trekking stuff at the locker facility in the Kathmandu hotel.

column3: 4-season sleeping bag (We can provide one if you need it but has to be returned after the trek)&lt
Down jacket (Must have for mornings, nights and evenings, and for altitudes above 4,000 m
column4: We can provide it if you need one but has to be returned after the trek.)&lt

column3: Wool or synthetic hat that cover the ears&lt
Soft shell and hard shell trekking pants&lt

column1: (Please note our guide will carry the first-aid kit bag during the trek. However we still recommend you to bring your personalized first-aid kit as well.)

column3: Extra Strength Excedrin for altitude related headaches&lt
Ibuprofen for general aches and pains&lt
Immodium or Pepto Bismol capsules for upset stomach or diarrhea&lt
Diamox (commonly prescribed as Acetazolamide) 125 or 250mg tablets for altitude sickness&lt
Passport and extra passport photos (3 copies)&lt
Airline ticket (Please make a copy and leave one at our office in Kathmandu just in case if you need to change the date of your flight.)&lt
Durable wallet/pouch for travel documents, money &amp
Toiletry kit (Be sure to include toilet paper stored in a plastic bag, hand wipes, and liquid hand sanitizer, towel, soap, etc.)&lt
Favorite snack foods (No more than 2 pounds)&lt
Cameras (Memory cards, chargers and also batteries)&lt
Pee bottle for men and pee funnel for women&lt

column17: s:41:""Drive to Pokhara (827 m) - approx 7 hours""
column23: s:50:""Trek from Ghorepani to Tatopani (1190 m) (7-8 hrs)""
column27: s:39:""Ghasa to Marpha (2650 m)  around 10 hrs""
column29: s:39:""Marpha to Kagbeni (2804 m) around 6 hrs""
column31: s:44:""Kagbeni to Muktinath (3710 m) around 4 hours""
column37: s:46:""Drive from Pokhara to Kathmandu (around 6 hrs)""
column42: s:170:""Our airport representative will be receiving you at Tribhuvan International Airport. You will be then transferred to your respective hotel in our private tourist vehicle.""
column44: s:243:""After a hearty breakfast, at 8.30 am your sightseeing trip will start. You will have a private vehicle and a professional tour guide at your disposal. Today we will visit Hindus and  Buddhists sites, Pashupatinath Temple and Bouddhanath Stupa.""
column46: s:431:""On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and head towards tourist Bus Park at Thamel and board a tourist bus to Pokhara. The bus ride will take around 7 hours through curvy roads of hilly terrain with couple of breaks in between for snacks and lunch. The drive to Pokhara on one of the major highways is exhilarating with beautiful views of never leaving tributaries, lush green hills and roadside settlements.""
column48: s:215:""The day starts early by taking a vehicle out of Pokhara. The drive takes around an hour and half to Nayapul and  we start our trip towards Ulleri hiking through jeep track way and a little bit of uphill stone steps.""
column50: s:203:""Walking through the beautiful Lord of the Rings like trail set-up is overwhelming and getting to Ghorepani the leading protected area in Nepal with the world largest Rhododendron forest is extraordinary.""
column52: s:402:""An early morning excursion to Poonhill offers you the breathtaking Himalayan sunrise views of Dhaulagiri massif, Annapurna I, Annapurna South, Annapurna II, Lamjung Himal, Hiuchuli, Mt Fishtail etc. Climbing down from Poonhill, we take a breakfast at Ghorepani and start our trip to Tatopani via Ghaja Khola. At tatopani, many people enjoy their spear time by swimming or bathing at natural hot spring.""
column54: s:200:""A lovely day walk through the world's deepest Kaligandaki gorge take you to the Ghasa crossing several suspension bridges. The beautiful village of Ghasa marks the cultural and ethological importance.""
column56: s:237:""A walk from diverese vegetation with the narrow rushing gorge of water takes you to Marpha. This village has a strong hold of Thakali tribes of people. Marpha has organic apples garden where you can taste the local wines made from those.""
column58: s:281:""An easy day hike along the riverside of Jomsom leads to Kagbeni. The trails follows the interesting footpath via thini, gompa, and syang which offers the picturesque of old towns and monasteries. Kagbeni is a small medieval village, closely packed with mud houses and dark tunnels.""
column60: s:525:""Mustang region is known as the desert valley of Nepal. So, we cannot find any vegetations despite some wheat fields. Here, you will experience the amazingly blown winds after the middle day. In order to avoid this we start our trek from very early morning gradually ascending to Muktinath, a famous pilgrimage site for both Hindus and Buddhists. It is believed that if you bath in the frigid water of 108 taps in Muktinath, the sins you have committed throughout your life will be washed away. Overnight we stay at Muktinath.""
column62: s:157:""Trek through the ancient caves, dramatic landscapes with the views of impressive white snow-capped mountains leads us to Jomsom. Overnight we stay at Jomsom.""
column64: s:203:""On this very day, we take flight back to Pokhara and spend a day here. You have a spear time at Pokhara, where you can enjoy the beauty of mother nature by boating in the Phewa Lake or roaming around it.""
column66: s:316:""On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and get ready to head towards Kathmandu. The bus ride will take around 7 hours through curvy roads of hilly terrain with couple of breaks in between for snacks and lunch. Tracing the same way back we reach Kathmandu and we transfer you back at the hotel.""
column68: s:171:""Today we say our final goodbye. Our representative will come to see you off at the airport. Hoping you had a pleasant and wonderful trekking experience we bid you goodbye.""

column44: >","13-days Jomsom Muktinath Trek is one of the pleasing treks in Nepal where you will be able to encounter the plains of Terai, exciting landscapes of Hilly region, massive mountains and also the Himalayan desert at once. The trek starts from Kathmandu with the tour of UNESCO world heritage sites...","Trek through the world's deepest galigandaki gorge to explore the hidden valley of Mustang passing the pilgrimage Muktinath temple at 3710m.",,"a:17:{s:6:""enable""

column2: >Visiting the most pristine and highest placed Tilicho Lake (4949m) has been the dreams for many explorers around the world. It is a glacier-fed lake surrounded by crystal clear mountains, plenty of indigenous folklore, and extreme environment with the presence of a strong spiritualness.

>Since the trek is connected to the legendary Annapurna Region area, the trail provides the fascinating and magnificent views of massif Annapurna and Dhaulagiri ranges along with the real taste of trekking in this area. The Tilicho pass trekking might be quite challenging due to difficult terrain. However, it is acceptable that the beautiful sceneries of Manang and Tilicho treat you surprisingly.",,20190331,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/annapurna-tilicho-pass-trekking/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/7484074568_08edd9932f_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/2998423922_6e8250db20_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/4230385525_29f679930d_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/5218464266_f04ecca5b9_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/6467587215_c25bba549d_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/9059459270_6d1adc13bf_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/13993874136_bbb97230f6_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/16038918236_7310d6a64e_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/31181542518_d3164ce6eb_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/33602205716_a51d9e364c_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/34710729853_4039f3e2cd_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/35481069666_6619e3b348_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/37598529644_2cbe6fa64a_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/46680902701_bc232140ed_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/46680902831_0197cbd2e8_o.jpg,"Adventurous Annapurna Tilicho Pass Trekking|2998423922_6e8250db20_o|Tilicho|5218464266_f04ecca5b9_b|6467587215_c25bba549d_b|9059459270_6d1adc13bf_k|13993874136_bbb97230f6_b|16038918236_7310d6a64e_k|31181542518_d3164ce6eb_o|33602205716_a51d9e364c_b|34710729853_4039f3e2cd_k|35481069666_6619e3b348_o|37598529644_2cbe6fa64a_b|46680902701_bc232140ed_o|46680902831_0197cbd2e8_o","||Arrived at camp befroe climbing to tilicho lake. column11: Visit one of the most sacred and pristine highest placed Tilicho Lake on the Earth.&lt
Amazing Annapurna Himalaya Ranges and dramatic landscapes around Manang Region.&lt
Explore thousands of years old monasteries, chortens and trekking trails.&lt
Stay with local people and experience their culture.&lt
Walk through the banks of rushing Kaligandaki river that is originated from massive ranges of Dhaulagiri and Annapurna.&lt
Cross one of the highest viewpoints, Thorang La Pass.&lt

column29: s:41:""Siri Kharka to Tilicho Base Camp (5000 m)""
column31: s:44:""Explore Tilicho Lake and back to Siri Kharka""
column33: s:44:""Trek from Siri Kharka to Yak Kharka (4018 m)""
column43: s:40:""Drive from Pokhara to Kathmandu (1400 m)""
column48: s:197:""Our representative will meet you on your arrival at the Airport and transfer you to the Hotel. An information session about the program will be conducted by our Tour Guide. Overnight stay in Hotel.""
column50: s:346:""Early in the morning after breakfast, our tour guide will takes you for the sightseeing around the Kathmandu, the sightseeing site are- Hindu temple of Pashupatinath, and Buddhists shrine (Bouddhanath) which is one of the large Stupas in the world. In the late afternoon you will have preparation for the trek and you can buy necessary equipment.""
column52: s:323:""On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and head towards tourist Bus Park and board a tourist bus to Besisahar. Then we take a jeep to Chamje. The drive to Chamje on one of the major highways is exhilarating with beautiful views of never leaving tributaries, lush green hills and roadside settlements.""
column54: s:151:""After a breakfast at Chamje, we head towards the bank of Marshyangdi river steeply upwards to Dharapani village, the first village in Mustang district.""
column56: s:229:""The trail towards the headquarter of Manang district- Chame treats you with the beautiful views of Annapurna ranges and the sceneries around. There are also two small hot springs crossing by the village. Tonight we stay at Chame.""
column58: s:185:""The trail towards the narrow valley with lush green forests leads us steeply towards Pisang. On the way, we cross several rivers through suspension bridges. Overnight we stay at Pisang.""
column60: s:266:""Today, we head towards the dry and barren landscapes towards high terrain of Manang district, beyond himalayas. This area does not experience rainfall. The people settling in this area partailly raise crops in only certain times of the year. Overnight at Guesthouse.""
column62: s:277:""We follow path down to river and through the western gates and coniferous forests. Then we head steeply uphill towards Siri Kharka passing through the monastery on the way. You can watch the beautiful picturesque of Gunggang Himal and Mt. Chulu. We stay at Siri Kharka tonight.""
column64: s:189:""Today's walk might be slightly challenging due to walking into the middle of landslide area. Here you can see the impressive rock formations along the trail. Overnight at Tilicho Base Camp.""
column66: s:304:""The steep hike through yak and deer grazing and watershed areas leads to the famous and sacred water Tilicho Lake. This is one of the most holiest lake for Hindus which is also mentioned in Ramayan. It is also commonly called the Great Ice Lake. After spending sometime here, we head back to Siri Kharka.""
column68: s:224:""After an early morning breakfast at Siri Kharka, we head towards Yak Kharka through the ancient monastery- Tare Gumba. On the way, we encounter Khangasar village through Thorang Khola Valley. Overnight we stay at Yak Kharka.""
column70: s:119:""We cross the another river at 4310 meters and head towards High Camp. After delicious breakfast, we head towards Phedi.""
column72: s:274:""Today's steep uphill walk rewards with crossing one of the beat viewpoints and pass in Annapurna Region, the Thorang La Pass. The way towards the pass are covered by chortens, stupas, tibetan prayer flags, and of course the beautiful sceneries. Tonight we stay at Muktinath.""
column74: s:235:""On this day we will visit the Muktinath Temple at early morning, and after breakfast we head towards the Jomsom enjoying the best landscapes, vegetations, sceneries, and picturesque that Nepal has to offer. Overnight we stay at Jomsom.""
column76: s:126:""We fly back from Jomsom to Pokhara from Jomsom Airport and transfer to hotel. The remaining spear time is to chill at Pokhara.""
column78: s:316:""On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and get ready to head towards Kathmandu. The bus ride will take around 7 hours through curvy roads of hilly terrain with couple of breaks in between for snacks and lunch. Tracing the same way back we reach Kathmandu and we transfer you back at the hotel.""
column80: s:171:""Today we say our final goodbye. Our representative will come to see you off at the airport. Hoping you had a pleasant and wonderful trekking experience we bid you goodbye.""

column111: After a breakfast at Chamje, we head towards the bank of Marshyangdi river steeply upwards to Dharapani village, the first village in Mustang district.&lt
column121: The trail towards the headquarter of Manang district- Chame treats you with the beautiful views of Annapurna ranges and the sceneries around. There are also two small hot springs crossing by the village. Tonight we stay at Chame.&lt
column131: The trail towards the narrow valley with lush green forests leads us steeply towards Pisang. On the way, we cross several rivers through suspension bridges. Overnight we stay at Pisang.&lt
column141: Today, we head towards the dry and barren landscapes towards high terrain of Manang district, beyond himalayas. This area does not experience rainfall. The people settling in this area partailly raise crops in only certain times of the year. Overnight at Guesthouse.&lt
column147: We follow path down to river and through the western gates and coniferous forests. Then we head steeply uphill towards Siri Kharka passing through the monastery on the way. You can watch the beautiful picturesque of Gunggang Himal and Mt. Chulu. We stay at Siri Kharka tonight.&lt
column153: Today's walk might be slightly challenging due to walking into the middle of landslide area. Here you can see the impressive rock formations along the trail. Overnight at Tilicho Base Camp.&lt
column163: The steep hike through yak and deer grazing and watershed areas leads to the famous and sacred water Tilicho Lake. This is one of the most holiest lake for Hindus which is also mentioned in Ramayan. It is also commonly called the Great Ice Lake. After spending sometime here, we head back to Siri Kharka.&lt
column169: After an early morning breakfast at Siri Kharka, we head towards Yak Kharka through the ancient monastery- Tare Gumba. On the way, we encounter Khangasar village through Thorang Khola Valley. Overnight we stay at Yak Kharka.&lt
column179: We cross the another river at 4310 meters and head towards High Camp. After delicious breakfast, we head towards Phedi.&lt
column189: Today's steep uphill walk rewards with crossing one of the beat viewpoints and pass in Annapurna Region, the Thorang La Pass. The way towards the pass are covered by chortens, stupas, tibetan prayer flags, and of course the beautiful sceneries. Tonight we stay at Muktinath.&lt
column195: On this day we will visit the Muktinath Temple at early morning, and after breakfast we head towards the Jomsom enjoying the best landscapes, vegetations, sceneries, and picturesque that Nepal has to offer. Overnight we stay at Jomsom.&lt
column205: We fly back from Jomsom to Pokhara from Jomsom Airport and transfer to hotel. The remaining spear time is to chill at Pokhara.&lt
column215: On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and get ready to head towards Kathmandu. The bus ride will take around 7 hours through curvy roads of hilly terrain with couple of breaks in between for snacks and lunch. Tracing the same way back we reach Kathmandu and we transfer you back at the hotel.&lt
column225: Today we say our final goodbye. Our representative will come to see you off at the airport. Hoping you had a pleasant and wonderful trekking experience we bid you goodbye.&lt

column44: >","Visiting the most pristine and highest placed Tilicho Lake (4949m) has been the dreams for many explorers around the world. It is a glacier-fed lake surrounded by crystal clear mountains, plenty of indigenous folklore, and extreme environment with the presence of a strong spiritualness. Since...","Walk through the grassy slope lands near the bank of Kaligandaki river. Experience the trekking into the highest placed glacier-fed Tilicho Lake at 4949m.",6,"a:16:{s:6:""enable""

column1: 6528,"Kids Friendly Lower Annapurna Royal Trek","The royal trek(1730m) is one of the shortest and easiest treks in the foothill of Annapurna. The blend of diverse cultures with superb views of Mt. Fishtail and Annapurna ranges at the northern highlands makes this trek one of the most exhilarating trips in the Annapurna Region.

The trek is very suitable for beginners, hikers with moderate, for the kids as well. Less crowd of tourists, more remote places to explore, and easy uphill steps are the main characteristics features of the trek. This beautiful journey of exploration begins from a day drive to the city of beautiful lakes
column2: Pokhara passing through the Gurung settlements, layered rice terrains, and lush green forests. The trekking trail marks its completion at Begnas Lake, 30km west of Pokhara city.",,20190331,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/trek-nepal-with-kids-royal-trek/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/15309067318_10904efec6_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/192872101_bd102e26c0_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/198655830_41b0c2821a_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/210207680_ad4808810a_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/2988017934_b483ac5993_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/2988041952_0268076cb5_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/4350285983_f76dd185c9_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/9257537031_b533863702_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/12219140416_9aeea49ff7_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/15698918054_742ae08f35_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/15955545881_150f66141b_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/16749072181_c7a90aeab9_z.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/29627253744_149fd0f1d4_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/33845686613_e068b20028_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/37701505485_6d2b6adfee_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/43835232062_9a3066ef5c_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/827541277_4f4eb9e579_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/4354071114_0cd85562b1_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/6751320375_8b266390f7_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/7436892856_4fc38aa6d8_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/8617648149_af23dd85b8_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/8933162948_16e016cf71_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/9737476623_83554ed039_b.jp column3: Start your trip with a light evening walk around the Phewa Lake in Pokhara.&lt
Captivating views of spectacular Mt. Fishtail, Langtang Himal, Mt. Annapurna and its ranges.&lt
Stay with local people, Gurungs and Magar tribes of people, and experience their culture&lt
Excellent layered rice terrains of along the way.&lt
Boat across the natural serene Begnas Lake.&lt

column1: Two clients share one porter. We will supply you a trek duffel bag where you keep your heavy items and this bag is carried by the porter. You will need to bring your own daypack to be carried by you. In the daypack, you can put money, important documents, water bottle/bladder, camera, toiletries, sunscreen, notebook, etc. The weight limit for the porter is 30 kg or 66 pounds. 15 kg or 33 pounds for each client. So, we recommend you to pack as carefully as you can and not exceed the weight limit. You can leave your non-trekking stuff at the locker facility in the Kathmandu hotel.

column3: 4-season sleeping bag (We can provide one if you need it but has to be returned after the trek)&lt
Down jacket (Must have for mornings, nights and evenings, and for altitudes above 4,000 m
column4: We can provide it if you need one but has to be returned after the trek.)&lt

column3: Wool or synthetic hat that cover the ears&lt
Soft shell and hard shell trekking pants&lt

column1: (Please note our guide will carry the first-aid kit bag during the trek. However we still recommend you to bring your personalized first-aid kit as well.)

column3: Extra Strength Excedrin for altitude related headaches&lt
Ibuprofen for general aches and pains&lt
Immodium or Pepto Bismol capsules for upset stomach or diarrhea&lt
Diamox (commonly prescribed as Acetazolamide) 125 or 250mg tablets for altitude sickness&lt
Passport and extra passport photos (3 copies)&lt
Airline ticket (Please make a copy and leave one at our office in Kathmandu just in case if you need to change the date of your flight.)&lt
Durable wallet/pouch for travel documents, money &amp
Toiletry kit (Be sure to include toilet paper stored in a plastic bag, hand wipes, and liquid hand sanitizer, towel, soap, etc.)&lt
Favorite snack foods (No more than 2 pounds)&lt
Cameras (Memory cards, chargers and also batteries)&lt
Pee bottle for men and pee funnel for women&lt

column32: s:197:""Our representative will meet you on your arrival at the Airport and transfer you to the Hotel. An information session about the program will be conducted by our Tour Guide. Overnight stay in Hotel.""
column34: s:419:""Early in the morning after breakfast, our tour guide will takes you for the sightseeing around the Kathmandu, the sightseeing site are- Durbar Square, the sacred Hindu temple of Pashupatinath, the famous ‘Monkey Temple’ (Swayambhunath) and Buddhists shrine (Bouddhanath) which is one of the large Stupas in the world. In the late afternoon you will have preparation for the trek and you can buy necessary equipment.""
column36: s:431:""On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and head towards tourist Bus Park at Thamel and board a tourist bus to Pokhara. The drive to Pokhara on one of the major highways is exhilarating with beautiful views of never leaving tributaries, lush green hills and roadside settlements.""
column38: s:251:""After breakfast at the heart of Phewa Lake, we take a jeep and proceed to Bijayapur. From here we  start our journey toward Kalikasthan crossing several paddy fields. We cross a small river and descend to Kalikasthan. Overnight we stay at Kalikasthan.""
column40: s:238:""Today, we start our journey through the settlements of local people, rhododendron forests towards Syaklung. We pass by a ridge from where we can see spectacular views of Lamjung Himal and its ranges. This is the highest point of the trek.""
column42: s:222:""An early morning rise from Syaklung through the ethnic Gurung village offers you to explore the local lifestyle of the people. Descending through diverse rhododendron forests and pine trees, we stay overnight at Chisapani.""
column44: s:208:""After a breakfast, we descend towards Begnas Lake. This Lake is also known as freshwater lake in Pokhara. After a nice drink, we enjoy our spear time in Begnas Lake by boating. Then we take a jeep to Pokhara.""

column1: 6551,"Short Everest View Trek","This short Everest base camp trip is designed for those travelers with very limited time, yet who have an enduring desire to wave the almighty Everest. On this short Everest Base camp trek, you will be able to experience astounding mountain views.

Everest Short Trek starts with an exhilarating Himalayan flight towards Lukla from Kathmandu. Then we continue our trek towards Khumbu Region. The trek offers you to explore the culture and lifestyle of legendary and brave mountain climbers ‘Sherpa’ in the Namche Bazaar. Namche Bazaar is the popular trading center of the Everest region and also the one and only gateway to Everest.

We will settle the majority of our trek in Khumbu Region. It offers you the excellent views of Khumbu ranges and ice floating Khumbu glacier-fed lakes. Breakfast in the Everest View hotel treats you with the nose-tip view of the great Mount Everest.

column3: Breathtaking Himalayan flight from Kathmandu to Lukla offers the captivating views of some Ganesh Himal, Manaslu, Langtang Himal ranges, and Jugal.&lt
Walk through the bank of Dudh- Koshi to Everest National Park and encounter with vibrant rhododendron, maple, oak etc.&lt
Explore the Himalayan city 'Namche Bazaar' and experience lifestyle and culture of brave and legendary Sherpa people.&lt
Excellent view of the great Mount Everest from the Syangboche/Khumjung along with icefloating Khumbu glaciers.&lt

column1: Two clients share one porter. We will supply you a trek duffel bag where you keep your heavy items and this bag is carried by the porter. You will need to bring your own daypack to be carried by you. In the daypack, you can put money, important documents, water bottle/bladder, camera, toiletries, sunscreen, notebook, etc. The weight limit for the porter is 30 kg or 66 pounds. 15 kg or 33 pounds for each client. So, we recommend you to pack as carefully as you can and not exceed the weight limit. You can leave your non-trekking stuff at the locker facility in the Kathmandu hotel.

column3: 4-season sleeping bag (We can provide one if you need it but has to be returned after the trek)&lt
Down jacket (Must have for mornings, nights and evenings, and for altitudes above 4,000 m
column4: We can provide it if you need one but has to be returned after the trek.)&lt

column3: Wool or synthetic hat that cover the ears&lt
Soft shell and hard shell trekking pants&lt

column1: (Please note our guide will carry the first-aid kit bag during the trek. However we still recommend you to bring your personalized first-aid kit as well.)

column3: Extra Strength Excedrin for altitude related headaches&lt
Ibuprofen for general aches and pains&lt
Immodium or Pepto Bismol capsules for upset stomach or diarrhea&lt
Diamox (commonly prescribed as Acetazolamide) 125 or 250mg tablets for altitude sickness&lt
Passport and extra passport photos (3 copies)&lt
Airline ticket (Please make a copy and leave one at our office in Kathmandu just in case if you need to change the date of your flight.)&lt
Durable wallet/pouch for travel documents, money &amp
Toiletry kit (Be sure to include toilet paper stored in a plastic bag, hand wipes, and liquid hand sanitizer, towel, soap, etc.)&lt
Favorite snack foods (No more than 2 pounds)&lt
Cameras (Memory cards, chargers and also batteries)&lt
Pee bottle for men and pee funnel for women&lt

column15: s:41:""Fly to Lukla and trek to Phakding (2610m)""
column19: s:67:""Namche Bazzar to Syangboche and Everest View Hotel Khumjung (3780m)""
column28: s:207:""Our representative will meet you on your arrival at the Airport and transfer you to the Hotel. An information session about the program will be conducted by our Tour Guide. Overnight stay in Hotel.(B/B plan)""
column30: s:284:""Early morning drives to Tribhuwan International Airport and then 35-minute scenic flight to Lukla airport. In Lukla, you will be introduced with your Guide and Porters. Our Everest Panoramic Trekking starts from here passing along the left bank of Dudh Koshi before reaching Phakding.""
column32: s:741:""From Phakding, our trail crosses the suspension bridge over the Dudh-Kosi. The walk is pleasant with few short uphill and downhill, with magnificent views of Thermasarkhu (6,608m), then reaching a small village of Monjo, the entrance of Sagarmatha National Park. A short descent to the Jorsaleand Village and the trail levels for some time. We are now heading towards Namche Bazaar- the walk along the riverbed is pleasant before winding uphill path, with the magnificent view of Kwangde peak, Kusum kangru Mt.Everest- Nuptse wall, Lhotse, and Taweche peak in the background. Namche Bazaar is the capital of Sherpa people, distinct for its colorful houses, monasteries located at high altitude. We will be careful to avoid altitude sickness.""
column34: s:370:""This day we will hike to Syangboche Airport (3700m) which is the highest airport in the world. From Namche Bazzar, we continue to trek to Everest View Hotel for great panoramic views of the Mt. Everest, Lhotse, Amadablam, Tawache etc. We also visit Sherpa Culture Museum and Everest Photo Gallery. Overnight at Guesthouse with full breakfast, lunch, and dinner included.""
column36: s:454:""The trail descends steeply so we have to be very careful. We will be crossing the suspension bridge over the Dudh Koshi. We can see many Rhododendron, and pine trees on the way and we can also get the view of beautiful snow capped mountains. We will be crossing Sherpa Villages where you can experience the impressive faith in Buddhism and culture of prayer stones and prayer flags. On arriving Lukla, we can get fresh and enjoy out last day of the trek.""
column38: s:238:""We will have our breakfast and then grab our bags and move towards the Tenzing-Hillary Airport from where we will be flying back to Kathmandu. After the exciting trek, you can relax at the hotel as this will be your last day in Kathmandu.""
column40: s:231:""Today is your last day in Kathmandu. Hope you have enjoyed your trip with us in Nepal. As per your flight time, you will be transferred to the international Airport for your departure back to your country. We hope to see you again!""

column1: 6552,"Panorama Panchase Family Trek","Panchase trek is an easier trek. Each day of hiking day is not more than 3 to 4 hours which make it ideal for the hikers with moderate fitness, beginning trekkers, as well as kids.

Unlike other treks in Annapurna foothill, Panchase trek sets off with an early morning stimulating boating across Phewa Lake. After crossing, we start our uphill trek towards World Peace Pagoda through lush green forests.
The third-day trek to Panchase Peak is significant which treats you with the amazing views of Gangapurna, Machhapuchhre, Dhaulagiri, Annapurna I, and Annapurna south with the delicious lunch.

The trek is completed as you descend down through the jeep trail of Naudada to Pokhara and Kathmandu.",,20190331,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/panorama-panchase-family-trek/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/6636212009_df0076f6f0_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/5192001083_713e8f4b38_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/5192342046_15524f9ef8_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/5496298781_4e4a808bab_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/6134288826_d1c7e5e622_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/8620351986_4c59e0524d_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/11500577745_c4a4b9d864_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/14508238632_110af6ea8d_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/16978231910_3ad1e1d28e_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/27575773929_24a85823d8_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/38474810935_a42f65e83e_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/38474813165_5bc9eea0f4_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/panchese-trek.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/3575695062_672bbaf351_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/4699484138_9db3388dc7_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/5168730081_46827e7fb2_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/6608786565_c9a5e4f9c2_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/6615239187_e69aecb8cb_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/6628750303_79c4a85f31_o-1.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/6629333721_a79e815015_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/6635430077_53dc6dd010_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/6636214661_3bc9ff5da9_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/6636766851_5b5bd1ddaf_o.jpg|ht column3: An early morning boating across the serene water of Phewa Lake.&lt
Light walk towards the World Peace Pagoda which is regarded as the finest viewpoint inside the Pokhara.&lt
Stay with local Gurung tribes of people in Bhumdi and Bhadaure and experience their unforgettable ways/culture of welcoming guests.&lt
Finest Panoramic views of Gangapurna, Lamjung Himal, Mt. Fishtail, Annapurna and its ranges from Panchase Peak.&lt

column30: s:197:""Our representative will meet you on your arrival at the Airport and transfer you to the Hotel. An information session about the program will be conducted by our Tour Guide. Overnight stay in Hotel.""
column32: s:419:""Early in the morning after breakfast, our tour guide will takes you for the sightseeing around the Kathmandu, the sightseeing site are- Durbar Square, the sacred Hindu temple of Pashupatinath, the famous ‘Monkey Temple’ (Swayambhunath) and Buddhists shrine (Bouddhanath) which is one of the large Stupas in the world. In the late afternoon you will have preparation for the trek and you can buy necessary equipment.""
column34: s:431:""On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and head towards tourist Bus Park at Thamel and board a tourist bus to Pokhara. The bus ride will take around 7 hours through curvy roads of hilly terrain with couple of breaks in between for snacks and lunch. The drive to Pokhara on one of the major highways is exhilarating with beautiful views of never leaving tributaries, lush green hills and roadside settlements.""
column36: s:393:""An early peaceful boating towards the corner of Phewa Lake marks the starting of your trek. Then you head to World Peace Pagoda from the lush green hill laid back to Phewa Lake. From the top of the hill, you will be able to explore the beautiful Phewa lake and Pokhara city and Phewa Lake. After some rest, we head to the beautiful Bhumdi village of Gurung settlements where we stay overnight.""
column38: s:215:""A lovely hike from Bhumdi village crossing vibrant rhododendron forests and luch green forests leads us to Thulochaur from where we can see magnificent views of Lamjung Himal, Mt. Fishtail, Annapurna and its ranges.""
column40: s:311:""And early morning ascend upwards to 2500m takes us to Panchase peak. This is the highest point of our trek. Here we take our breakfast enjoying the captivating views of Gangapurna, Lamhjung HImal, Fishtail, Annapurna and Dhaulagiri. Then, heavenly passing through pine forests, today's trails stops at Bhadaure.""
column42: s:279:""This is the last day of our trek, thus after our early morning breakfast in Bhadaure we continue our trek to Naudada. Then, we take a jeep to Pokhara, and drive back to Kathmandu on a private car if you are on short time, otherwise the trek can also be extended upon your choice.""
column44: s:171:""Today we say our final goodbye. Our representative will come to see you off at the airport. Hoping you had a pleasant and wonderful trekking experience we bid you goodbye.""

Unlike other treks in Annapurna foothill, Panchase trek sets off with an early morning stimulating boating across...","Panchase Trek is an easier trek in the Annapurna Foothill. Panchase Peak (2500m) is the highest point of the trek. Good for family trekking with children.",,"a:23:{s:6:""enable""

column1: 6625,"Alternative Annapurna Khopra Danda Trek","Khopra Danda Trek is one of the finest viewpoints in the Annapurna Region to gaze over captivating views of Mt. Dhaulagiri massif, Annapurna I, II, Annapurna South, Nilgiri, Hiuchuli and many other spectacular peaks.

This trek is the excellent alternative to Annapurna Ghorepani Trek to those who want a little more off beaten trail to explore remotely Nepal with fewer tourists. An early morning Himalayan sunrise views at Poonhill is the starting impression of the trek.

As you go up steeply higher to Upper Chistibung, you will encounter high cascading waterfalls, rushing rivers, lush pine forests with vibrant colors of flowers along with fine settlements of local Gurung tribe of people. You stay at the guesthouse in the mountains will be an unforgettable and rewarding experience. You will be surprised by the natural way of welcoming guests.

Exploring sacred Khayer Lake, encountering the local people of fine Gurung villages, walking through the excellent layered paddy fields with rewarding views of Mt. Dhaulagiri, Annapurna, Nilgiri, Hiuchuli, etc are the major attractions of this trek.",,20190401,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/alternative-annapurna-khopra-danda-trek/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/38694346491_e9d705e4ac_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/6029388915_0f6c3308f9_z.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/7493946790_e72ae548e2_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/7494175606_552947010d_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/13891525617_1aec81fd75_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/22957728804_2cb6ffca7d_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/23585943065_92816af7ac_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/31244462193_1328fea5e3_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/32268715654_3d7d2bbb03_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/33072299916_0ff5deb592_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/33113829905_6aab6325df_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/34706764694_0d97d681bb_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/35418688651_fab93ae5dc_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/35418849431_cf7683a021_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/35509178006_aea707b6e0_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/40258146750_414f5f2603_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/43070629760_e75fc926cf_b.jpg,38694346491_e9d705e4ac_k|6029388915_0f6c3308f9_z|7493946790_e72ae548e2_k|7494175606_552947010d_k|13891525617_1aec81fd75_k|22957728804_2cb6ffca7d_b|23585943065_92816af7ac_b|31244462193_1328fea5e3_k|32268715654_3d7d2bbb03_k|33072299916_0ff5deb592_k|33113829905_6aab6325df_k|34706764694_0d97d681bb_k|35418688651_fab93ae5dc_k|35418849431_cf7683a021_k|35509178006_aea707b6e0_k|40258146750_414f5f2603_k|43070629760_e75fc926cf_b,||||||||||||||||,||||||||||||||||,||||||||||||||||,http:/
