column3: Walk through the lush pine forests, high cascading waterfalls, rushing rivers listening birds singing.&lt
Embrace the glowing Himalayan sunrise views from Poonhill.&lt
Stay with local Gurung and Magar tribes of people along the way to Khopra Danda and know their surprising culture of welcoming guests.&lt
Explore the sacred and pristine Khayer Lake, one of the holiest place for Hindus.&lt
Enjoy your spear time at natural hot spring in Tatopani.&lt
Enjoy the majestic close-up views of Dhaulagiri massif, Annapurna, Lamjung Himal, Nilgiri, Hiuchuli from the Khopra Danda View point.&lt

column1: Two clients share one porter. We will supply you a trek duffel bag where you keep your heavy items and this bag is carried by the porter. You will need to bring your own daypack to be carried by you. In the daypack, you can put money, important documents, water bottle/bladder, camera, toiletries, sunscreen, notebook, etc. The weight limit for the porter is 30 kg or 66 pounds. 15 kg or 33 pounds for each client. So, we recommend you to pack as carefully as you can and not exceed the weight limit. You can leave your non-trekking stuff at the locker facility in the Kathmandu hotel.

column3: 4-season sleeping bag (We can provide one if you need it but has to be returned after the trek)&lt
Down jacket (Must have for mornings, nights and evenings, and for altitudes above 4,000 m
column4: We can provide it if you need one but has to be returned after the trek.)&lt

column3: Wool or synthetic hat that cover the ears&lt
Soft shell and hard shell trekking pants&lt

column1: (Please note our guide will carry the first-aid kit bag during the trek. However we still recommend you to bring your personalized first-aid kit as well.)

column3: Extra Strength Excedrin for altitude related headaches&lt
Ibuprofen for general aches and pains&lt
Immodium or Pepto Bismol capsules for upset stomach or diarrhea&lt
Diamox (commonly prescribed as Acetazolamide) 125 or 250mg tablets for altitude sickness&lt
Passport and extra passport photos (3 copies)&lt
Airline ticket (Please make a copy and leave one at our office in Kathmandu just in case if you need to change the date of your flight.)&lt
Durable wallet/pouch for travel documents, money &amp
Toiletry kit (Be sure to include toilet paper stored in a plastic bag, hand wipes, and liquid hand sanitizer, towel, soap, etc.)&lt
Favorite snack foods (No more than 2 pounds)&lt
Cameras (Memory cards, chargers and also batteries)&lt
Pee bottle for men and pee funnel for women&lt

column45: s:170:""Our airport representative will be receiving you at Tribhuvan International Airport. You will be then transferred to your respective hotel in our private tourist vehicle.""
column47: s:431:""On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and head towards tourist Bus Park at Thamel and board a tourist bus to Pokhara. The bus ride will take around 7 hours through curvy roads of hilly terrain with couple of breaks in between for snacks and lunch. The drive to Pokhara on one of the major highways is exhilarating with beautiful views of never leaving tributaries, lush green hills and roadside settlements.""
column49: s:214:""The day starts early by taking a vehicle out of Pokhara. The drive takes around an hour and half to Nayapul and we start our trip towards Ulleri hiking through jeep track way and a little bit of uphill stone steps.""
column51: s:203:""Walking through the beautiful Lord of the Rings like trail set-up is overwhelming and getting to Ghorepani the leading protected area in Nepal with the world largest Rhododendron forest is extraordinary.""
column53: s:518:""An early morning excursion to Poonhill offers you the breathtaking Himalayan sunrise views of Dhaulagiri massif, Annapurna I, Annapurna South, Annapurna II, Lamjung Himal, Hiuchuli, Mt Fishtail etc. Climbing down from Poonhill, we take a breakfast at Ghorepani and start our trip to Upper Chistibung through lush pine forests which contains diverse species of flowers such as maple, oak, orchids. Watch out grazing cattles, and wild Himalayan thar at grassy slopes on the way. Tonight we will stay at Upper Chistibung.""
column55: s:354:""Today, we will ascent towards Khopra Danda through the alpine meadows and pastures gazing over the rushing Kaligandaki river that originatinates from the massive ranges of Annapurna and Dhaulagiri. Khopra Danda is the best viewpoint to perceive the spectacular views of Dhaulagiri massif inside the Annapurna Region. Tonight we will stay at Khopra Danda.""
column57: s:188:""After a hearty breakfast at one of the finest viewpoint, we head to explore the most sacred himalayan Lake. It is one of the most holiest lake for Hindus, which is also written in Ramayan.""
column59: s:188:""After an early morning breakfast, we head to Tatopani. In tatopani many people enjoy their spear time swimming or bathing in the natural hot water spring. Tonight we will stay at Tatopani.""
column61: s:195:""Today is the last day of your trek. We take a private jeep to Pokhara enjoying the dramtic landscapes, waterfalls and terrains all around the way. We will stay at 3 star hotel in Pokhara tonight.""
column63: s:316:""On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and get ready to head towards Kathmandu. The bus ride will take around 7 hours through curvy roads of hilly terrain with couple of breaks in between for snacks and lunch. Tracing the same way back we reach Kathmandu and we transfer you back at the hotel.""
column65: s:171:""Today we say our final goodbye. Our representative will come to see you off at the airport. Hoping you had a pleasant and wonderful trekking experience we bid you goodbye.""

column1: 6731,"Easy Road Trip to Upper Mustang by Jeep","Upper Mustang is truly an exotic Kingdom which lies behind the massif ranges of Dhaulagiri and Annapurna. It is the most preserved and mysterious hidden jewel of Nepal. Upper Mustang has so much to offer. Many explorers around the world dream to visit this precious land.

Upper Mustang is also known as 'The Last Forbidden Kingdom of Lo', which is hugely rich in its Tibetan culture. This nomadic land is absolutely untouched by modernization. If you want to travel back to your time, hands down Upper Mustang that you will not regret. People in this land are unchanged for thousands of years, follow the same culture and rituals that we study from history books or magazines.

The land of Mustang is dry and barren which does not possess any Vegetations. The description of this hidden treasure is beyond words. There are more than a thousand caves in Upper Mustang. Only 300 of them are discovered until. Some of the people still live inside the caves and those people are called sky people.

The capital city of this Kingdom is Lo Manthang. This treasure valley is now connected with off-road which facilitates the travelers from worldwide to explore this dream Kingdom hassle-free. We can also trek this trail. However, the overland jeep tour is ideal for people who are on short time but still have an enduring desire to visit Upper Mustang.
As you follow the trail, you will encounter various gompas, prayer flags, monasteries, chortens, mani walls which is evidence to Buddhist culture and custom.
Embark you lifetime journey to Upper Mustang with Osho World Adventure.

column3: This hidden jewel of Nepal possess Tibetan cultural enlightenment inside Nepal with overflowing numbers of monasteries, gompas, chortens, prayer flags and unique festival&lt
As known as Himalayan desert, it reflects the dry and barren vegetation of Mustang region with 360 degree spectacular views of Dhaulagiri massif and Annapurna ranges at the backdrop.&lt
Totally untouched with modernization- people here still live in caves and those people are called sky people.&lt
Explore Lo- Manthang (727 Sq/Km, the capital city of this kingdom. Ghar Gompa and Luri caves are the major attractions.&lt

column54: s:170:""Our airport representative will be receiving you at Tribhuvan International Airport. You will be then transferred to your respective hotel in our private tourist vehicle.""
column56: s:242:""After a hearty breakfast, at 8.30 am your sightseeing trip will start. You will have a private vehicle and a professional tour guide at your disposal. Today we will visit Hindus and Buddhists sites, Pashupatinath Temple and Bouddhanath Stupa.""
column58: s:431:""On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and head towards tourist Bus Park at Thamel and board a tourist bus to Pokhara. The bus ride will take around 7 hours through curvy roads of hilly terrain with couple of breaks in between for snacks and lunch. The drive to Pokhara on one of the major highways is exhilarating with beautiful views of never leaving tributaries, lush green hills and roadside settlements.""
column60: s:286:""An alluring drive to Kagbeni starts after a delicious brekfast in Pokhara. The journey to the starting point of Mustang passes through the beautiful landscapes. The Kagbeni village is situated at the bank of rushing Kaligandaki river. Kagbeni is the main entrace gate for Upper Mustang.""
column62: s:313:""Journey to Charang village if fully filled with white hills and terrains. Charang is south walled town of Lo Manthang. This beautiful charang village consists of numerous stupa structures, monasteries, and buildings. The monasteries walls in the Charang are painted with murals. Overnight we will stay at Charang.""
column64: s:383:""This day we will hike to Luri cave which lies south east of Lo Manthang. The Luri Gompa is a monastery which sits above the crumbling landscape like an eagle's nest. So, this cave is also called sky caves. The cave is pitted with sand stone cliffs and bluffs fluted by winds and forms taperred or pillar like structures. After exploring this historic cave, we return back to Charang.""
column66: s:500:""An early morning breakfast and drive from Charang, we continue our journey towards the Lo Manthang, the capital of this kingdom. Lo Manthang offers the marvelous taste of Budhhist culture and lifestyle. Lo Manthang is known for its white washed mud brick walls, Gomaps and Royal palace of the Mustang King. There are four major temples in Lo Manthang that were  Jampa Gompa, Thubchen Gompa, Chodey Gompa, Choprang Gompa. All these temples were built in 14th century. Overnight we stay at Lo Manthang.""
column68: s:356:""A drive from Lo Manthang takes you to beautiful Chosar Village. The village is full of stone walls and bone-white glowing hills. Through suspension bridges and cultivated lands in Upper Mustang, we reach to Chhosar village, and explore the Chosar caves. Then we again return back to Charang village where we stay overnight at a comfortable tea house lodge.""
column70: s:328:""Chhusang village lies at the junction of Narsingha river and the massive Kaligandaki. This village is surrounded by white, orange, and red sandy cliffs. Like most of the mustang region, chusang village is also slowly moving towards modernization. Life is just so peaceful and serene at this village. Tonight we stay at Chhusang.""
column72: s:548:""An incredible journey towards the sparse of green vegetations and frequent water falls and excellent views of mountains takes you to the holiest place, the Muktinath. Muktinath is situated at the altitude of 3710m at the base of Thorung La mountain pass. Muktinath is very famous place for sky dancers. It is believed that the water continuously flowing from 108 taps of Muktinath is the holy water. So, people take a bath with that icy and frigid water to wash their sins that they have committed throughout lifetime. Tonight we stay at Muktinath.""
column74: s:255:""Leaving the himalayan desert behind, we head towards Pokhara. The pleasant drive through tranquil trails, mesmerizing vegetations, and dramatic landscapes light a sparkle to our journey towards the city of lake. Tonight we stay at 3-star hotel in Pokhara.""
column76: s:316:""On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and get ready to head towards Kathmandu. The bus ride will take around 7 hours through curvy roads of hilly terrain with couple of breaks in between for snacks and lunch. Tracing the same way back we reach Kathmandu and we transfer you back at the hotel.""
column78: s:171:""Today we say our final goodbye. Our representative will come to see you off at the airport. Hoping you had a pleasant and wonderful trekking experience we bid you goodbye.""
column83: Our airport representative will be receiving you at Tribhuvan International Airport. You will be then transferred to your respective hotel in our private tourist vehicle.&lt
column89: After a hearty breakfast, at 8.30 am your sightseeing trip will start. You will have a private vehicle and a professional tour guide at your disposal. Today we will visit Hindus and Buddhists sites, Pashupatinath Temple and Bouddhanath Stupa.&lt
column95: On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and head towards tourist Bus Park at Thamel and board a tourist bus to Pokhara. The bus ride will take around 7 hours through curvy roads of hilly terrain with couple of breaks in between for snacks and lunch. The drive to Pokhara on one of the major highways is exhilarating with beautiful views of never leaving tributaries, lush green hills and roadside settlements.&lt
column101: An alluring drive to Kagbeni starts after a delicious brekfast in Pokhara. The journey to the starting point of Mustang passes through the beautiful landscapes. The Kagbeni village is situated at the bank of rushing Kaligandaki river. Kagbeni is the main entrace gate for Upper Mustang.&lt
column107: Journey to Charang village if fully filled with white hills and terrains. Charang is south walled town of Lo Manthang. This beautiful charang village consists of numerous stupa structures, monasteries, and buildings. The monasteries walls in the Charang are painted with murals. Overnight we will stay at Charang.&lt
column113: This day we will hike to Luri cave which lies south east of Lo Manthang. The Luri Gompa is a monastery which sits above the crumbling landscape like an eagle's nest. So, this cave is also called sky caves. The cave is pitted with sand stone cliffs and bluffs fluted by winds and forms taperred or pillar like structures. After exploring this historic cave, we return back to Charang.&lt
column119: An early morning breakfast and drive from Charang, we continue our journey towards the Lo Manthang, the capital of this kingdom. Lo Manthang offers the marvelous taste of Budhhist culture and lifestyle. Lo Manthang is known for its white washed mud brick walls, Gomaps and Royal palace of the Mustang King. There are four major temples in Lo Manthang that were  Jampa Gompa, Thubchen Gompa, Chodey Gompa, Choprang Gompa. All these temples were built in 14th century. Overnight we stay at Lo Manthang.&lt
column125: A drive from Lo Manthang takes you to beautiful Chosar Village. The village is full of stone walls and bone-white glowing hills. Through suspension bridges and cultivated lands in Upper Mustang, we reach to Chhosar village, and explore the Chosar caves. Then we again return back to Charang village where we stay overnight at a comfortable tea house lodge.&lt
column131: Chhusang village lies at the junction of Narsingha river and the massive Kaligandaki. This village is surrounded by white, orange, and red sandy cliffs. Like most of the mustang region, chusang village is also slowly moving towards modernization. Life is just so peaceful and serene at this village. Tonight we stay at Chhusang.&lt
column137: An incredible journey towards the sparse of green vegetations and frequent water falls and excellent views of mountains takes you to the holiest place, the Muktinath. Muktinath is situated at the altitude of 3710m at the base of Thorung La mountain pass. Muktinath is very famous place for sky dancers. It is believed that the water continuously flowing from 108 taps of Muktinath is the holy water. So, people take a bath with that icy and frigid water to wash their sins that they have committed throughout lifetime. Tonight we stay at Muktinath.&lt
column143: Leaving the himalayan desert behind, we head towards Pokhara. The pleasant drive through tranquil trails, mesmerizing vegetations, and dramatic landscapes light a sparkle to our journey towards the city of lake. Tonight we stay at 3-star hotel in Pokhara.&lt
column149: On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and get ready to head towards Kathmandu. The bus ride will take around 7 hours through curvy roads of hilly terrain with couple of breaks in between for snacks and lunch. Tracing the same way back we reach Kathmandu and we transfer you back at the hotel.&lt
column155: Today we say our final goodbye. Our representative will come to see you off at the airport. Hoping you had a pleasant and wonderful trekking experience we bid you goodbye.&lt

column1: 6820,"Kathmandu Durbar Square and Explore Asan","<span style=""font-weight: 400
column2: >Located at the heart of the ancient city, Kathmandu Durbar Square is the prominent Durbar Square, lies at the southern part of Thamel where the royal family lived until the 19th century. It is also known as Hanuman Dhoka Durbar Square.

>Most of the buildings in the palace are built in the pagoda style embellished with intricately carved wooden windows and panels. This is one of the excellent examples of the ancient traditional Nepali architecture. Durbar Square also epitomizes the religious and cultural life of Nepalese people.
>Overlooking the south part of the palace, Kumari Ghar is three-storeyed brick building richly decorated with wooden-carved reliefs of god and symbols, where the living Goddess Kumari lives.

>Wandering through the old back narrow streets of Asan, lined-up with local shops, handicrafts, souvenirs, clothes, which will keep you busy for hours. The price is marked on foreigners rate so make sure that you would bargain it to a fair price. ",,20190402,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/kathmandu-durbar-square-and-explore-asan/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/44873088775_3a0d56185b_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/2207272457_09a90787ce_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/3016563620_2253c2ee91_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/6423159203_a00488f9af_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/6446937807_ec3a9cff1d_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/9516456008_894807ddb1_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/14017145884_ac20183e41_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/17071061927_63033627af_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/33312945621_a269351459_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/33445972936_3023a990b0_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/40259670161_007d3ffb17_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/40288809811_4ceb890368_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/44227299930_8095dfac4d_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/47411298272_0f6da61ccd_b.jpg,44873088775_3a0d56185b_b|2207272457_09a90787ce_b|3016563620_2253c2ee91_o|R0013980|6446937807_ec3a9cff1d_o|9516456008_894807ddb1_b|14017145884_ac20183e41_b|17071061927_63033627af_b|33312945621_a269351459_b|33445972936_3023a990b0_b|40259670161_007d3ffb17_b|40288809811_4ceb890368_b|44227299930_8095dfac4d_b|47411298272_0f6da61ccd_b,|||||||||||||,|||||||||||||,|||||||||||||,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/44873088775_3a0d56185b_b.jpg,,"Kathmandu Valley","Cultural Visits>UNESCO WORLD HERITAGE SITES","Duration>day trip|Trip Level>Easy|Budget>Less than $500","a:6:{s:8:""og_title""

column1: 6851,"Fly over the Invigorating Hills of Chandragiri","<span style=""font-weight: 400
column2: >The 9 to 12 minutes cable car ride to the top, Chandragiri hills gives the finest panoramic view of Kathmandu Valley covered with lush green blankets of floras and soaring 360 views of Himalayan ranges like Mt. Annapurna, Manaslu, Langtang, Ganesh, Everest which makes anyone feel like seeing whole Nepal at once.

>Located at the elevation of 2551 meters, it has its own historical and mythological significance for Kathmandu Valley since the period of King Prithvi Narayan Shah. There is a temple named Baleshwar Temple at the top of the hill. The religious and cultural program is performed during the festivals. This mesmerizing hill offers you the most fascinating day of the 1-day tour inside the Kathmandu Valley. ",,20190402,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/fly-over-the-invigorating-hills-of-chandragiri/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/29226908243_bfd6da2333_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/14511063684_390024602a_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/24316613097_0d15c80285_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/24512513417_653b5c2bed_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/26151139059_42a3b6a433_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/26718424548_30fd13fd2e_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/32511459597_ee51a6ebb1_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/42203751020_a92f73d42b_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/46730069934_ab9066d44f_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/46730070014_d195105019_o.jpg,29226908243_bfd6da2333_k|14511063684_390024602a_k|24316613097_0d15c80285_b|24512513417_653b5c2bed_b|26151139059_42a3b6a433_b|26718424548_30fd13fd2e_b|32511459597_ee51a6ebb1_o|42203751020_a92f73d42b_b|46730069934_ab9066d44f_k|46730070014_d195105019_o,|||||||||,|||||||||,|||||||||,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/29226908243_bfd6da2333_k.jpg,,"Middle Hills>Chandragiri","Relaxing Moments>CABLE CAR","Duration>day trip|Trip Level>Easy|Budget>Less than $500","a:6:{s:8:""og_title""

column1: 6867,"Excursion to Twin Villages: Bungamati & Khokana","<span style=""font-weight: 400
column2: >These two villages offer you the pleasant smell of Nepalese culture and tradition within a few hours of your visit to Nepal. These two classical village lies across the sacred
column4: > beside Chobhar. The major attraction of Bungamati village is the Shikhara style of a temple of
column6: > where the rivered rain god is believed to have been born there.

column2: >Kokhana is the fertile farming village, where mustard oil is harvested and locals spend most of their days engaged in agriculture.

>Most of the men in both villages are engaged in woodcarvings while women sitting outside busy on spinning the corns, millet, etc. Despite being close to the capital city, Bungamati and Khokana still preserve ancient traditions, Newari culture, and typical village lifestyle which is totally untouched from modern development. However, the 2015 earthquake has damaged this village so harshly, thus recently these both villages need the tourism more than ever for its quick restoration.

,,20190401,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/excursion-to-twin-villages-bungamati-khokana/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/6811194581_b10666e1b4_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/5435505639_a2687deca0_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/6743738985_6bfe636a38_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/6811184881_afff634a7a_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/6811190349_751369a90e_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/6811193311_c16e0345b3_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/17630312231_dc410df0d2_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/32596681611_87fefbac51_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/33391743912_ee608b7245_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/37483802472_6041cbba6c_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/989556638_8bb6eebec4_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/15130791954_ec4784d04e_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/15565602767_2ce0fddac5_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/21472316088_bb19e4bf63_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/41390135684_04f8895efd_k.jpg,6811194581_b10666e1b4_b|A Khokana woman preparing chillies for drying|6743738985_6bfe636a38_b|6811184881_afff634a7a_b|6811190349_751369a90e_b|6811193311_c16e0345b3_b|17630312231_dc410df0d2_k|32596681611_87fefbac51_b|33391743912_ee608b7245_k|37483802472_6041cbba6c_k|989556638_8bb6eebec4_b|15130791954_ec4784d04e_b|15565602767_2ce0fddac5_b|21472316088_bb19e4bf63_b|41390135684_04f8895efd_k","|A Khokana woman preparing chillies for drying|||||||||||||",||||||||||||||,||||||||||||||,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/6811194581_b10666e1b4_b.jpg,,"Kathmandu Valley","Natural &amp

column1: 6868,"Half Day Pashupatinath Temple and Wander around Boudhanath Stupa","<span style=""font-weight: 400
column2: >Pashupatinath Temple is Nepal’s most sacred Hindu Temple that lies on the banks of Bagmati river, 5-km east of Kathmandu city. Pashupatinath is an avatar of Hindu God Shiva as “Lord of animals” which draws the devotees from the Indian subcontinent. During the evening from 6 to 7 P.M, the
column4: >(fire worship with songs and dance dedicating Lord Shiva) are regularly performed.

column2: >It is believed that those who die in Pashupatinath Temple are reborn as a human, regardless of any misconduct throughout the lifetime. Cremations are done at the bank of the sacred Bagmati river.

>Boudhanath is just 2.1km away from Pashupatinath temple. It is the largest spherical stupa in Nepal. It has a greater significance of Tibetan Buddhism and their culture. This is also enlisted in World heritage sites. Tibetan community comes along and walk around the stupa with a simple melody of the mantra

>There are many monasteries lies within Boudhanath such as Tamang Gompa, which is gracefully decorated with vibrant murals. ",,20190402,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/half-day-pashupatinath-temple-and-wander-around-boudhanath-stupa/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/budhanilkantha-wvp-pilgrima.jpeg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/424103497_da9b0b89b2_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/3131223232_382a3955d7_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/5451706792_b5c742466a_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/14461574302_6232e3bbd4_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/15448250393_2e0fe37f6a_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/27182733612_ad0974b4bf_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/33015977916_4345049c3b_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/41616645952_1234ebcf72_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/46873238061_71dc450158_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/3992755968_e07e8ba130_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/5042288820_f05bb4b463_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/5042410186_5220cf50ef_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/5042414852_cb339aab8f_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/13693165074_2cb514a82a_b.jpg,budhanilkantha-wvp-pilgrima|424103497_da9b0b89b2_b|3131223232_382a3955d7_b|Buddhanelakanda|14461574302_6232e3bbd4_k|15448250393_2e0fe37f6a_b|27182733612_ad0974b4bf_k|33015977916_4345049c3b_o|41616645952_1234ebcf72_k|46873238061_71dc450158_k|3992755968_e07e8ba130_b|5042288820_f05bb4b463_b|5042410186_5220cf50ef_b|5042414852_cb339aab8f_b|13693165074_2cb514a82a_b,|||Buddhanelakanda|||||||||||,||||||||||||||,||||||||||||||,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/budhanilkantha-wvp-pilgrima.jpeg,,"Kathmandu column1: 6869,"Full Day Bhaktapur Durbar Square and Nagarkot Sunset Tour","<span style=""font-weight: 400
column2: >Museum of medieval art and architecture, Bhaktapur Durbar Square has many overflowing examples of wood carvings and colossal pagoda temples. The popular attraction of this palace is Golden Gate, Bastala Temple, Lion’s Gate, Nyatapola Temple, Mini Pashupati Temple, Bhairavnath Temple.

>On this half-day tour from Kathmandu, you will have opportunities to enjoy the city of Bhaktapur and the village of Nagarkot. Nagarkot located 32 km away from the Kathmandu and 2133.6 meters from the sea level, is considered as one of the most scenic spots in Bhaktapur district. This place offers a panoramic view of Kathmandu Valley and also is popular for it's sunrise and sunset views of the Himalayas among many visitors. ",,20190402,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/full-day-bhaktapur-durbar-square-and-nagarkot-sunset-tour/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/8152597021_9010f97b34_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/36724133860_8c6d10b27c_h.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/39864388223_4447412c44_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/5171453436_2b2604aed5_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/11325603285_2847935904_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/11969844903_fe90af5a7c_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/14611050411_402230091b_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/16267505639_bdc779e2b1_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/20589038134_e92287d6c7_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/36123611821_0ebe21e945_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/39175519785_035683c50c_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/44648838700_8a431c5f94_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/45791593855_6df60881bd_o.jpg,8152597021_9010f97b34_k|36724133860_8c6d10b27c_h|39864388223_4447412c44_b|5171453436_2b2604aed5_o|11325603285_2847935904_b|11969844903_fe90af5a7c_b|14611050411_402230091b_k|16267505639_bdc779e2b1_k|20589038134_e92287d6c7_k|36123611821_0ebe21e945_b|39175519785_035683c50c_k|44648838700_8a431c5f94_o|45791593855_6df60881bd_o,||||||||||||,||||||||||||,||||||||||||,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/8152597021_9010f97b34_k.jpg,,"Kathmandu Valley|Middle Hills>Nagarkot","Natural &

column1: 6889,"A Day Visit to Kopan Monastery","<span style=""font-weight: 400
column2: >Kopan Monastery is a serene sacred place that lies on the Himalayan foothills inside Kathmandu Valley which is surrounded by lush of green forests. Despite being a sacred place for Buddhists, it welcomes the visitors around the world following any religions or cultures.

>The monastery is stunningly gorgeous with large open space grounds and gardens at the back which offers you the breathtaking view of Kathmandu Valley, hills, mountains and beyond. The place is popular for Buddhists study, meditation, retreat, and practice. The atmosphere here is charged with spiritual energy that is almost tangible which definitely gives you a life-changing experience.

>You can also find decent restaurants serving delicious foods and book stores with many works in English. The visitors may enter inside the stupa typically from 9 am to 5 pm.",,20190401,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/a-day-visit-to-kopan-monastery/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/5415983784_474486f380_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/39768240_35d60a2fb2_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/2351601012_494084da62_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/3369184854_3751144480_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/4073156791_a100cc5e03_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/4145854874_3fb43ee9b4_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/5285284963_48df8eebeb_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/33671105913_813c686e9a_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/305254915_db0f17c8de_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/2351601012_494084da62_b-1.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/4997915718_f4e4c0e644_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/5415371457_2d2ac9a8fe_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/14609107476_04a10bd4c1_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/46697696781_6fa26cc38b_o_d.jpg,"5415983784_474486f380_b|39768240_35d60a2fb2_b|2351601012_494084da62_b|3369184854_3751144480_b|4073156791_a100cc5e03_b|4145854874_3fb43ee9b4_b|5285284963_48df8eebeb_b|33671105913_813c686e9a_b|KONICA MINOLTA DIGITAL CAMERA|2351601012_494084da62_b (1)|4997915718_f4e4c0e644_b|5415371457_2d2ac9a8fe_b|14609107476_04a10bd4c1_b|46697696781_6fa26cc38b_o_d","||||||||KONICA MINOLTA DIGITAL CAMERA|||||",|||||||||||||,|||||||||||||,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/5415983784_474486f380_b.jpg,,"Kathmandu Valley","Natural &

column1: 6911,"Panauti Village and Namo Buddha Stupa Hike","<span style=""font-weight: 400
column2: >Namo Buddha stupa is believed to be the incarnation of Lord Buddha. There is a magnificent Buddhist monastery beautifully built on the top of the hill situated at Kavre district of Nepal, 56 km away from the main business area of Kathmandu. Namo Buddha is the perfect place to gaze over the captivating ranges of the Himalayas like Langtang, Gaurishankar, etc.

>The environment needs no magnification. This place is just quite, pure, and totally untouched with pollution. It is also the right place for meditation and retreat. You will hike up to the top to visit Thrangu Tashi Yangtse Monastery and enjoy the panoramic views of Panauti Village and Khopasi. ",,20190402,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/panauti-village-and-namo-buddha-stupa-hike/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/panauti.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/panauti2.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/panauti3.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/panauti4.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/panauti5.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/panauti6.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/panauti7.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/panauti8.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/panauti9.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/panauti10.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/panauti11.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/panauti12.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/panauti13.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/panauti14.jpg,panauti|panauti2|panauti3|panauti4|panauti5|panauti6|panauti7|panauti8|panauti9|panauti10|panauti11|panauti12|panauti13|panauti14,"||||||Panauti, a small town located 32 km Southeast of Kathmandu, found in the central regions of Nepal. Panauti is a very historical city found in Nepal, as it was originally a small state given by King Bhupatindra Malla as a dowry to his sister. This town has a population of under 10,000 people and a few prominent icons, such as the Indreswor temple and Durbar square found in the town center. At the end of the 13th Century, Panauti was finally integrated into the unified kingdom of Nepal, along with Kathmandu, Patan, and Bhaktapur, which are all former capital cities of the Kathmandu valley. Panauti, consists of a variety of Buddhist and Hindu religious monuments, and is considered to be one of the area’s most important medieval sites.[1]||||Panauti, a small town located 32 km Southeast of Kathmandu, found in the central regions of Nepal. Panauti is a very historical city found in Nepal, as it was originally a small state given by King Bhupatindra Malla as a dowry to his sister. This town has a population of under 10,000 people and a few prominent icons, such as the Indreswor temple and Durbar square found in the town center. At the end of the 13th Century, Panauti was finally integrated into the unified kingdom of Nepal, along with Kathmandu, Patan, and Bhaktapur, which are all former capital cities of the Kathmandu valley. Panauti, consists of a variety of Buddhist and Hindu religious monuments, and is considered to be one of the area’s most important medieval sites.[1]|||",|||||||||||||,|||||||||||||,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/panauti.jpg,,"Middle Hills>Panauti","Natural &

column1: 6922,"Relaxation Australian Camp Trek","Australian Base Camp is the shortest and easiest trekking route. It is very suitable for the trekkers who have an enduring desire to see the close-up views of Annapurna ranges on a short hike.

The trek starts from Pokhara. You will explore the excellent layered rice terrains, lush green and peaceful forests, waterfalls and glowing views of Annapurna II, Fishtail, Dhaulagiri, and Annapurna South.

Annapurna Conservation Region never fails to surprise its explorers. It's the largest protected land in Nepal where you will able to wander around diverse landscapes depending upon your time, level of fitness and group members.",,20190402,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/relaxation-australian-camp-trek/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/13034309675_ffb70e44f2_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/6785111396_fbd24b401f_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/6788408914_a67221df39_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/10788245114_12b471554a_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/13034674544_b272268b03_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/25459269298_13bf6a8a6d_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/31051907680_c5b65cb20b_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/31276549972_8d72d6c16d_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/31276552702_a72d52950a_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/31489799700_2a6996292e_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/31756853998_d687f74d68_h.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/31862917175_a0f3a6fbec_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/31862919415_6e0f7c91e7_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/32563733104_227555fae0_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/39686143475_b5c4b5c428_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/40348456120_ce993d85fe_b.jpg,13034309675_ffb70e44f2_b|6785111396_fbd24b401f_b|6788408914_a67221df39_b|10788245114_12b471554a_k|13034674544_b272268b03_b|25459269298_13bf6a8a6d_b|31051907680_c5b65cb20b_b|31276549972_8d72d6c16d_b|31276552702_a72d52950a_b|31489799700_2a6996292e_k|31756853998_d687f74d68_h|31862917175_a0f3a6fbec_k|31862919415_6e0f7c91e7_k|32563733104_227555fae0_k|39686143475_b5c4b5c428_k|40348456120_ce993d85fe_b,|||||||||||||||,|||||||||||||||,|||||||||||||||,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/13034309675_ffb70e44f2_b.jpg,,"Himalayas>Annapurna column30: s:197:""Our representative will meet you on your arrival at the Airport and transfer you to the Hotel. An information session about the program will be conducted by our Tour Guide. Overnight stay in Hotel.""
column32: s:431:""On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and head towards tourist Bus Park at Thamel and board a tourist bus to Pokhara. The bus ride will take around 7 hours through curvy roads of hilly terrain with couple of breaks in between for snacks and lunch. The drive to Pokhara on one of the major highways is exhilarating with beautiful views of never leaving tributaries, lush green hills and roadside settlements.""
column34: s:323:""After a breakfast in Pokhara, we take a private jeep to Kande, for about 45 mins. Then after 2 hours of light walk through the traditional village and stone steps, we get to Australian Camp where we will be able to explore the glowing Annapurna South, Mt. Fishtail, and Annapurna II. Tonight we will stay at Teahouse lodge.""
column36: s:204:""We hike down to Pothana and Dhampus exploring the sloppy-roofed houses and traditional people. As we come closer, we can see the amazing view of Mt. Fishtail. We take a private jeep/car/taxi to Sarangkot.""
column38: s:206:""Before 6:00am in the morning, we walk to the Sarangkot viewpoint to watch over the Himalayan Sunrise views of Dhaulagiri, Annapurna and Machhapuchhre. After breakfast we hike down or take a taxi to Pokhara.""
column40: s:316:""On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and get ready to head towards Kathmandu. Tracing the same way back we reach Kathmandu and we transfer you back at the hotel.""
column42: s:171:""Today we say our final goodbye. Our representative will come to see you off at the airport. Hoping you had a pleasant and wonderful trekking experience we bid you goodbye.""

column1: 6967,"A Secret Monastery Day Hike to Budhanilkantha Temple & Nagi Gompa","<span style=""font-weight: 400
column2: >This one-day hike will take you to the incredible Hindus and Buddhists religious sites of Nepal. Budhanilkantha is the sacred site for Hindu which pays homage for sleeping statue of Hindu deity Lord Vishnu which is elegantly carved with stones. You can witness the masterpiece of statue floating on the surface of the pond on a bed of serpent.

>Located on the foothills of Shivapuri National Park(laid back hill to Budhanilkantha Temple), Nagi Gompa is a Tibetan Buddhist convent which is home to more than 100 nuns. It lies in a peaceful region in the middle of sub-tropical and mild atmospheres. The trail goes steeply uphill through the oak, rhododendron, and bamboo forests. From this place, you will be able to gaze over the amazing lush of green hills and panoramic view of Kathmandu Valley. This is one of the best spots to explore the cherished ranges of Ganesh Himal, Langtang Lirung and many more. This place is also famous for bird watching.",,20190402,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/a-secret-monastery-day-hike-to-budhanilkantha-temple-nagi-gompa/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/19291309813_85f952286a_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/5722779336_afed0fe46b_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/6979732698_064a22ba57_h.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/9491366719_013383f7af_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/10874676226_c4afa4201a_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/10875116813_90f69b0e5b_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/15673176648_519125d4e2_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/39995195883_60427dd7fe_b.jpg,"19291309813_85f952286a_b|5722779336_afed0fe46b_b|6979732698_064a22ba57_h|9491366719_013383f7af_k|10874676226_c4afa4201a_b|10875116813_90f69b0e5b_b|Walking down from Nagi Gompa|39995195883_60427dd7fe_b",|||||||,|||||||,|||||||,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/19291309813_85f952286a_b.jpg,,"Kathmandu Valley","Natural &

column1: 6975,"Nagarkot Sunrise Tour & Hike back to Changu Narayan","<span style=""font-weight: 400
column2: >Nagarkot is a resort village lies 32 km east of Kathmandu and is one of the most scenic spots, greatly popular for sunrise and sunset views of the Himalayas. Located at the altitude of 2157 meters, Nagarkot viewpoint offers the acquainted views of glistening Himalayan peaks such as Mt. Everest, Ganesh Himal, Manaslu, Rolwaling, Jugal, Mahalangur with the view of Kathmandu Valley and Shivapuri National Park.
>This hike is an excellent walking day tour on the outskirts of Kathmandu Valley. The hiking trail is gradually accompanied by the terraced fields through Tamang, Chettri, and Brahmin village.

>This tour will be completed by a hike back to a UNESCO World Heritage listed site, Changu Narayan Temple located at the small hilltop overlooking Bhaktapur which is dedicated to Lord Vishnu. It is the oldest temple in Nepal dating from Lichhavi King Period. ",,20190402,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/nagarkot-sunrise-tour-hike-back-to-changu-narayan/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/5934370551_87228ab500_b-1.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/2759611266_f4e7fe7aae_z.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/2759611654_5c6944e2f2_z.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/2773836553_48ab68dfba_z.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/3974048716_6217400550_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/4561744344_4aff95c599_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/5133302273_69634932a1_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/6515390553_09cd88807e_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/6806037133_8e8d3370e8_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/7163688933_2a7cc58455_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/7168538792_cccaa23186_h.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/7169784730_d4997779b2_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/8449549937_808f016bd1_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/11238681575_411121d796_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/17712279084_facc441dd8_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/44648838700_8a431c5f94_o-1.jpg,5934370551_87228ab500_b|2759611266_f4e7fe7aae_z|2759611654_5c6944e2f2_z|2773836553_48ab68dfba_z|3974048716_6217400550_b|4561744344_4aff95c599_o|5133302273_69634932a1_b|6515390553_09cd88807e_b|6806037133_8e8d3370e8_b|7163688933_2a7cc58455_b|7168538792_cccaa23186_h|7169784730_d4997779b2_k|8449549937_808f016bd1_o|11238681575_411121d796_b|aging|44648838700_8a431c5f94_o,||||||||||||||aging|,|||||||||||||||,|||||||||||||||,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/5934370551_87228ab500_b-1.jpg,,"Middle Hills>Nagarkot","Natural &

column1: 7099,"West Langtang Valley Tamang Heritage Trek","An exciting trek to the Himalayas of Nepal offers you to watch out the every-day lifestyle of Tamang people residing in the mountain regions of Nepal. Tamangs are the special tribes of people in Nepal who came from Tibet and lived in the upper hilly and Himalayan regions of Nepal before centuries back. Their face has a unique characteristic which is completely different from normal people.

The trekking to Tamang Heritage Trail is easily accessible. Throughout your trekking route, you will experience the outstanding views of Langtang Himal peaks, terrains, lush green forests, high cascading waterfalls. An added bonus is we will be trekking near to the broader between Nepal and Tibet.

Experience the culture, tradition and living lifestyle of Himalayan Tamang people through Tamang Heritage Trail.",,20190404,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/west-langtang-valley-tamang-heritage-trek/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/6875969257_9d9b55e8ae_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/3453387615_4171f2a367_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/6984494020_1b5ff224dd_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/7121479623_d2971e99e2_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/8157615702_044dfee3fb_o_d.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/8158866642_20ab7aca9a_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/8282391557_c9512c1390_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/8283442024_b55fb164a2_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/8283458608_8e66cdffb7_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/9927283775_3f62111c00_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/13556205674_d018b597a7_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/15098537514_638a1e4b20_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/16166742542_7e7109fce4_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/25965730346_df00915797_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/29018433518_ea5f9d8d60_b.jpg,"6875969257_9d9b55e8ae_b|3453387615_4171f2a367_o|6984494020_1b5ff224dd_b|7121479623_d2971e99e2_k|Yala column3: Embrace the dramatic landscapes at Syabrubesi, and the captivating views of Langtang Himal ranges throughout your trek.&lt
Rushing Trishuli river, high cascading waterfalls from the high Himalayas, lush green forests and terraced farmlands are the appealing features of the trek.&lt
Peek out the day to day lifestyle of Tamang people dwelling in the mountain region of Nepal. Enjoy their culture and tradition.&lt
Direct contribution to the economy of under privileged Tamang people.&lt

column1: Two clients share one porter. We will supply you a trek duffel bag where you keep your heavy items and this bag is carried by the porter. You will need to bring your own daypack to be carried by you. In the daypack, you can put money, important documents, water bottle/bladder, camera, toiletries, sunscreen, notebook, etc. The weight limit for the porter is 30 kg or 66 pounds. 15 kg or 33 pounds for each client. So, we recommend you to pack as carefully as you can and not exceed the weight limit. You can leave your non-trekking stuff at the locker facility in the Kathmandu hotel.

column3: 4-season sleeping bag (We can provide one if you need it but has to be returned after the trek)&lt
Down jacket (Must have for mornings, nights and evenings, and for altitudes above 4,000 m
column4: We can provide it if you need one but has to be returned after the trek.)&lt

column3: Wool or synthetic hat that cover the ears&lt
Soft shell and hard shell trekking pants&lt

column1: (Please note our guide will carry the first-aid kit bag during the trek. However we still recommend you to bring your personalized first-aid kit as well.)

column3: Extra Strength Excedrin for altitude related headaches&lt
Ibuprofen for general aches and pains&lt
Immodium or Pepto Bismol capsules for upset stomach or diarrhea&lt
Diamox (commonly prescribed as Acetazolamide) 125 or 250mg tablets for altitude sickness&lt
Passport and extra passport photos (3 copies)&lt
Airline ticket (Please make a copy and leave one at our office in Kathmandu just in case if you need to change the date of your flight.)&lt
Durable wallet/pouch for travel documents, money &amp
Toiletry kit (Be sure to include toilet paper stored in a plastic bag, hand wipes, and liquid hand sanitizer, towel, soap, etc.)&lt
Favorite snack foods (No more than 2 pounds)&lt
Cameras (Memory cards, chargers and also batteries)&lt
Pee bottle for men and pee funnel for women&lt

column32: s:170:""Our airport representative will be receiving you at Tribhuvan International Airport. You will be then transferred to your respective hotel in our private tourist vehicle.""
column34: s:393:""On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and head towards a bus park and board a tourist bus to Syabrubesi. The bus ride will take around 7 hours through curvy roads of hilly terrain with couple of breaks in between for snacks and lunch. The drive to Syabrubesi is exhilarating  with beautiful views of never leaving tributaries, lush green hills and roadside settlements.""
column36: s:302:""The ultimate starting point of Tamang Heritage Trek is Syabrubesi. After a breakfast you head towards  Goljhang Valley through the magnificent views of Langtang Himal and Gosaikunda ranges. After lunch, you continue the trek to Gatlang. This is a beautiful Tamang village where you will stay overnight.""
column38: s:351:""Descending to a lovely river Thangbuchet, we walk across several suspension bridges towards Tatopani. The word 'tatopani' is called natural hot water spring in English. You will have a great opportunity to swim or bath in this hot water. it is believed that bathing or swimming in natural hot water keeps your pain away. Overnight we stay at Tatopani.""
column40: s:257:""Your trail continues towards the Nagthali Danda where you will find plenty of sloppy grasslands. Here, you enjoy the captivating views of Langtang Himal ranges. After catching a lunch at Nagthal, we will be welcomed by the friendly people of Thuman Village.""
column42: s:275:""Today we descend to Timure, a flatter sections of trails. Tibet is not far away from here. This day we continue our walk towards another appealing Tamang Village called Briddim. We stay overnight at a simple and comfortable homestay where all kinds of local foods are served.""
column44: s:203:""Just a 3-hours descend takes us to Syabrubesi. After a breakfast in Briddim we continue our walk and reach Syabrubesi for our lunch. During the spear time at Syabrubesi, we spend our spear time relaxing.""
column46: s:316:""On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and get ready to head towards Kathmandu. The bus ride will take around 7 hours through curvy roads of hilly terrain with couple of breaks in between for snacks and lunch. Tracing the same way back we reach Kathmandu and we transfer you back at the hotel.""
column48: s:171:""Today we say our final goodbye. Our representative will come to see you off at the airport. Hoping you had a pleasant and wonderful trekking experience we bid you goodbye.""

column1: 7166,"Naturalist Favorite- Makalu Base Camp Trek","Makalu(4600m) is the fifth highest mountain in the world which lies southeast of the Mt. Everest. It is rarely accessible trek in comparison to Annapurna and Everest Base Camp trek.

This trek is quiet with tranquil trails and is very suitable for the nature-loving trekkers who want to experience more remote Nepal and diverse landscapes with unparalleled views of some of the world's tallest mountains peaks.

This trekking initially starts with a Himalayan Flight to Tumlingtar. The trek goes ahead in warm, terraced farmland inhabited by Rai and Sherpa ethnic group of people. As the trails follow, we pass into the Barun Valley, granite cliffs and high cascading waterfalls. Makalu Barun National Pak is the eighth largest National Park in Nepal which has a stronghold of diverse rhododendron flowers and also the vulnerable species like Red Panda.

From the Makalu Base Camp, you will get the amazing views of Makalu Peak, Mount Everest, Lhotse, Chamlang, and Kanchenjunga.",,-00011130,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/?post_type=trip&p=7166,,,,,,,,,,,"a:6:{s:8:""og_title""

column1: 7265,"Light Trekking with Kids to Illam Tea Garden","Trekking to the Illam Tea Garden gives you the marvelous vibe of hiking in Nepal. As known as 'Queen of Hills' Illam hill town has an amazing landscape of sloped and lush green tea gardens, mountain views and holy sites. A serene walk into the tea garden of Illam offers many beautiful sightseeing spots, short hike towards the easy slopes through mountain streams and waterfalls. Illam might be an excellent gateway from your city life.

Illam is home to many valuable cash crops like cardamom, potato, ginger, red round chilly, broom grass, etc. So, it is commonly called one of the richest districts in Nepal. Not only this, but Illam also boasts its richness in terms of its cultural diversity and variations in landscapes. Lepcha, Brahmin, Gurung, Magar, Rai, Limbu, and Chettri tribes of people inhabit this area especially.",,20190410,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/light-trekking-with-kids-to-illam-tea-garden/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/31973824767_eaf7694a0b_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/3375559934_ed353ae446_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/3426873587_cb528e7874_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/3427685452_7ab235e258_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/6120992998_1ca1e8a8d4_z.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/8300002810_e3f959b14a_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/15227300893_e9817f5e0b_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/15844962381_123fc81065_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/15844966611_93680b601f_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/15844968451_a285f79d67_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/31973822207_f9dcd67fab_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/41534167045_164a5383b9_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/46190044534_41004285a1_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/46190046374_3100b7d7b9_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/46862820612_52ebb8f660_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/46914890601_0dfc150530_k.jpg,"31973824767_eaf7694a0b_k|3375559934_ed353ae446_b|3426873587_cb528e7874_b|3427685452_7ab235e258_b|6120992998_1ca1e8a8d4_z|8300002810_e3f959b14a_k|Illam column1: 7272,"Music & Trekking to Upper Mustang Tiji Festival Trek","Tiji Festival is a colorful festival celebrated in the Lo Manthang region of Upper Mustang (3840  m). This festival holds a significant place on the truest mountain people who follow Tibetan Buddhist culture. Tiji Festival is celebrated for three days every year at the beginning of the harvest season. This spring-renewal festival marks the celebration of the triumph of good over evil. In a local ritual, they celebrate this festival to chase away the demons.

During this festival, people gather together and express themselves in different ways with traditional colorful customs with hideous masks, dance, and music. They show the drama of deity winning over the demon believing that the demons are chased away from their place. They chant their prayers and remember their god. Even the monks wear their traditional customs and present themselves in vibrant colors
column2: red, yellow, blue and with their multicultural flags which makes the entire ambiance appealing and lively.

column1: Upper Mustang Tiji festival trek coincides with the combination of the dramatic Himalayan desert with the magnificent views of massive Dhaulagiri, Annapurna, and Nilgiri ranges at the backdrop. Trekking through the world's deepest gorge, Kaligandaki Gorge and high vibrant walls of Mustang villages, exploring the centuries back lifestyle of people add a significant cultural and geographical highlight.

This year the Tiji Festival will be celebrated on 30th, 31st May, and 1st June 2019. We offer a fixed departure for this trip. If you find this trip appealing, you may reserve with Osho World Adventure. We are committed to making your travel reliable, safe, comfortable, and affordable.",,20190409,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/music-and-trekking-upper-mustang-tiji-festival-trek-to-lo-manthang/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/34308120604_268f9c14df_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/545546528_6db05f052c_z.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/545862486_738097e773_z.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/545863662_ebb6532221_z.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/545903039_a41e4e8dc8_z.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/546129203_881cc3e115_z.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/566401777_0caa91657f_z.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/4106058060_5de8cef164_z.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/7249074942_458f2feb5e_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/7320303816_47ee06c4c2_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/14201286428_d331c00fcf_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/14201341660_13be521d4c_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/14376085251_06ef17528d_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/14376165941_3e39b64a60_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/14377978822_253efaed78_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/14378057802_d38b046b3d_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/14440064104_fba64bd6fd_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/14441181445_72611184c5_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/24616316168_14cc66e900_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/29409211245_10e54aa9e2_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/35011266712_bc42c384c7_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/35045356621_e5a08718b8_h.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content column9: s:52:""Music & Trekking to Upper Mustang Tiji Festival Trek""
column11: s:160:""Tiji Festival is a colorful festival celebrated in the Lo Manthang region of Upper Mustang (3840  m). This festival holds a significant place on the truest mou""

column3: Mysterious colorful and captivating Tiji Festival is the most important festival of true Mustangi people who follow Tibetan Buddhist culture.&lt
Observe the smiling and happy faces of people presenting themselves in vibrantly colored traditional customs, jewelleries, and flags.&lt
Spring-renewal festival which marks the celebration of the triumph of good over evil.&lt
Trek in the Himalayan desert and enjoy the picturesque views of 360-degree Annapurna and Dhaulagiri massif.&lt
Explore Ghar Gompa,  Lo- Gekar Gompa, and centuries-old monasteries and caves.&lt
Enjoy horse-riding in the Lo-Manthang(3840 m).&lt

column1: Two clients share one porter. We will supply you a trek duffel bag where you keep your heavy items and this bag is carried by the porter. You will need to bring your own daypack to be carried by you. In the daypack, you can put money, important documents, water bottle/bladder, camera, toiletries, sunscreen, notebook, etc. The weight limit for the porter is 30 kg or 66 pounds. 15 kg or 33 pounds for each client. So, we recommend you to pack as carefully as you can and not exceed the weight limit. You can leave your non-trekking stuff at the locker facility in the Kathmandu hotel.

column3: 4-season sleeping bag (We can provide one if you need it but has to be returned after the trek)&lt
Down jacket (Must have for mornings, nights and evenings, and for altitudes above 4,000 m
column4: We can provide it if you need one but has to be returned after the trek.)&lt

column3: Wool or synthetic hat that cover the ears&lt
Soft shell and hard shell trekking pants&lt

column1: (Please note our guide will carry the first-aid kit bag during the trek. However we still recommend you to bring your personalized first-aid kit as well.)

column3: Extra Strength Excedrin for altitude related headaches&lt
Ibuprofen for general aches and pains&lt
Immodium or Pepto Bismol capsules for upset stomach or diarrhea&lt
Diamox (commonly prescribed as Acetazolamide) 125 or 250mg tablets for altitude sickness&lt
Passport and extra passport photos (3 copies)&lt
Airline ticket (Please make a copy and leave one at our office in Kathmandu just in case if you need to change the date of your flight.)&lt
Durable wallet/pouch for travel documents, money &amp
Toiletry kit (Be sure to include toilet paper stored in a plastic bag, hand wipes, and liquid hand sanitizer, towel, soap, etc.)&lt
Favorite snack foods (No more than 2 pounds)&lt
Cameras (Memory cards, chargers and also batteries)&lt
Pee bottle for men and pee funnel for women&lt

column29: s:49:""Kathmandu Valley Sightseeing and Trek Preparation""
column43: s:39:""Lo-Manthang, First Day of Tiji Festival""

column59: s:46:""Drive back to Kathmandu from Pokhara (7-8 hrs)""
column64: s:198:""Our airport representative will be receiving you at Tribhuvan International Airport kathmandu (1,300 m/ 4264 ft). You will be then transferred to your respective hotel in our private tourist vehicle""
column66: s:241:""After a hearty breakfast, at 8.30 am your sightseeing trip will start. You will have a private vehicle and a professional tour guide at your disposal. Today we will visit Hindus and Buddhists sites, Pashupatinath Temple and Boudhanath Stupa.""
column68: s:451:""On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and head towards tourist Bus Park at Thamel and board a tourist bus to Pokhara (827 m/ 2700 ft). The bus ride will take around 7 hours through curvy roads of hilly terrain with a couple of breaks in between for snacks and lunch. The drive to Pokhara on one of the major highways is exhilarating with beautiful views of never leaving tributaries, lush green hills, and roadside settlements.""
column70: s:300:""An appealing drive to Kagbeni starts after a delicious breakfast in Pokhara. The journey to the starting point of Mustang passes through the beautiful landscapes of kagbeni. The Kagbeni village is situated at the bank of rushing Kaligandaki river. Kagbeni is the main entrance gate for Upper Mustang.""
column72: s:369:""Our trek to Chele begins from Kagbeni through the east bank of Kali Gandaki river. The landscapes follow through uphill and downhill sandy trails to Tangbe Village, which offers the finest view of Nilgiri peak. Whitewashed houses, apple orchards along the way leads us to Chhusang Village and finally cross the Kali Gandaki Valley to Chele. Overnight, we stay at Chele.""
column74: s:326:""An early morning hike towards Geling along steep treeless terrain at the altitude of 3540m gives you the vibe of trekking through the desert. Long gradual descend toward the Samar Village into a large gorge, streams, and ridge takes us to the Shyagmochen. Furtherly, we descend to Geling village. Overnight, we stay at Geling.""
column76: s:270:""Today, we continue our trip towards the longest Mani walls in  Mustang. The trail follows a suspension bridge over Tangmar Chu river and a gentle NYI La Pass. We head towards a Dzong and red Gompa slowly descending towards Charang village. Overnight, we stay at Charang.""
column78: s:241:""From Charang village we gently climb up to visit the oldest Gompa of Nepal
column79: Lo-Gekar Gompa. Then, we continue our trail towards the plateau of Lo-Manthang enjoying the walled city of Lo. Lo- Manthang is the capital of this Himalayan Kingdom.""
column81: s:435:""30th May 2019. Mark your calendar! Today is the first day of Tiji Festival. The celebration of this ceremony lit-up with the lively ambiance as the people gather together in the vibrantly colored traditional dresses and they showcase their own way of dancing style. Not only this, tug-of-war and horse racing are the major attractions of this day. We spend this day observing this unique celebration. Overnight, we stay at Lo-Manthang.""
column83: s:310:""Tibetan monks perform unique dance and dramas to chase away the hungry demons from their villages. Many people from different regions of Mustang will be involved in this celebration. After this, we will walk around to explore the other appealing villages around Lo- Manthang. Overnight, we stay at Lo-Manthang.""
column85: s:371:""Today is the last day of Tiji Festival. We will hike around the Namgyal Gompa (3700 m) which lies on a hilltop, which is also an important monastery. Then, we continue to explore the Tingkhar village situated to the northwest of Lo-Manthang. After this, we come back at Lo-Manthang and watch out the final moment of celebration of Tiji Festival. Overnight at Lo-Manthang.""
column87: s:272:""Today, we climb up to the highest point of our trek to Chogo La, at an elevation of 4210m. We head to explore Lo Gekar and continue to descend Ghar Gompa. Then, we walk through the alpine meadows and steep down to Drakmar. Overnight at a comfortable guesthouse in Drakmar.""
column89: s:212:""We head towards the stone walls pass and the small fields of Drakmar descending through the lower part of Ghami and Jaite. Then, finally, descend to Tama Gau to Shyangmochen. Overnight, we stay at the guesthouse.""
column91: s:107:""Today, we hike down to Chhusang Village passing by an alternative route to Samar by visiting Ranchung Cave.""
column93: s:136:""Today, we complete the route of Upper Mustang and head towards the Jomsom through the Lower Mustang(Kagbeni). We stay at Jomsom tonight.""
column95: s:65:""We head towards Pokhara by a scenic Himalayan flight from Jomsom.""
column97: s:318:""On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and get ready to head towards Kathmandu. The bus ride will take around 7 hours through curvy roads of hilly terrain with a couple of breaks in between for snacks and lunch. Tracing the same way back we reach Kathmandu and we transfer you back at the hotel.""
column99: s:171:""Today we say our final goodbye. Our representative will come to see you off at the airport. Hoping you had a pleasant and wonderful trekking experience we bid you goodbye.""

column1: 7407,"Lower Dolpo Trekking to Shey Phoksundo Lake","Lower Dolpo Trek offers a spectacular trail through a mix of forest and beautiful traditional villages in the shadow of rain located behind Dhaulagiri range. This range is highly populated yet provides overwhelming insight into the lives of people out there. The people in this area are fond of Buddhist beliefs and strongly follows it. This is also one of the few areas where the Pre-Buddhist Bon Po religion is still practiced, which is disappeared even from Tibet in the 9th century.

In this trek, we will be passing two high regions Numa la(5190 m), Baga la (5070), and then we reach to explore the elegance of Shey-Phoksundo (3611.5 m), which is an alpine freshwater Oligotrophic lake. It is the deepest and second large lake in Nepal which lies in the periphery of Shey-Phokshundo National Park. Trekking through this area you will encounter some of the overwhelming species of animals such as Blue sheep, Musk deer, Snow leopard, Ghoral, Himalayan tahr and many more.

column1: (Please note our guide will carry the first-aid kit bag during the trek. However we still recommend you to bring your personalized first-aid kit as well.)

column3: Extra Strength Excedrin for altitude related headaches&lt
Ibuprofen for general aches and pains&lt
Immodium or Pepto Bismol capsules for upset stomach or diarrhea&lt
Diamox (commonly prescribed as Acetazolamide) 125 or 250mg tablets for altitude sickness&lt
Passport and extra passport photos (3 copies)&lt
Airline ticket (Please make a copy and leave one at our office in Kathmandu just in case if you need to change the date of your flight.)&lt
Durable wallet/pouch for travel documents, money &amp
Toiletry kit (Be sure to include toilet paper stored in a plastic bag, hand wipes, and liquid hand sanitizer, towel, soap, etc.)&lt
Favorite snack foods (No more than 2 pounds)&lt
Cameras (Memory cards, chargers and also batteries)&lt
Pee bottle for men and pee funnel for women&lt

column52: s:328:""After a delicious breakfast at 08:30 am your trip for sightseeing will start here you will have a private vehicle &amp
column53: professional tourist guide at your disposal. Today we will be visiting religious sites (Buddhist, Hindu) Temple of Pashupatinath &amp
column54: Bauddha stupa respectively. In the evening, we will prepare for our trip.""
column56: s:98:""Flight from Kathmandu to Nepalgunj (45 minutes) and overnight stay Nepalgunj in 2 or 3-star hotel.""
column58: s:167:""Take Flight from Nepalgunj to Juphal (35mins), 3.5 hours walk to Dunai. Lunch at Dunai, visit central gompa and local cultue. Overnight stay at Dunai in a tented camp.""
column60: s:533:""After breakfast, our trek continues along the south bank of the river heading upstream on a good trail, deep gorges, hanging bridges and isolated villages. A tremendous gorge with pine trees and path built about 7 meters above the river. The colorful terraced field of Tarakot greets us eventually. Tarakot is an old fortress town built by the local people as Dzong or fort. The village stands on a hillock to the south of Bheri River at one time supervised collection of tolls for the trading caravans. Overnight in Tarakot at Camp.""
column62: s:375:""We resume our walk following the Tarap chu river upstream, crossing a suspension bridge to open lunch spot.T he famed Sandul Gompa lies farther east from Tarakot and at the junction of Barbung Khola and Tarup Chu River. The path leads through the farm terraces and rural villages.  After a few ups and downs, finally, encounter river bed to reach our overnight camp at Laini.""
column64: s:483:""After breakfast, we continue walking up to the gorge of the Tarap River, rising high above on a trail built out from steep slopes. The walk is quite exciting as the valley becomes narrow gorge that in some places you can jump from one side to another and then we descend to Chyugur Khola. Sometimes the path vanishes for a while, making our own path across stone slabs fitted on logs in between the walls which act as a bridge. This night we will be staying at Nawarpani at the Camp.""
column66: s:238:""Trek to Dho Tarap from Nawarpani, 7-8 hours walk and we take lunch at Sisaul. The side trip to Sipchowk which is one of the highest settlement in the world at the elevation of 4200m from sea level. Stay overnight at Dho Tarap tented camp.""
column68: s:691:""We spend a rest day in Do Tarap for gradually getting used to the altitude. Explore villages, monasteries and enjoy the surrounding breathtaking views. Make friends with the locals who have hardly seen westerners. The Dolpo people wear homespun clothing that is sometimes dyed maroon and they favor Tibetan style combat or dhocha (boots with upturned toes) for footwear. Both men and women often wear religious amulets and strings of coral, amber, and turquoise. The people of the region are both Bön Po and Nyingmapa of Buddhist sect. The Buddhist Gompa is nearby to the camp while the Bön Gompa (pre-Buddhist) is about half an hour's walk. Then we stay Overnight in Do Tarap at the Camp.""
column70: s:723:""After a wonderful time at Do Tarap, our journey continues towards upper Tarap valley. The walks follow in this plain valley with patches of lush verdant grass on both sides of the river, which is completely different from other parts of Inner Dolpo. The trek on this pleasant track leads by the Tarap Chu upstream all the way. Tarap is certainly a dream valley with vast plains in high mountains.  A few hours' good walks take us to the village of Tokyu, it has a monastery belonging to the Chiba sect. After visit this village, our walk continues further up this valley climbing up the rough track for almost another three hours to reach our overnight camp beneath the Numa-la.

column1: Overnight in Numa La Base Camp at the camp.""
column3: s:473:""This is one of the long and difficult days during the trek. After breakfast, our journey continues to getaway Numa La pass at 5,190m. The tracks lead to steep climb all the way to the top ridge of Numa la with great views of the surrounding landscapes. An incredible panoramic view of the barren mountains of Dolpo up to the Dhaulagiri (8167m).  After getting to the top of Numa La, we will descend to camp at Pelung Tang

column2: Overnight stay in Baga La Phedi at the Camp.""
column4: s:354:""After breakfast, our morning trek starts with a steep climb to reach the ridge top of Baga-la at 5,070m which offers fantastic views of the surrounding landscapes and of the distant snow-capped peaks of Kanjirowa Himal range. After a glorious moment at the pass, almost three hours of the downhill walk takes to the Dajok Tang for overnight at tent camp.""
column6: s:295:""Our trek starts through the pine forest, on leaving the forest behind the country and the vegetation changes for pasture field and alpine shrubs most of the way to Ringmo on the gradual slopes with few ups and downs as we reach our final destination at Ringmo. Here we stay overnight at campsite""
column8: s:735:""A rest and exploration day! We sit right on the shore of the spectacular Phoksundo Lake: remember the harrowing scene in 'Himalaya' when Thinley's yak caravan attempted the 'Devil's Trail'. Yak caravans will be heading in and out of Ringmo on their way north towards the border of Tibet, and our most northerly destinations, Saldang and Thinje. This is the pleasant day free from the hassle of packing and chance to visit the nearby Tibetan Buddhist monastery is well worth a visit, as is the village of Ringmo. A walk part way around the lake is also very enjoyable and relaxing. This is a great day exploring the lake areas and the crystal serene Lake of Shey- Phoksundo with great views.

column1: Overnight in Ringmo Village at the campsite""
column3: s:329:""Today’s trek leads downhill to Chepka. From Chepka, the trail follows the massive overhanging rock. We find many important medicinal minerals which are believed to cure almost anything in this area. The route then passes through the villages, before climbing to Shyangta.

column1: We will be staying this night in Shyangta at the Camp.""
column3: s:440:""Following the trail gently sloping upwards, we march towards Juphal via Sulighat. We meet tall birch trees on our way. From atop the ridge, we can have the most spectacular views of the mountain and Juphal below. Utmost caution is required while trekking along this trail. After reaching Juphal, we can spend our afternoon exploring the busy market town or simply pursuing whatever we feel like.

column1: We spend Overnight in Juphal at the Camp.""
column3: s:468:""We take a flight from Juphal to Nepalgunj. On reaching Nepalgunj, we return to Kathmandu on the next available flight. Upon arrival in Kathmandu, you will be transferred to your hotel. There is nothing to do but trade emails with travel companions and organize the photos. You can spend the evening leisurely, perhaps catch up on some last minute shopping and celebrate dinner together with Osho adventure Trekking staffs.

column1: Overnight in Kathmandu dom himalaya Hotel""
