column44: >","Lower Dolpo Trek offers a spectacular trail through a mix of forest and beautiful traditional villages in the shadow of rain located behind Dhaulagiri range. This range is highly populated yet provides overwhelming insight into the lives of people out there. The people in this area are fond of...","Trek through the hidden valleyys of Lower Dolpo and explore the turquoise waters of Shey Phoksundo Lake, coniferous forests and amazing snow capped mountains.",,"a:21:{i:0

column1: 7541,"Sirubari Village Homestay Trek","Sirubari Village holds a beautiful settlement of Gurung community at Syangja district of Nepal, which is just a few hours drive from Pokhara. This village is amazingly blended with distinct and prosperous traditions with the rich in their hospitality and kindness.

An easy drive from Pokhara through the diverse landscapes, green ridges, and vibrant flowers leads us to Syangja district from where we take a 3-hours steep walk to Sirubari Village. Living with the typical Nepalese people for 3 days aims to give you the best insight into Nepalese culture and tradition where you can observe the day-to-day life of them. The accommodation in the village is simple and comfortable.

This tour can be done all-the-year-around. The climate remains as pleasant as the ever friendly, warm welcoming and cheerful behavior of the inhabitants. Enjoy the cultural show presented by this community, which makes Sirubari Village Homestay truly mesmerizing and unforgettable.

column3: Living with typical Gurung tribe at Sirubari gives you the truest essence of their hospitality, culturally rich and friendly people.&lt
Spectacular Himalayan sunrise view of Mt. Annapurna and Dhaulagiri ranges from Dahare Hills.&lt
The village is enriched with lush green forests fully covered with different species of flowers like maple, oak, orchids, etc.&lt
Live with typical Nepalese people and observe their day-to-day activities.&lt

column19: s:73:""Drive to Syangja district and trek to Sirubari. Welcome Lunch at Sirubari""
column21: s:69:""Sunrise Tour to Dahare Hills. Lunch with Local Family and Hike around""
column23: s:33:""Hike to Maidan Kharka and Thumro.""
column25: s:74:""Farewell at Village Gompa. Depart Pokhara through Seti Dobhan and Naudanda""
column32: s:201:""Our representative will meet you at your arrival at the Airport and transfer you to the Hotel. An information session about the program will be conducted by our Tour Guide. Overnight stay in the Hotel.""
column34: s:434:""On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and head towards tourist Bus Park at Thamel and board a tourist bus to Pokhara. The bus ride will take around 7 hours through curvy roads of hilly terrain with a couple of breaks in between for snacks and lunch. The drive to Pokhara on one of the major highways is exhilarating with beautiful views of never leaving tributaries, lush green hills, and roadside settlements.""
column36: s:343:""We take our ride from the city of lakes towards the Syangja district crossing lush green forests with blankets folds of vibrant flowers and rushing Ghatte Khola (river). You will be warmly welcomed by the Gurung people of Sirubari Village with a delicious Danau Lunch. Overnight we stay at Sirubari Homestay. Lunch, Breakfast, Dinner included.""
column38: s:363:""An early morning hike to Dahare viewpoint offers us the pleasant Himalayan sunrise view of Annapurna and Dhaulagiri ranges. We come down and take a local lunch (dal bhat) with a local family. After lunch, we hike around the local community to observe the day-to-day lifestyle of local people. Overnight at Sirubari Homestay. Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner included.""
column40: s:466:""Today, we again wake up early to catch an amazing sunrise view from Maidan Kharka and Thumro Danda. From here, we can also observe the beautiful Himalayan sunrise view with blanket folds of floras and faunas residing at the hillside. We hike down to Sirubari Village and have lunch with local family. We take a rest for a while and join a cultural show presented by local Gurung tribe of people. Overnight at Sirubari Homestay. Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner included.""
column42: s:111:""Today, we drive back to Pokhara from Sirubari Village through Gorge watching beautiful settlements at Naudanda.""
column44: s:318:""On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and get ready to head towards Kathmandu. The bus ride will take around 7 hours through curvy roads of hilly terrain with a couple of breaks in between for snacks and lunch. Tracing the same way back we reach Kathmandu and we transfer you back at the hotel.""
column46: s:171:""Today we say our final goodbye. Our representative will come to see you off at the airport. Hoping you had a pleasant and wonderful trekking experience we bid you goodbye.""

column81: Today, we drive back to Pokhara from Sirubari Village through Gorge watching beautiful settlements at Naudanda.&lt
column87: On this day we have our breakfast by 6:00 a.m. in the morning and get ready to head towards Kathmandu. column1: 7563,"Chitlang Village Homestay Trek","Chitlang is completely an exotic and rare destination for many visitors which is culturally richer by the settlements of ancient Newar, Tamang, and Khas tribes of people. It lies towards the northern part of Kathmandu valley.

Chitlang is just 27 km away from Kathmandu Valley, which takes around 2-3 hours drive in local transportation. This tour offers you to observe the culture of friendly Tamang people, their cultures and traditions, and day-to-day lifestyle. As you approach the village, you will be invited to live with one of the families. There, you will be warmly welcomed by with their special dish and greetings. The food will be delicious. You will be no different than a member of the same family. You will be truly amazed by the hospitality of the inhabitants. The accommodation will be simple and comfortable with clean toilet facilities.

Walk with your family wherever they go and watch out the day-to-day activity of people living inside the community like tilling the fields, cutting the grasses, tending the animals, going school with children and sitting at the sun sharing your lifestyle and compare between. You will be truly overwhelmed by the warm wishes and greetings at your farewell.

column1: 7587,"Balthali Village Homestay Trek","Balthali is a small, sleepy yet admiring village which rests at the junction of Roshi and Ladku Khola river. It stands on the plateau which is just beyond Khopasi, 40km away from Kathmandu.

Balthali is one of the highest points in the Mahabharat range. We can reach the resort after an hour’s walk from Khopasi, till where we can drive. If you walk from Panauti, it will take about two hours to reach Balthali. There is a beautiful resort in Balthali from you can observe great mountain views in the north attractive spans of the Terai plains in the south. This appealing village is surrounded by lush green hills and layered rice terrains.

Balthali is a place where you can mainly find Newar tribes of people who have kept their traditions and way of life for several generations. You can live here with a completely local family where you will have an opportunity to observe their day-to-day activities and share moments with them.
There are numbers of excellent short and long hikes inside Panauti Valley that takes you to explore many religious sites such as NamoBuddha, Indreshwar Mahadev and Brahmayani, etc.

column1: 7588,"Kakani Village Homestay Trek","Kakani Village is nation-widely famous for bird watching, trout fish-farming and for its amazing Himalayan view. Just an hour scenic drive towards the north of Kathmandu Valley takes us to Kakani Village, which is situated at an altitude of 2073m.

Kakani Village is truly an ideal place to explore the typical Nepali village lifestyle, people and culture. During the spring season, the forests at the hillside will be covered by vibrant colors of rhododendron flowers, maple, orchids, and appealing coniferous pine forests. The magnificent views of mountain ranges stretching from Annapurna to Everest, via Ganesh Himal, Manaslu, Gaurishankar and Dorje Lakpa at the northern highlands makes this place absolutely a precious treasure to gaze over the Himalayan sunrise and sunset view from Kakani Hill tower.
The sense of visiting is place is slower and quieter devoid of distractions. And if you love strawberries, Kakani is the right choice for you. Every year Kakani produces 250,000 kg of strawberries.

column1: 7601,"Ghale Gaun Village Homestay","Ghale Gaun is a serene and scenic tourist destination at an elevation of 2,100m.  Situated at the foot of Lamjung Himal (6932m), Ghale Gaun is an idyllic place where you will experience a gusting of cold snowy air, tenacious snow-covered mountains, rugged day-hiking trails, easy on the eye pasture land, aromatic flowers in the vicinity of Annapurna.

Gurung tribes of people inhabit this place who are highly rich in their generosity and hospitality. It is a model village to promoting the unique village tourism practicing community-based liberality. Everything served as your food during your is truly organic and fresh.

Gurung people have their own culture, tradition, dress, and language, which they follow during their birth, wedding, and death ceremonies. During these ceremonies, they perform old cultural folk dances like Jhyaure, Serka, Dohari, Gantu, and Ghandu accompanied by various musical instruments and dancers in traditional dress. People in this village are mostly involved in agriculture and service. They also do sheep and goat farming and use their wools to make bags, towels, shawls and many more.",,20190416,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/ghale-gaun-village-homestay/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/44060997110_fc310cf14a_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/4114836352_6a7955a796_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/6605561245_ded1cf6e95_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/6605890479_8e58456768_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/6751320375_8b266390f7_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/9081086131_c40c466a57_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/9081101525_77260b96c0_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/15144946973_90ca4f1724_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/17178628029_80925bc447_h.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/26380740050_1abcb24d28_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/26588192641_ab9697d223_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/28296806189_1836d23f20_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/33591318081_c492fd6edb_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/34462752500_0a210a083e_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/40043882292_5090b998d3_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/8936191961_718b4d6f6c_o.jpg,"Annapurna column28: s:348:""We take an early drive from Kathmandu to Besisahar from the bus park. You will be picked from your hotel in Kathmandu for the tour. column30: s:870:""The route up to Ghale Gaun is mostly gentle uphill. Hike slowly, leaving the Besisahar behind, you will be offered with wonderful landscapes and some mountain views along the way.  The lunch place will be along the way in a local restaurant with the local foods. Then we head to Ghale gau where you will be welcomed by the homestay community on their unique way. We will spend some time exploring the local village and observe the local lives then we hike up to the view tower for the Himalayan sunset view.  The entire village looks just stunning from the tower. After the sunset, get back to homestay. Now, we spend some of our time camp firings and entertaining with local music and instruments.  After dinner, we join the cultural program to watch local ghatu Dance, Krishna Charitra, and more.  Overnight at Ghalegau homestay. Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner included.""
column32: s:148:""Today, after your authentic local breakfast, they will farewell you in a truly unique way. After some time, we take the same way drive to Kathmandu.""

column1: 7609,"Chepang Village Homestay Hill Trek","Chepang is one of the marginalized ethnic groups of people residing in the north-central region of Nepal who possesses their own culture, tradition, and language. They are totally untouched by modernization that they are still completely away from present society.

This tour takes you to the unexplored hillside of Dhading and Chitwan districts of Nepal through high waterfalls, valleys, dramatic landscapes, and panoramic mountain views. In this homestay tour, we will experience the nomadic lifestyle of the indigenous Chepang communities who are rich in their own language and tradition which is completely different from the rest of the Nepalese society. Due to this distinct lifestyle and remoteness, they fall under the marginalized group of people in Nepal.

This trail is newly opened. We have designed this concept so as to raise the economic status of Chepang tribes of Cotton Tree in Chitwan village||||???????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????|||The Chepangs is an ethnic group which used to be nomadic. Only recently have the settled and their settlements are high up in the mountains. Only a few years ago they did not have any running water and had to bring up water from below but with the help pf Restless Development and their partner NGO Prayash Nepal they now have running clean water from springs diverted into resovoirs and the connected to taps inther settlement. This not only give them clean water to drink, it also improve hygiene dramatiaclly and improve health and it saves precious time for the women who now spend the 4 hours it used to take getting water growing healhty vegetables.||||||||||",|||||||||||||||||,|||||||||||||||||,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/15672774714_d4769c4bbc_k.jpg,,"Western &amp

column3: Observe the nomadic lifestyle of marginalized Chepang people.&lt
Enjoy the captivating panoramic views of Mt. Manaslu, Annapurna throughout your hiking route.&lt
High waterfalls, the herd of cattle grazing over the green pastures in the hills and Terai.&lt
Learn their unique language and observe their distinct way of living life, dressing customs, traditions and many more.&lt
Contribute to the economic status of Chepang people.&lt
Note: You can also combine this trip with Jungle Safari (Chitwan National Park) and River Rafting (Trishuli River) if time favors.&lt
column19: s:58:""Drive to Hungdu Khola and trek to Hattibang (1410m) 7-8hrs""
column30: s:170:""Our airport representative will be receiving you at Tribhuvan International Airport. You will be then transferred to your respective hotel in our private tourist vehicle.""
column32: s:298:""We take an early morning drive to Hungdu Khola through the rushing serpentine river and after that, we trek to Hattibang for about 4 hours through the dense forests, diverse landscapes, and excellent paddy fields. Overnight we stay at a homestay at Hattibang. Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner included.""
column34: s:533:""Jyandala is a village situated at an altitude of 1600m. On the way, you will observe the surprising Chepang settlements at Juatesh, Changa, and Dinglang with a beautiful panoramic view of Annapurna and Ganesh Himal ranges at the backdrop. Jyandala village is mainly famous for hospitality and generosity. This place offers one of the finest views of the western Himalayas such as Dhaulagiri, Rolwaling, Gaurishanker, Langtang, etc. During the evening, you can also learn to cook Nepal's all-time favorite traditional dish, Dal bhaat.""
column36: s:390:""We continue our trek towards Shaktikhor. Today we will pass through the Kolar Village, continue along the ridgeline towards the Shakti Khola. Upon arriving Shaktikhor, we visit the Chepang Museum, waterfalls and caves. In the evening, we will have an opportunity to watch the cultural show of Chepang people. Overnight at local homestay at Shaktikhor. Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner included.""
column38: s:101:""With all the beautiful memories and a lifetime experience, we take a drive from Chitwan to Kathmandu.""
column40: s:186:""We bid goodbye. Then, you will be transferred to the International Port, Kathmandu. We wish all the best. Looking forward to welcoming you as our guest again sometime in the near future.""

column1: 7755,"Nepal Buddhist Pilgrimage Tour","The birthplace of Lord Buddha, Lumbini is a sacred place for Buddhists from all over the world, standing on an equal footing with holy places sacred to other world religions. The sacred garden where Buddha was born converges into the Ashoka pillar, which carries an inscription identifying the birth spot where we can see the seven footsteps of the Budhha.

Maya Devi Temple is located close to the Ashoka pillar, which is named after his mother Mayadevi. The statue of Maya Devi is made out of the stone which is believed to be 2000 years old. To the south of Maya Devi Temple, there is Puskar pond where Maya Devi took a bath before giving birth to Buddha. Lord Buddha is also believed to get a purifying bath in the same pond.

The whole area of Lumbini is considered as a garden. Many appealing monasteries have been built through the help of different countries such as Thailand, Srilanka, and Japan. It is considered as the International Centre for the Buddhist pilgrimage.

The Lumbini Museum has a large collection of the Mauryan and Kushana coins, religious manuscripts, terracotta fragments, stones, and metal sculptures. Also on display is an extensive collection of stamps from various countries depicting Lumbini and Buddha.",,20190418,trip,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/trip/nepal-buddhist-pilgrimage-tour/,http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/32432734131_fe1de74d22_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/4347523434_ce5e5a6406_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/5133302273_69634932a1_b-1.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/7064389319_c1793eafe7_h.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/7857858616_e422e3f979_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/8589161206_308fbd7bc5_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/8636294121_b5850284b6_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/8674175812_ff7b2ff0f5_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/9238107702_fdf7c3948f_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/9458059719_bcbc30a9c6_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/9623976942_9b979eab72_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/9638908783_e0b516c8a3_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/9645508970_228810480a_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/10360206874_e5aa603882_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/13652310783_9cb15f9cab_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/13982909659_adb49a736b_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/14095744083_50c3cd0aa7_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/14210148991_3e35e07e99_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/24126858148_dfae4242bc_k.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/26513974989_5f692ef6ed_b.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/27488856621_70a8d00be2_o.jpg|http://trekkingtopnepal.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/38105882516_52c53e4d32_k.jpg,"32432734131_fe1de74d22_b|4347523434_ce5e5a6406_b|5133302273_69634932a1_b column17: s:38:""Fly to Bhairahawa and drive to Lumbini""
column19: s:41:""Explore Lumbini and fly back to Kathmandu""
column28: s:357:""Arriving Kathmandu from your homeport, where Osho world Adventure representative meets you at the airport, transfers you to the hotel nearby Thamel as per your requirement. Great food from all over the world, fabulous shopping and Durbar square with its several temples and markets are nearby Thamel. Overnight at a standard 3-star Boutique Hotel in Thamel.""
column30: s:623:""One of the most important and highest holy places known as Namo Buddha is located at the top of the hill nearby Kathmandu which takes about 2 ½ hour drive from Kathmandu. One of the most important Buddhist pilgrimage sites in Nepal and one of the holiest in the world is believed to be the place where the Buddha, in a previous life as a prince, gave his body to a famished tigress and her cubs. Namo Buddha is known as ‘Takmo Lu Jin’, among Tibetans and people of the Himalayan region, which literally means ‘Tigress body generosity’. Back to Kathmandu and overnight at a standard 3-star Boutique Hotel in Thamel.""
column32: s:609:""After breakfast, we will fly to Bhairahawa then drive to Lumbini and then we visit the lumbini temple. Lumbini, the traditional birthplace of the founder of Buddhism renown as  Gautama Buddha, lies in the foothills of the Himalayas in Nepal. The site is a large garden with a grove of pipal trees. The area around Lumbini is entirely Hindu, but many Buddhist temples and shrines from various nations are scattered around the holy site itself. The modern temple consists mainly of a simple white building that protects ancient ruins, with the exact spot of the Buddha's birth identified. Overnight at a hotel.""
column34: s:245:""Today, we roam around the stupa and Mayadevi Temple, Ashoka pillar and see the footsteps of the Lord Budhha. We spend some time shopping, buying souvenirs. After lunch, we fly back to Kathmandu. Overnight at a 3-star Boutique Hotel in Kathmandu.""
column36: s:616:""Drive for around an hour and a half to Kopan monastery. Just north of the ancient Buddhist town of Boudhanath is the Kopan hill, rising up out of the terraced fields of the Kathmandu valley and visible for miles. Dominated by a magnificent Bodhi tree, it was once the home of the astrologer to the king of Nepal. It was to this hill that these lamas came with their first Western students in 1969. Kopan is a thriving monastery of 360 monks, mainly from Nepal and Tibet, and a spiritual oasis for hundreds of visitors yearly from around the world. Back to Kathmandu and overnight at a standard 3-star Boutique Hotel.""
column38: s:679:""This meditation centre, with a meditation hall, Buddhist library, bookshop, Thangka gallery and a vegetarian garden café, provides you with a peaceful retreat in the midst of this ancient busy city. We strive to serve your needs according to Buddhist ethics and principles. The Himalayan Buddhist Meditation Centre (HBMC) for Mahayana Buddhist studies was founded in 1982 by the late Lama Thubten Yeshe and Lama Thubten Zopa Rinpoche as an urban centre for meditation, study and spiritual practice. HBMC is run under the spiritual guidance of Kyabje Lama Thubten Zopa Rinpoche and is the Kathmandu city centre of the Foundation for the Preservation of the Mahayana Tradition. ""
column40: s:171:""Today we say our final goodbye. Our representative will come to see you off at the airport. Hoping you had a pleasant and wonderful trekking experience we bid you goodbye.""
